title: The Pink Shell's Sister Property!
review: we have stayed her twice in the last 2 marches.  it is clean and affordable, a little down the road from the crowds so a little quieter. BUT the best part is you can use the ammenities at the Pink Shell, by far our favorite location/resort in Ft Myers. and the Sandpiper is about half the cost!

title: Best Beachside Vacation Ever!
review: We were first-time guests at the Sandpiper Resort. Everything was absolutely PERFECT. Great location, great staff, wonderful accommodations!  We watched dolphins from our balcony every morning! Halfway between Times Square and Lovers Key, the location was as ideal as you could ask for.   The only disappointment we had was that we had to leave. We'll be back!

title: Great for shelling
review: Very accommodating staff. Away from the biggest hotels so beach is very good for walking and shelling and playing. Short drive to restaurants, groceries, shopping. Downtown area is quaint and good for shopping.

title: fabulous
review: It was just great.  No problems, room was great  Ocean view balcony great.  Staff was so helpful.  Water and bag in the room was so, so different.  Never experienced that before.  Would for sure stay there again.

title: ANNIVERSARY
review: Great location. No frills. Right on the beach. Publix down the road and pier a few mins drive away. Pools were great. Construction on the main road makes getting in the property a little difficult but nothing to worry about. Very few parking spots. 1 space per room. Lights off at sunset. Will return! Loved the kitchen - no oven but everything else needed. Absolutely breathtaking sunsets!!!!!

title: Wonderful as always
review: Very friendly staff that try to accommodate any requests. Clean rooms and well kept grounds. Pool area very nice that over look the Gulf! Gorgeous views from beach front rooms with really big private balconies.

title: Wonderful Stay
review: Sandpiper was just what we were looking for! We loved everything from the staff to room, beach & pool. Very quiet even with some road construction going on out front. Not hotel fault. We will be back!

title: Nice place.
review: Overpriced for what it is.  It is a nice Gulf-side old-ish motel with a passable small-ish pool.  Great access to beach.  Beachfront room very nice. Great sunsets.  Kitchen and bathroom very nice.  Beds very good.  TV good.  Place kept neat.  BBQ's are nice.  Small, intimate property.  No one very friendly.  So many languages heard around pool.  Nothing too special.  Just a place to lie head down and use as base.

title: Never Again!!
review: The Sandpiper was deceptive with the amount we would be charged per night and at checkout time we discovered we were overcharged  by about $40.00. The amount of overcharge is one thing, the way the office manager handled this was poor.

title: Vacation Days
review: Nice place excellent location great service. Staff  friendless was good. All amenities were excellent. Room condition was excellent. The beach was great. the location to all surroundings areas was perfect.

title: Below average
review: The value was not very good for this hotel and the mattress was horrible. The young lady at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Not much to do at this hotel and everything was a drive away. The late night check-in was very easy.

title: leisure stay
review: we didn't have housekeeping for 2 days and nothing was done for compensation. this is my third time staying here and was a bit disappointed as we try and come to this property yearly. next visit we will try another property

title: Wish we could have stayed longer.
review: Loved it! Room had a beautiful view and was very clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful.Would definitely recommend the Sandpiper Resort for anyone wanting a Fort Myers vacation. The only downfall was they were doing some road construction in front of the resort and along the roadway along Estero Blvd but that was no fault of the resort.  Overall experience was excellent!

title: Gorgeous beach!
review: Wonderful hotel. Very spacious rooms. Would stay there again. And the beach, just gorgeous. Just a short drive to some wonderful restaurants. You won’t be disappointed. The bed was so comfy, we slept great. We did not utilize the kitchenette but it is plenty big to eat in if you want.

title: Very Nice Hotel enjoyed the stay
review: We loved our ocean front room with a balcony and down the steps to the pool and ocean. Nice kitchenette with full refrigerator, dining table and sofa. We went back and forth to Sanibel Island about a 15 min. drive so nice location.

title: Pleasure
review: Awesome place/will book again! Rooms are spotless/pool area was spotless as well. Staff was pleasant and helpful if needed. Beach area was very well kept. Will/would recommend the Sandpiper Gulf to everyone!!

title: Worth every penny
review: Rooms overlooking the Gulf, clean, great pools (especially the adult only pool!), and literally only a few steps until your toes are in the sand on the beach. Beach chair rental is right by the Sandpiper as well so no extensive walking to rent chairs or umbrellas. Plus a great discount for staying at the Sandpiper!

title: Location! Location!! Location!!!
review: We have been staying at The Sandpiper ever since hurricane Charley destroyed The Tropical Inn in    2004!! We searched the island & thankfully we found The Sandpiper & have stayed there almost every year since 2005!! We have brought & told several family members who now come down to The Sandpiper almost yearly too!! It is comfortable for couples or families!! The location of the pool, beach & Gulf is the perfect proximity!!  A few improvements are painting building & rooms. Installing a ceiling fan over the bed. An update of the kitchen is needed & our little sofa was ripped in several spots!  Hoping these updates are done as we want to come back w our families & friends as well as with just my husband & I!! We would like to come down from NY/NJ approx 2 times a year!! Keeping…

title: Ground Floor
review: Was told when I made reservations we had ground floor. My friend and I both have bad knees and can't do stairs very well. Had a hard time walking up the steps out front just to check in. They put us on the third floor....there was no way we could climb those stairs. Finally the put us on the 2nd floor which was a little better but still had to get up the stairs. It's usually my favorite place to stay on the beach but next time I will not book it unless they put it in writing that it's a first floor beach view unit.

title: 2 stars
review: Jackie” will do anything to sell a room at this place! After reading some reviews about renovations (and water shortages) we called and asked specifically if the renovations were still going on. We were told “Renovations? Here? No, nothing is going on, just some road work but nothing on our property”. (Flat our LIE!) We asked for a ground floor room and decided to book it over the phone.  Got to the hotel, exhausted, checked in and were told no ground floor rooms were available but check back in the morning. 😞 Got to the room to find hair in the shower, on the floor, and bed spread. 🤢 Asked for a ground floor room the next morning to be told there was no way to move us because they ARE UNDER RENOVATIONS and one whole building was closed.  The pros: 2 stars for the clean pool…

title: Not a resort.
review: The only thing good about the Sandpiper hotel is the location.  A little overpriced for a hotel with no bar/restaurant.  This is not a resort.  I would look around and try another hotel further North for the price.

title: August beach vacation
review: Good for the value. Suite sleeps 6, but tight quarters. Full size fridge. Bring your own coffee and filters. Nice size patio. Small bathroom space. Beach chairs and umbrellas are available for rent, but only until 5pm.

title: NOT good anymore - better change to another location ...
review: Over the years we have been staying here several times, always happy. It is basic, though at the same time a real classic Florida beach Hotel, nice ... BUT what was good in the last years more and more has become an old Hotel, outdated, not fulfilling modern needs anymore. Service has gone down a lot, ceiling fans don’t work, lights don’t work ... claimed twice within 3 days ( we stayed for 6 ), nobody seems to care, no repairs. In the night the fire alarm woke us up, twice ... there was no fire, no smoke ... we asked for exchange or repair, nobody cared. We had to live with all this ... room was not cleaned daily, towels have not been changed, etc. ... WiFi works but is rather slow, ... altogether we will NOT visit this Hotel anymore in the future ... we recommend to better…

title: Nice Hotel
review: We stayed one night.  The room and grounds were very clean and kept up.  Couldn't use pool or go to beach because of rain but it was a really pretty place. Nice staff with cold lemon water and coffee for guests.

title: Poor service
review: Staff did not communicate remodeling would turn off water for day. The room offered was not the room booked and did not have enough beds for family. There was no offer of compensation for being without water for a day-not even a free T-shirt. Front desk was telling people to go to a 7-11 to use a bathroom.

title: helcha
review: We have stayed at Sandpiper many times and we are never disappointed.  It always clean and if you have any issues with anything there's someone there to help you.  We plan on going there again next summer.

title: Teen Get-a-way
review: I brought my teenage son down to Fort Myers for a mini vaca before school started back... our room was facing the ocean so he could see the sunsets every evening. He enjoyed the pool and swimming in the ocean. The room was very clean... we never saw any bugs during our whole stay there. The beds were perfect, not too soft but not too hard either. We even utilized the gas grills to make smore's a couple of times... it was a wonderful stay.

title: comforts of home at the beach
review: I had a condo, with 2 queen very comfortable beds, full cooking kitchen, refrigerator, pull out sofa bed, and nice big TV, along with view from balcony of the ocean and a very nice size pool, with BBQ grills and shuffle board...What more can you ask for at this price. Very helpful staff!!!

title: Good for a nice, quiet stay
review: Nice little hotel.  Not 5 star, but if that is what you are looking for, then go elsewhere.  Nice clean room, huge beach, friendly and helpful staff.  Yes, it could have used some updating, but still very nice.  Stayed here as a single person coming to visit family in a beach-view room.  Far enough away from the real touristy area to be quiet and not crowded, but still close enough to drive to.  The kitchen was great and made eating in very easy so you didn't have to go out 3 times a day.  A grocery store very close and several others within 15-20 min.  If you are a single person and want more quiet, stay nearer the adult only pool.  Didn't get a beach chair, but heard they were an extra charge.

title: Loved it!!!
review: The resort was exactly as the pictures and other reviews stated. My daughter is almost 6 months pregnant and when we found out there was no elevator in the beach fronts we called and they made sure we were on the first floor. The 1st floor balcony was huge. The rooms are a little outdated but the bathroom was updated and everything worked fine. The beds were comfy. We will definitely return again next year.

title: Would definitely come back
review: Spacious room.  Stunning view of the gulf, low key, quiet and very comfortable beds.  The couch had a few nicks and looked like it could be replaced, but otherwise, the room was in great shape.  Appreciated the full size fridge.  The porch was spacious and had comfy lounge chairs.

title: Family Vacation
review: Clean, comfortable stay. Great location with easy access to beach, pools, rooms, shops, and restaurants. Grocery store is a few minutes away to stock up on anything you may need for the fully stocked kitchen.

title: Beautiful
review: We love traveling to the sandpaper we go every summer with our family it is close to the beach and always a great timeThere was lots of fun activities to do and you can walk down to Tiki bar’s there is a grocery store right down the road and a kitchen right in the room so you can cook dinner and watch the sunset

title: Awesome Vacation spot
review: This resort offers kind and exceptional attention to its customers. Stay here often, and the use of Pink Shell is a bonus! I love this place! Come several times a year to vacation with my family. Love the location on the Island:)

title: The Salassa’s 215-817-1717
review: We are true fans of the Sandpiper Resort The staff is awesome The service is great  We love the views, the beds, the pools and beach front for the money is a great deal. We love the stay every time and have always gotten from our stay exactly what we expect from a hotel. They are accommodating, courteous and are always on their game. From the beach to the grill from water sports to leisure, this place does it right.  We love the donut yourself approach with the ability to leave and venture onward as we see fit. We strongly recommend the Sandpiper and it’s off site entertainment at its mother resort. Have fun!!!!

title: The worst customer service ever and questionable family Friendly
review: Extremely rude staffing including service desk, kids pool full of drunks adults while the adult pool was empty. The place in general its depressing i mean we thought of leaving. i personally went to the front desk and was treated rude and dismissit. i have travel all around the world from small chain hotels to hufe luxurious resorts and this is by far the worst and the sad part is that the hotel itself eas kept very nice and clean..Believe whoever is giving this place 4 and 5 stars have no idea what good service is

title: Great family reunion/vacation!
review: We enjoyed our stay! The room was very comfortable and spacious. The kitchen area had everything we needed to prepare a few meals. The grills outside were very convenient, clean and complete. The pool area was wonderful and the beach as well. Close to everything. Loved that they have water and coffee by the front desk as day. They have thought of everything! Friendly staff. Will return!

title: Always good!
review: We have stayed here several times and are never disappointed! The location is perfect for our needs while here. Property is well kept,as are the units and pools. Staff are friendly and efficient! The 24hr. coffee and water availability are a nice perk too!

title: 3 time visitor
review: always clean and quite, staff was great.Beachs are wide clean and surf never too rough for kids .Can rent wet bikes for a fair fee and chairs and umbrellas for beach $20.  a day .Sea turtle nest are interesting as well

title: Outdated and overpriced
review: Same outdated resort I used to come very frequent few years ago for average $150/night. Now is overpriced, no new features have been added to it, and for the current price you can find many other options.

title: Best place ever!!!
review: My husband and I took a trip alone last time it was with kids here. Still just as perfect with no kids. Staff is great!! The place is amazing! Adult pool is awesome with no kids!! We booked for next year!!!

title: Very nice hotel.  Will definitely be back, very clean rooms, had everything we needed, loved the happiness of the housek
review: Loved the happiness of the housekeepers, especially one lady an the left side who sang beautifully the whole time she cleaned. How could anyone be in a bad mood, to hear that as your walking down the stairs. Beaches were beautiful and clean. Staff very friendly. We will be back for sure!!

title: Perfect for a family vacation, great value
review: The Sandpiper Gulf Resort is a charming beachfront hotel perfect for a family vacation. If you're on a budget, the value here can't be beat. The property is truly oceanfront - many of the rooms are walk-outs straight onto the beach with nothing in between. There's a Publix just a few blocks away so you can stock your room's kitchenette and stay a few nights. Perfect sunset views at night!

title: First vacation
review: My daughter and I came to Fort Meyers Beach for her graduation present. The resort was so much better than I expected on my budget. Rooms were very nice and clean. Resort is beautiful with great views of the ocean. Lol area was very nice. I will definitely be back again.

title: Nice place and good value
review: While this place is not a luxury hotel it s clean and kept up very nicely.  We stayed with little ones and they loved the pool and the beach.  The dining is very limited.  No restaurant on site.  There is a Publix not far away.  Perfect for families.

title: Excellent vacation location
review: Sandpiper is an excellent hotel. This was our second stay and we love it here. We will definitely be returning! The hotel staff is great and the hotel is very clean. The beach is very clean. The whole area if family oriented.

title: Disaster
review: The trip was a disaster-we never saw the contaminated water flier and both got sick-we were never told at the front desk to boil the water..The flier was under the map and we never saw it. See prior review-not a good experience at all! Sorry lots of improvements are needed! And when I went to the front desk and asked for coffee and was told right out "sorry no coffee the water is contaminated" we almost left!

title: My 5th trip
review: I’ve been 5 times now and will for sure be back. I love the location.  It’s the quieter end of the island. Not packed and not party city.  The beach and it’s just perfect.  The staff have been very accommodating as needed. I would recommend this place.

title: Excellent hotel.
review: Very friendly staff. Room was great. We had a gulf facing room on top floor. Kitchenette. Private balcony. Very clean. Great views. Easy access. Only drawback was no elevator. Other than that it was a great stay.

title: Awesome hotel!!
review: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  The room was perfect. 2 queen rooms and a kitchen with a full size fridge.  Come here on a sat or sun and you see why there is a 1 car per room limit.  We always had a parking spot so that rule is well enforced.  Thank you for that.  We will definitely be back here again.

title: Best 3 star hotel I have ever stayed in by far.
review: Best 3 star hotel I have ever stayed in by far. Great room, good location ( if you have a car ) Great beach ( awesome shells for those who wake up early) Use your towel, trade it in for a clean one. Stay away from the Mexican Food Restaurant that gets great reviews. I don't know what they are thinking. Anyone calling it "Authentic Mexican food" Has never eaten authentic Mexican food.

title: Amazing
review: Amazing beach front hotel.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Cleaned and quiet hotel. Nice rooms and service. Great location. A couple of blocks away from Publix’s. Free parking and use of gas grills. I’m  definitely coming again!

title: A diamond of a find.
review: We have been visiting this location for over 40 years and have no complaints. great location and staff. Pool and beach are very clean. Sunsets are amazing. Beds are comfortable, and rooms are big.. We always return.

title: Great stay at Sandpiper!
review: I would recommend this beautiful resort to everyone!  The friendliness, helpfulness, cleanliness of all staff was the best we've ever experienced!  Your room is very comfortable, private and clean and amenities are right there for you.  Beach and pool very beautiful and clean.  Would come again!

title: Memorial Day Family vacation!
review: For the last four years my family has been coming to the Sandpiper for Memorial Day weekend. It is something we look forward to all year round and are never disappointed! It has it all...beach, pool, friendly atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms and reasonably price. I highly recommend it!

title: Happy Holidays
review: I can recommend the resort.  It is a quiet resort, is located directly on the beautiful beach and has beautiful Roms, a nice pool and a well–kept outdoor area. It is already our third stay and we will definitely come back.

title: Gulf view at the Sandpiper
review: The Sandpiper Gulf Resort was a very nice little hotel on Estero Island at Fort Myers Beach. The accommodations were very nice and it had an efficiency kitchen with a full size refrigerator. Our room opened into the pool area but it did have gulf view rooms. The setting was very nice and the staff were kind and helpful. There were 4 adults with us and it was still very comfortable. (The algae on the beach was a bummer but certainly not their fault.) Sorry that the only photo I took was the gorgeous hibiscus.

title: Great Resort
review: If you don't care about frivolous things and simply want a fantastic room with a great view, I have to recommend Sandpiper. We have stayed here twice and it has been perfect each time. We have had the beachview rooms both times and actually like it better than beachfront because of the added privacy. The views are beautiful. Beds are comfy, rooms clean, staff excellent. Highly recommended.

title: Update the rooms!
review: Great view peaceful. The poolside rooms were much nicer than any other beachfront rooms we’ve stayed in for the last 17 yrs. If you’re looking for a beautiful beach and relaxing, it’s beautiful  Staff needs to be more professional and welcoming on this trip. Past years it was fine

title: What I expected and a little more for the price!
review: Great trip!   I loved that this hotel was far away from the chaos of Times Square.  Gorgeous beach, 2 pulls (1 adult only), several Weber gas grills in excellent shape for guests, tetherball, cornhole, shuffleboard!  Hotel felt like a second home instead of a constant drunken party!   Exactly what I was looking for.

title: Great quiet resort.
review: We have stayed here about ten times over the last thirty years.    We have stayed here about 10 times in the last 30 years.  The property is always well maintained with every thing is clean and in good condition.

title: Great spot in its category
review: Very nice place. Not high end, but clean, well appointed with beautiful beach access and pools. View from beach front room was amazing but pool view rooms had a nice view as well. Staff was friendly and helpful. Grounds nicely maintained. We were a large group and the resort accommodated us nicely. Good bang for your buck.

title: beach get away
review: Traffic on the main road is slow due to construction that has been going on for the past 3 years,   That is the only negative of this experience. Sandpiper is located on the quiet end of Fort Myers.  You are just steps from the beach and everything is well maintained.

title: Great Resort to Relax
review: Excellent beach with watersport rentals available on site. Mid island location is convenient to restaurants and shopping. Beautiful sunsets. Two swimming pools, one for families, one reserved for adults.

title: Repeat Customer
review: Third stay at the Sandpiper.  The location on Ft Myers beach is perfect.  Access to water sports just out front on the beach.  We rented jet skis, went parasailing and rented paddle boards.  Loved seeing the dolphins right out front everyday.  So amazing.

title: Short and Sweet Trip To The BEACH
review: Very nice room right on the beach.  It was perfect for us, as we were there on business and it gave us a great place to work, while we enjoyed the location.   Everyone was great and the room was very nice and clean.  Very comfortable.

title: Heaven
review: Friendly and courteous staff. Clean rooms with comfortable beds. Nice balcony views looking out towards the ocean. Pool area clean with a good number of chairs & loungers. Beach area was clean and we always rent beach chairs & umbrella for our stay.

title: WILL VISIT AGAIN!
review: Place is very relaxing and has all you need to spend a nice vacation.  Apartment is equipped with all the necessary tools to cook in, beds are comfy.  The only negative is that they do not provide beach chairs and the rentals are expensive. I will visit again but bring my beach chair!

title: Location Matters!
review: Nice stay at this resort right on the beach. Nice pool and well kept rooms would stay again. Rented 2 rooms for family and inlaws. Did wave runners on the the beach too. Would suggest early spring vs late april as the ocean temp was too high for swimming.

title: Very Clean
review: Did not get the room I wanted even with booking a year in advanced. I think all the money you pay for the hotel the chairs and umbrellas should be included. However they do give you a free beach bag!.

title: Sandpiper Right on the Beach
review: For the rate---great place and location!  Quite beach and easy to rent chairs. We were early for check-in (11am)--but they had our room ready by 1pm.  The room was very clean and the service very good.  Would come again.

title: Not bad
review: Very quiet beach Room is above average Check your paper products when you arrive, we had no paper towels or coffee filters  Other than that our experience was very good Don’t forget to watch the sunset from the balcony

title: Great Stay...peaceful, quiet, nice beach.
review: We were looking for a nice, quiet, clean place to stay.  We found It. I will definitely go back.   The staff were very friendly and helpful. Beach was clean and had chairs we could rent for $20 per day. Highly recommend.

title: Very Nice Resort
review: pros: beautiful property. Very clean rooms cons: You have to rent beach chairs.  When I walked the beach I noticed a lot of other resorts had chairs out for their guests. Paying 25.00 for two chairs is a bit steep. If you wanted to use their beach towels they also charge you more- thankfully I brought my own. The resort is nice, but it is pricey. When you pay as much as they charge those basic amenities should be included in the price.

title: Wonderful trip!
review: The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our room was clean and the right size for a family of three. The location was perfect for us.  We liked staying in a more quiet area. The beach was beautiful and clean.  However, the red seed weed was everywhere.

title: Fun
review: Our family stayed here with a larger group. The rooms were clean and well maintained, and the amenities were perfect, with parasailing, paddle boards, and jet skis to be rented right next to the hotel. It was an excellent stay! The only downside to this stay was the island traffic and construction; if you want to be in the heart of the action, stay north, or expect an hour drive to go 2-3miles. However, this location was great for a quieter family-friendly stay!

title: Amazing vacation at the Sandpiper!
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort during spring break of 2019.  What an amazing location and perfect hotel for our needs!  We had a third floor balcony oceanfront room.  We could not have asked for a more beautiful view.  The room had an efficiency apartment feel.  It contained a full size refrigerator, two burner stove, sink, and all the kitchen items needed to prepare a meal.  We had a dining room table, pull out couch, plus two queen beds.  The hotel offers free use of two large gas grills near the shuffleboard court.  We bbq'ed several meals.  This hote is clean....I never saw a mess anywhere, including on the stairwells, near the pool, on the beach, or anywhere in between.  The front desk personnel were accomodating and friendly.  The nightwatchman was also friendly…

title: great place
review: Very nice CLEAN ROOMS. Comfortable king beds. Excellent beach view rooms. Staff very quick to respond to any requests we had. LOVED the adult only pool. Beach out front has lovely soft white sand. Would stay here again.

title: A perfect family resort with an incredible beach.
review: This was the perfect resort for our family.  It has beautiful grounds and an incredible beach.  The resort has a pool, shuffle board, beach volleyball, tether ball, bags, and sand toys.  For an extra cost, there is jet ski rental, parasailing, and beach chair rental on site.  is on site.  We created family memories and look forward to returning.

title: Won’t go back!
review: When we arrived I noticed the kitchen cabinets were sticky! The side of the fridge had stuck on food and dishes did not look washed. Bathroom was very small and no privacy for changing. Loud air conditioner!

title: Great well-rounded resort, family friendly
review: The resort is on a great location with lots of family activities and the best beach sand I've seen. Staff is world class and our stay was excellent! Would definitely go back. Good restaurant options are nearby as well.

title: Smoking on Property
review: Had the possibility to be a great place but the smoking by others ruined the experience.  Maintenance was substandard.  Issues never addressed by staff.  Great view of the ocean but was confined to the room because of the smoking around us.

title: Great Location
review: Awesome staff and clean hotel right on the water. I literally have 0 complaints. Very close to the town square but far enough away to get some relaxation in. Room was very clean and staff was joyous and friendly

title: 5th year at the Sandpiper
review: Once again an excellent stay. Staff was accommodating and the ability to utilize two resorts is a added bonus.  We are already planning our next trip to the Sandpiper in the spring of 2020. Thanks for your hospitality.

title: Lovely Penthouse Stay
review: We stayed in the penthouse suite for 3 nights and the accommodations were wonderful.  Great view and helpful/friendly staff on site.  The resort was clean and had a great location on the island.  I would recommend the resort to anyone visiting Fort Myers Beach!

title: awesome!!!
review: GREAT place to stay with a family!  everyone was very friendly and helpful.  We were close to all the action of the island if we chose to take part in them.  we never felt the need to leave, everything was there for us to do.

title: New Years 2019
review: Great place and had a wonderful time.  The hotel/motel is dated but well cared for and clean.  When other locations are so expensive it is nice to know there is a place for the average person to afford.  We were a couple and stayed in the higher building over the pool with a nice view of the beach and water.  It was quiet and there were no kids or families in that building.  This may be on purpose?  If you want quiet, you may want to book over there?  The main U shaped building is noisier and has the larger pool in the middle.  Beachfront units in the main  building are truly beachfront over the sand.  The location is 3/4 south down the beach from the pier and all the activity.  You will need to bicycle or drive to the pier area, but there may be a lot of traffic  if you drive? …

title: Great place
review: Convenient location. We loved the proximity to the beach. The front desk staff was very friendly. Our kids loved the pool and shuffleboard. Parking in the lot is nice because your car is usually close to your room.We would definitely stay here again.

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: We recently spent 3 nights at this hotel and absolutely loved it. Our room was very clean the staff was VERY nice and the hotel beach was kept very clean too!  We are in the process of planning our next vacation and will be reserving a room here again.

title: Nice and clean
review: Although the hotel is older, it was clean and renovated. It was nice that the wifi worked really well. We also really enjoyed using the grills available. They were clean and in very good condition. We look to come back around Christmas 2019.

title: Away from the hustle and bustle, a true gem on the coast!
review: A last minute trip to Florida meant a scramble to find a hotel that could accommodate our family of 6. Fortunately, the Sandpiper had availability and boy were we lucky!  We walked into our room, and the first thing that struck us was the incredible view of sand, sun and water from our balcony.  In fact, my favourite thing to do while we were there was to sit on the balcony at morning and night and read a book and watch the world go by.  Away from the chaos of Ft Myers beach, this hotel is a quiet gem.  The room itself was perfect for us, two double beds and a double pull out couch.  It had a full sized fridge, stove top, microwave, and cabinets full of anything we needed to cook.  The bathroom itself was a bit small, but it was clean and use-able.  The only slight downside to…

title: Wonderful Resort on the Gulf
review: Amazing resort with an amazing view.  Stayed with our girls and had a wonderful trip.  Resort was clean, and staff was amazing.  I would definitely stay here again!  Great for families wanting to get away for rest and relaxation.

title: Good place if you like Ft Myers.
review: Very satisfied with the 4 nights we stayed at the Sandpipper. I think it’s probably one of the best spots on the beach and with the Publix supermarket A few blocks down and the Bistro  restaurant next to it you’re in a good place to enjoy your stay. Also pinchers restaurant is walkable. But I must warn everyone that Ft Myers beach is very congested with traffic so trying to get anywhere is awful!!   Not my favorite place in Florida.

title: Quiet and Family Friendly
review: This was our third stay at the Sandpiper.  The rooms are great with kitchenettes and living space beyond a bedroom.  The staff is wonderful.  It is a long walk to restaurants so plan on taking the trolley or driving.

title: Sandpiper vaction at Ft. Meyers
review: Loved the access to the beach and watching the sunsets!  The front desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly.   Loved the hotel and the excellent condition of the rooms and amenities.  The rooms were of high quality, the furniture was high quality, the bathrooms were clean and updated.

title: Nice get a way resort
review: This is not a full resort like others with a full kitchen but very nice for a get a way.  Full size fridge with 2 plate eye burner cook top.  Not oven just toaster and coffee maker.  Nice room with well kept facility.  The only issue is there is NO elevator.

title: March stay
review: The whole resort was very clean and comfortable.  The beach view room was awesome. We are planning to make the Sandpiper Gulf Resort an annual vacation destination for the whole family.  A family tradition.

title: relaxing vacation
review: most relaxing vacation.  picture perfect gulf and beach view from balcony. it would have been easy to sit there all day and watch the world go by.  fell asleep every night to the sound of waves. Cant wait to return.

title: Stay at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort
review: Absolutely excellent place to stay; peaceful, clean, and friendly service. Been staying there for years. The beach is always clean and maintained very well. The staff is outstanding from the moment of check-in to check-out. The cleaning staff is also very helpful when something is needed. The pool is clean!! Can't say that about some other places I've stayed. This place is the place to stay for a great vacation!

title: Great place to rejuvenate!
review: Just got home after a few days at the Sand Piper Resort. It's smaller than other resorts but very peaceful. The beach was great, the staff was great. Lots of families and middle age/older couples. It was nice not to have  the spring break crowd here. I would recommend stopping at the Publix up the street to stock up on food you can cook on site (using the gas grills and your two burner stove, fridge is full size) as well as snacks and beverages as there is no eatery or bar. Also the traffic on Estero Blvd due to road construction (which our neighbors who are repeats at the Sand Piper say has been going on the past three years....) makes you not want to leave the resort once you get there. Despite the traffic, we would stay here again.

title: Great hotel!
review: We stayed at the hotel last year and liked it so much that we went ahead and reserved the room for this year.  We were in town because my husband was working in the area on Monday and Tuesday, and we stayed for the week.

title: Great place
review: Great place all around.  Would recommend ocean view room with balcony.  Room was clean and the linens and bedding were new.  Went to both pools and both were well maintained.  Pool chairs were newer.  For the beach you need to rent or bring chairs.  The staff was very nice and helpful,  Would not hesitate to stay there again.

title: Great location and view, not great value
review: Front desk not helpful, housekeeping not very attentive, but great view from room and great quiet location on the beach. Many hidden fees, resort fees, no beach chairs as they are rented by a guy on the beach who says he is not affiliated with the hotel but we watched him go inside to give them their cut. You think you are paying one price but it ends up much more once you arrive. Not much value for the money you pay.

title: SandPiper quick visit
review: Wonderful location and value! The room could easily accommodate an extended stay. Staff was helpful and friendly! Enjoyed the large balcony for morning coffee as well as terrific view. We are already discussing a future trip with family when we can stay longer.

title: Last minute stay
review: Our flight home was rescheduled due to snow in the northeast and we needed a last minute hotel.  We chose this hotel and were pleased.  The front desk girls at check in were so sweet.  The room Was very clean and spacious and I had a magnificent view of the ocean and was able to watch the sunset right on my patio.  I didn’t like that you had to pay an additional fee to use the beach chairs, particularly because there is a resort fee.  I liked the coffee bar and the fact that there were tons of board games and beach toys available to share. We only stayed one night, but enjoyed our stay.

title: Ft Myers
review: Nice place - little pricey and a bit far from restaurants. Great beach access though and overall a nice place.  Will consider other locations in the future that we would not have to drive to and be able to walk

title: Average
review: Called early in the morning to say we would be early could we store our luggage? Sure but get here sooner rather than later to do so....Upon arrival asked about storing our luggage, they do not have storage for that or as we felt just didn't care to look into the possibility.  Asked that they call if a room was available earlier....upon our return a room was available...no call. Went to pull up a chair at the beach...oh hold on that is 20.00 a day? Wow really just paid a resort fee on top of the daily charge...beach is groomed and nice....room is comfortable...don't pay much attention to detail when cleaning though...to be honest for what we paid would not come back.

title: Right on the beach !
review: You couldn’t ask for more , friendly staff , clean rooms , two pools, steps to the beach , watch the sunset every night , watersports activities and umbrellas and chairs on the beach steps away ! Stayed here 6 years in a row , met people who have stayed 20 years, 17 years and we are all returning

title: Beautiful property
review: Great facility and a beautiful view.  We only stayed two days and wish we'd stayed for a month!  Our only "negatives" are the street construction and the constant traffic jam.  It takes 45 minutes to travel a mile or two.

title: Avoid the Sandpiper in Ft Myers Beach
review: Booked court yard view room but view was wall, trash cans, and ac units. They wouldn't move us, even as we offered to pay more!  Told no vacancy but sign outside indicated otherwise many days of stay.  AC unit was broken, entry door into room wouldn't open or lock properly.  Couch and curtains were stained beyond belief.  Window shutter broken, refrigerator leaked condensation, Traffic noise from Estero was horrible 24 hours a day. Adult pool was not clean, very dirty!  Beach access was good, but sand hadn't been raked for a long time; seemed littered and dirty.  Rude staff, on breaks they would hide behind a large trash dumpster smoking, and talking on cell phones.  Seemed weird as it was right next to the parking lot.  Don't ruin your vacation as this did for us, avoid this…

title: Very nice small hotel at a supreme location
review: Very nice and quiet small hotel at a supreme location. The staff was friendly, helpful and always with a smile. The beach is superb with its white sand and beautiful shells and conks. We would like to go there another time.

title: Very nice place
review: This property has everything you need. Beds are comfortable and room is very nice. It is great for couples and family’s with children. Only thing that needs attention are the floors . Our feet were black from walking on with no shoes.

title: Best Resort on Fort Myers Beach
review: Everything is always great at this resort.  BBQ area is wonderful if you want to spend the day on the beach and eat in.  It’s nice they supply coffee in the mornings.  The grounds are always clean and the staff is friendly.

title: Such a wonderful stay...We will return.
review: We enjoyed the resort very much. The week we were there the Gulf was experiencing record high temps in February so ot truly felt like we were in the tropics coming from MI. The Sandpiper is a nice resort with the best little beach front. If available get a beachfront room. You won’t regret it. The sunsets are AMAZING. We were there to chill and so for us it was perfect. We loved the adult pool. lt was nice and quiet. The room was clean, but soon they will need to update the decor. (l realize l am being picky here). l do wish the kitchenette was a little more stocked. lt was very bare bones so be advised if you plan on cooking. We ended up walking up to the Publix which was about 1/2 a mile away. Oh... There is alot of construction going on on Estero drive with lots of traffic…

title: Beachfront hotel
review: We stayed in one of their rooms on and facing the water.  We could open our doorwall and hear the waves crashing down.  It was awesome.  The room is fully equipped with beach towels and beach bag.  They give you two Figi waters and the beach bag to keep.  The room was dated but real clean. Beautiful balcony with lounge chair and two arm chairs.

title: Jill and Pete
review: Overall it was a very nice resort. We had a beachfront room, the view was beautiful, listening to the waves was very relaxing. The beach is gorgeous. Staff very friendly and helpful. Pools clean and nice. Liked having the adult pool, it was quiet and you could visit. Nice to have the kitchenette. Would recommend to anyone.

title: A Lot of Good Features and Some Hiccups
review: The accommodations were,  generally speaking, fine. The Sandpiper is located right on Ft. Meyers Beach, but on what I would call the mid-south end of Estero Key.  This area of the Key is much quieter and less frantic than the northern end of the Key close to Times Square. We had a beach front room (studio) with a patio that was great for watching people and dolphins, and listening to the surf.  There were two queen beds.  My wife and I would have preferred a king bed, but I don't think any of the beachfront rooms have them.  Rooms are cleaned daily.              Although we didn't notice it for most of our stay, the walls of the units where we were are thin. However, when we had our only rainy day, our neighbors were inside and we could hear a lot from them. This may have had to…

title: Girls weekend
review: We really loved this hotel . Children’s pool , adult pool , and right on the beach . It was beautiful. The room was quite large with everything we needed . The kitchen had a full size refrigerator and stove .

title: Great Location, could use some updates.
review: Location and sunsets are amazing!!  Parking lot is always full and hard to park.  Rooms could use some updating but a very relaxing place.  I would go back.  Price was average for those locations.  It was a bit of a drive for the food/bars for nighttime activities.  All in All, very relaxing!!

title: Did not disappoint again!
review: This was our second time staying and were not disappointed in our choice. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We were able to check in early and when first room didn’t work out because of being on third floor, she was more than willing to help us out. Everything turned out great and our stay was relaxing and enjoyable! Will definitely request that same room next time! Thanks for a beautiful time!

title: Nice stop
review: Good location right on Fort Meyers Beach about in the center of the island. Easy in and out and no problem parking. Room was nice and we had a balcony. It is starting to show its age and could use some upgrades (like maybe a coffee pot less then 20 years old, wiring in place of plug in strips, new fridge and charging stations).

title: Great location!
review: We had an amazing trip to Sand Piper.  We any wait to come back!  Great rooms and amenities!  Beautiful views, clean, friendly staff and comfy beds! Loved being able to rent an umbrella and chairs right out front.  Pro to being on the south end of the beach is far less beach traffic!

title: Hotel in Fort Myers Beah
review: Ft Myers as a whole seemed to be running down compared to our visit about 3 years ago.  Road construction was going on which made getting around difficult.  With that being said, maybe they were trying to give Fort Myers a face lift.  It is an older hotel and there is not an elevator in one of the buildings which made it hard due to my husband's recent back surgery.  The other buillding had an elevator but no beach front rooms.  It would not be my choice if we returned.

title: Good Value
review: Overall our stay was very good. The negative is the staff is not very friendly, the water pressure was weak at best and the doors slammed all day long. The good: Beautiful beach right at your doorstep, all rooms remodeled and very, very clean and other than the slamming doors a very nice place. The grounds were perfectly kept and we enjoyed the family pool and the beach service. We would return and enjoy this wonderful Florida beach!

title: Relaxing get away
review: Absolutely amazing. We were on the first floor and opened our door to a beautiful view of the pool and palm trees. The staff were all phenomenal!!!! Kristen at the front desk was over the top, went above and beyond for ALL of our needs!!!! Highly highly recommend!

title: Relaxing vacation
review: This place was amazing! There was construction yes but it didn’t bother us at all. We didn’t hear any road work and had the relaxing vacation we were aiming for. The beach and pool access was awesome, the coffee all day and night was a big plus too. It was really clean too. The staff was super friendly. If you need ANYTHING at all ask Kristin! She was so helpful and so sweet. Definitely will be booking again in the future.

title: Girls trip!
review: Amazing place to stay at! The beach and pool have really easy access and coffee/water was out at all times, perfect for relaxing! The front desk was nice as well. Kristin was really helpful with any questions and was super nice, she really made me enjoy my stay even more! I would definitely return to this resort because of my experience and the staff!

title: Fun Girls Weekend
review: I thought for the age of this resort that it was well maintained and had a very nice beach access. The rooms were large and would accommodate a family nicely (2 queen beds, pull out sofa, dining table and kitchenette.  My view was of the pool/courtyard, it was never noisy, and I felt very safe here.  We came as a large group of friends and had several units between us.  One of the travelers was an owner there so it helped that they had a lay of the land.  It is a very small resort with ample parking, the only knock is that it is far from the local attractions.  Luckily we could always get an uber or bus but I would not mind staying closer to the action.  I would definitely return to this resort with my children as they would enjoy the pool (small) and beach access (on the…

title: Anniversary Getaway
review: Every aspect of our stay was quite enjoyable! From check in to check out! The beach was beautiful, and the resort was conveniently located near several excellent restaurants and entertainment facilities!

title: Relaxing stay
review: Nice hotel with two pool areas one for adults only and a general pool both with terraces leading on to the beach.  One big irritation when relaxing by the pool is the gates slamming which is really annoying and can be heard from the room.  These are the security gates to/from the pool which are constantly in use.  The more thoughtful guests close them gently but most guests unfortunately don’t, especially children.  This could so easily be rectified by the hotel.  The apartment was comfortable however there were a few issues.  There was very little water pressure in the washbasin tap and the kitchen sink tap leaked badly when used.  Both these issues were rectified once we brought it to the hotel’s attention.  In my view these types of issues should be noticed and reported by…

title: Terrible stay at this hotel
review: They should say something about road construction right  near by their hotel Before people will book it!  We had a Terrible and extrimally loud noise from early morning 7 am with never end!!! Totally wrong!

title: Sister Getaway
review: Great place and friendliest front desk staff. Kristin is amazing!  She’s knowledgeable, great conversation and made our stay one of our best ever.  If you like the less crowded beach and beautiful white sand, you can’t go wrong at Sandpiper.  Two pools...  All Swim & Adult.  Great walks and beach lounging can’t b beat!  We WILL be back😊

title: Sand Piper
review: A great place to stay at our trip to Fort Myers Beach. Love the view and the beach close up. There was some Road work in front of the hotel and it was making some noise. Its dosent matter.  We liked it at Sand Piper and our one dag visit til The Pink Shell.

title: great location!
review: This was a nice hotel, the rooms were comfy and the location right on the beach was perfect.  The beds were very comfortable and there is a fully stocked kitchen area to prepare your own meals if desired.    when checking in, they offer you the use of their beach towels, but beware, they charge you $40 if you loose it, which is WAY more than the towels are worth, it's better just to bring your own beach towel and not even mess with that.    There is construction going on right in the front of the hotel but it didn't cause too much of a problem, there is a grocery store about a mile away and lots of other places to eat/shop within a short drive.  Also, parking is a problem on the weekend when the hotel is full.   The biggest downside for my group was the lack of on-beach…

title: Best vacation spot!!
review: We love this place!  We take full advantage of the adult pool area.  We keep returning here for 100% relaxation, and we get it here.  One of the best perks is staying right on the beach and renting beach chairs & umbrellas!

title: Roomy and a great view
review: I was not sure about the hotel when I first saw it online as there were not a lot of reviews.  I was so pleased when we arrived.  Loved that I had a kitchentette that had everything we needed.  So great to be able to save a little money by being able to grill out or cook in our rooms.  There was plenty of room for our family of four to spread out andrelax.  Being right on that beautiful beach was great.  They had a little damage from the hurricane that hit the summer before but you would have never have known as they repaired everything.  They had activities and a pool on site too.  You could even purchase icecream.  It is gated so you need the access bracelet to enter rooms and pool area so no strangers lurking about.  One warning is that the pool area gets full of sunbathers…

title: So Fun!
review: We took my two boys here for summer vacation & loved it! The jet ski excursion was so much fun! We saw Manatees, Dolphins, Sea Turtles & so much more! We had a Great time on Sanibel Island as well. We found lots of beautiful shells and rocks. Would love to go back again!

title: Don't book through Expedia
review: We had to cancel our reservation more than a week before.   We were charged $74 even though there was no cancellation fee.  Expedia charged my card $400 and only based the return on $370 even though there was no fee.   We are in this area a few times a year and will NEVER book through expedia or at this resort.

title: Very good hotel
review: We rent two pool view rooms for a couple of days, the hotel is great, is few steps from the beach, nice and clean rooms , pool area is very clean with BBQs for guess use, the red heir girl in the from desk was very nice every time I ask for something she give te solution or answer in very courteous way. The only inconvenience I found was at the time when I ask if we can check out late the other girl in the morning told me that I have to live by 11 am, at 10:30 am some one cut off the water on booth room, she knew that I have a baby and 2 other kids to bad for the hotel,becouse they loose the chance to bild a relation with a costumer for every year,just for the attitude of one person who dosent have idea o dont care about the costumer satisfaction

title: The Prettiest golf course in the Fraser Valley.
review: This course is challenging, and it is beautiful.  Every hole has an easy out where shorter hitters can go to make a play, and it has risk/reward spots if you go for it. The wide tree lined fairways, the vistas that include views of the Harrison River and the mountains of the area, and even just the whole aura of the course make it relaxing and my favourite long weekend golf course  I wish it was closer, but every time I drive to it I realize the drive is worthwhile. Great golf course!

title: Booked 7 months in advance; $500 to cancel.. Really?
review: We go nearly every year to Fort Myers Beach, and the plan for 2019 was to pick a new spot along the beach.  Sandpiper Gulf Resort sounded nice.  Booked one room for Feb 2019.  Unfortunately, an upcoming family event forced us to cancel.  $502.39 to cancel?  Really?  Seven months in advance.  Yeah, I should have read all the fine print, but this is an outright ripoff.  Never, ever, ever, ever, ever again.

title: Gorgeous place!
review: For our road trip in Florida, we booked about 5 hotels. This one was by far the most beautiful. What a gorgeous place to be right at the beach with te most amazing panorama. The apartment hotel is not outrageously luxurious, it is just really cosy and well maintained.  The pool area is clean and small, but it cools you down after a beach visit. The rooms are spacious and clean, except for the occasional beach sand on the floor which seems to be difficult to get rid of. The bathrooms are sparkling clean but again, as in so many other hotels, we experienced extremely low water pressure so it is difficult to wash and rinse long hair after a beach day. Also here, the toilets did not flush very well.  Fabulous surroundings! Captiva and Sanibel are so much worth a visit. The personnel…

title: Good Hotel right at the Beach
review: We spend the 4 of July at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort. We had a great room with pool view and Gulf view. The room could be cleaner but this is by my standard what is very high. The mattress needs to be changed very soon because it is way to soft. We spend two days at the Beach and saw a great fireworks from Ft. Myers Beach all the way up to Lovers Key. The Pool is very busy but with the Beach so close who needs a Pool.

title: On the beach
review: Fantastic hotel everything 1st class the only downside was getting to places its on a very busy road but to be fair there was construction in progress it took about an hour to get 5 miles but hotel beautiful location everything you need in a hotel loved it

title: Great old-fashioned beach experience.
review: Booked an oceanfront room at the Sandpiper for the first time. Loved it. Pool was on the beach with great views. Very family-friendly place.  Went to the sister resort down the road for the day but ended up coming back to the Sandpiper. It is smaller quieter and friendlier. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Ok stay
review: The hotel is not resort material. It's rooms were very small. The staff was friendly though. Swimming pool small too. It's a quaint place but I just didn't feel it was "resort" quality.  No elevator either,  so you'll need to be in shape to stay here.

title: Friendly & Helpful Staff
review: The Staff was very friendly & helpful.  Rooms were spacious & clean.  Grounds were kept very clean. Free Coffee all day long. Two pools, grills, laundry, & volleyball net. You can sign out cornhole, volleyball, & shuffleboard. We will definitely be staying here again.

title: Fort Myers Beach area for vacationing
review: Lovely week at Sandpiper Resort. During week, few people but week end little more. Rooms have kitchens and a close grocery store makes it easy to obtain food items. Beach clean from garbage, in fact entire area very litter free. Loved the two pools kids and adults. Very few people in adult one. The rooms are a little dated but has the necessities! Recommend the oceanfront ones.

title: NO ELEVATOR TO THE TOP
review: My wife and I recently reserved a room here for our Anniversary weekend. We had asked repeatedly for a first floor unit since we found out the have no elevator to take you up three flights of stairs for the beachfront units, and since they take one night stay when you book we had to keep the reservation.  The good: Right on the beach                  Tile thu-out the rooms, (no Carpet)                   Adult pool is very quiet and relaxing                  The help was very accommodating  in getting our luggage up to our room. The bad: No restaurant or bar close by so have to Uber if going out, because the parking is a disaster. No assigned parking spots.               They will place 150.00 charge on your card for incidentals, and you have to wait to get that back.            …

title: Wonderful as usual!
review: The Sandpiper Gulf Resort is a dreamy getaway.  The vibe is relaxation...gorgeous view and friendly people. ZOA at the front desk is terrific!  She was so helpful and kind to us.  Thanks for the wonderful service!

title: Gomez Family Reunion
review: Fantastic stay as usual.  Thank you again to:      Gary Lee -  Group Sales Manager      Deysi Ynoa - Conference Services Coordinator      Bonnie - onsite Manager Thank you for all you do to make our stay wonderful year after year.

title: Great place to stay
review: The resort is directly on the beach! They also provide beach towels which is a big plus when packing for air travel. Also, it’s located close to lots of shopping and restaurants. Our family loves the resort.

title: Family vacation!
review: Great location, beautiful views, and excellent accommodations. You will love walking the beach, and the tropical grounds. Two pools (1 family, 1 adults only), easy parking, clean room, very spacious, feels like a studio apartment. Within walking distance from Supermarket and all conveniences are surrounding the resort. Great beach! Will definitely return with family; they fell in love with the resort and the area.

title: Loud Music, Yelling, and Foul Language All Day and Night.
review: I was very excited to stay in this hotel with my husband and four young children. I did a ton of research before booking the room. The Sandpiper got great reviews and was supposed to be at the quiet end of the beach, which is exactly what we wanted; A quiet and relaxing vacation. That is not what we got. In fact, when we checked in there was a huge party going on with more than 50 people. Loud vulgar music played constantly into the night.  The pool and courtyard were full of drunk party-goers using foul language and there was even a beer pong table set up on one of the patios. This party went on for two days straight. For two days we couldn’t use the pool and wouldn’t even allow our children on our own balcony for fear of what they’d hear or see. When we complained, the women…

title: LOVE THIS PLACE
review: Sandpiper is clean, the location can't be beat and the hotel is beautiful.  Publix is close to do your grocery shopping, the kitchens are stocked with all the necessities, and they have grills on property. You will not be disappointed if you stay here.

title: Not the best stay
review: We have stayed at this motel each year for over 30 years. One of the pros this year was good housekeeping. Our rooms were serviced everyday. Another positive was the adult only pool. This allows older people a more pleasant time. The ocean front room certainly gave us stunning views of the gulf and of the sunsets. For the cons the kitchen, was lacking. The stainless steel pan was horrible to cook in even though I always used medium heat. Everything stuck and burned in the pan. It would be nice to have some glass storage bowls. The refrigerator leaked water which ended up getting in the food that we had stored. We did not bother to complain because we have complained about this for the past two years and was told the owner would not replace the frig. This year though it was…

title: Very nice! +++++
review: We spent three nights at Sandpiper and found it very nice indeed. Clean and right on the beautiful beach. Nice rooms with access to pool area and good parking just outside the room at the back. We used the large clean barberques every night. In fact this hotel is the best of the lot of the hotels we stayed at during our two week vacation in New York and Florida.

title: Great , clean and quiet beach hotel in the heart of it all.
review: You can never tell from pictures what a place will be like when you arrive but the Sandpiper met our expectations and then some. The entire property was fastidiously maintained every day from the outdoor grills and the pool to the beach area. This is what I would call an "Old Florida" resort, low-key, friendly and laid back. There were some families with kids but not too many or too noisy and everyone there seemed to be there for the sun and the beach. We met a number of families and couples who have been coming to the SandPiper for years. The only downside of this small resort in my book is that it does not serve a daily breakfast or any food and it has no outdoor bar, but our room did have a nicely equipped kitchen and full-sized fridge. Overall it was very clean, quiet and…

title: Great Place on the Beach
review: This was an amazing place to stay.... right on the beach, very clean, great beds.  Rooms have a full kitchen ( no oven ) place setting for 4-6 people.... full size frig...  we had an ocean view/front.... it was perfect....the parking lot was tricky at times.... LOVED the rubber wristbands... that is your key.... never found yourself without a key.... had never seen it before.... loved it.... grills were great... grilled brats for lunch one day,... barely had to leave the beach to grill..... there was a Co. that set up beach chairs/umbrella's at the beach....20.00 for the day.... great deal.... ONLY drawback is there is nothing really w/in walking distance and lots of construction on the road out front ( not noisy though )

title: Heavenly
review: Fabulous location with a perfect white sandy beach. The room was wonderful with a private deck overlooking the ocean, we slept with the door open and listened  to the waves all night. Small comfortable hotel very quiet and  the staff was great!!! We will return 😊

title: Impressed!
review: Everything was very clean which is top priority in my book!  Loved the Full Sized Fridge!!  Great place for a family to cook meals and play shuffleboard, tether ball, corn hole, volleyball etc.  We were on 5th floor of he adjacent building with a balcony. So the pool and the grills etc were between us and the Gulf which was a downfall but just a little.  Rental chairs and umbrellas right on the beach.  Walkable to the grocery store.  Nice beach.  We had the Do Not Disturb sign on our door all day and when we came back there was a bag of fresh towels and support our door.  I've never seen that and I thought that was great!  I'd certainly recommend this hotel and stay here again!

title: Nice and clean hotel.
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper in March of 2018 for my sons high school spring break.  The hotel itself is very nice and the staff was very friendly.  The rooms were clean and nice and all have kitchenette's.  The pools were nice and the beach is amazing.  Our only complaint was the location (for our purposes) and lack of amenities on the property.  The location itself is probably perfect for someone looking for a quiet getaway.  Unfortunately for us, we were there with 2 teenagers who wanted to be closer to the action.  With the Spring Break traffic, it would take 45 minutes or more to travel the 3 miles to Times Square and the pier.  This created quite a headache in regards to transportation back and forth.  There is a Trolley that was supposed to go by every 20 minutes however we…

title: Shhh!  I want to keep this place a secret!
review: My husband wanted me to write a bad review so other people don't discover this lovely hotel in south Fort Myers Beach.  But I just can't!  The two of us traveled for Spring Break and just wanted time at the beach with conveniences of a hotel and pool if desired.  This was perfect. We added a night to the beginning of our trip so we got a poolside room for one night and until we checked into our beach front room.  We almost asked to stay in the poolside room because it was so convenient to walk to the pool (literally 15 steps, tops) but we also LOVED our beach front room.  Rooms are spacious (keep in mind there were only 2 of us, but each room sleeps 6. I think that might be a little crowded with the smaller bathroom.) and although our poolside room had a ripped screen, the…

title: Beautiful, Sunny Hotel!
review: My husband  and I stayed one night upon arriving in Florida and wished we were there longer. We had a beach front room with an amazing view of the Gulf. The hotel is immaculate and beautifully decorated. The staff are friendly and gave us great suggestions for dinner and breakfast.  The beds are extremely comfortable and it was wonderful to listen to the surf at night. We will definitely return for a longer stay. It is on the quieter part of Ft. Myers Beach and you do need to drive to restaurants. But worth it!

title: Holidays on the Beach front
review: Resorts is located directly on the beautiful beach of Fort Myers Beach Very friendly stuff give you the feeling of a perfect vacation. Barbecue for self made dinner for free. I highly recommend the beach view rooms. I had one on the third floor with spectacular sunset!

title: Not staying here again!
review: After not being able to get a room at the Pink Shell for a special weekend, the phone agent recommended us to come to the SP. After a couple of calls and the high recommendation from the agent, we finally made the reservation for 2 nights in an ocean view room and paid the non-refundable deposit. However, when we got to the hotel, we were informed that we didn’t get the ocean view room and that we could only park one car. As a “solution”, the staff at the lobby told us to go to another hotel about a mile away to park our car or to leave it in a nearby plaza where they’re open until 2am so it was “unlikely” that they would tow the car. I was very surprised that after making the reservation with a live agent, multiple calls, and almost a $1,000 for 2 nights at a 3 star hotel, no…

title: Perfect
review: My husband and I stayed for 6 nights here. The stay was fantastic, sitting on the balcony with sea views watching the dolphins swim past in the morning. Walks along the white sand beach, sitting by and swimming in the adult only pool and use of the barbeques in the evening. Perfect just what we needed

title: Just perfect!
review: Spent a week here in February with my husband, sister, my brother and his family. First time in Fort Meyers for all of us, and it was everything we hoped for and more! Sandpiper is in a great location, and access to the beautiful  beach is steps from your room! Two pools, shuffle board, grills, beach volleyball, great pool area, and staff was amazing! We would love to come back!

title: This resort has its act together
review: My family visited for three nights.   I was happily surprised by the size of the rooms, and the fact that they did not smell musty at all, which can be common along the beach.   Check in was efficient and friendly, also let us know we could visit the Pink Shell for swimming or eating. The beach is wide and the water in the gulf stays shallow so it is safe for little kids.  There are "community" sand toys that my kids enjoyed.  We saw dolphins just off shore one evening and one morning. Checking out the shuffleboard and volleyballs was easy. Exchanging pool towels whenever we wanted was also easy. The chairs for rent on the beach went up to $20/day through the rental shop along the beach.   We did not use them. The pool heat felt great as we were there during some breezy days. …

title: Winter vacation
review: My wife and I spent 10 days at the Sandpiper and had an outstanding time. The property was clean and up-to-date. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. We particularly enjoyed the beach and adult pool. While there are no facilities on sight (bar, restaurant) there are options nearby. The property also includes 2 large Weber grills near the adult pool that were clean and well maintained.

title: Great location!
review: My husband and I got away from the cold of the north and stayed at the Sandpiper resort for a 4 day weekend.  We had a room on the beach and the location was wonderful!  Nice kitchenette, 2 beds, very clean.   We didn't use the pools, but they looked nice.  We did rent beach chairs and an umbrella from a guy located right in front of the hotel.  Also had excursions that left straight from the beach (on ski-doos).   I would go back in a heartbeat!

title: Location, comfort and cleanliness!
review: Five of us stayed for 2 nights during Presidents week (3 adults, 2 children).  The hotel consists of 3 buildings, all right on the beach.  The location is nice because it is a little farther from the noisy, crowded north end of the beach.  There are 2 swimming pools (one for families and the other is adults only).  Our room was spotlessly clean and nicely appointed with two double beds in the bedroom and a separate living area with a double size pull out couch, kitchenette and dining area.  The bathroom was updated and was also spotless.  We had a balcony with a nice ocean view.  The rooms have a full size refrigerator, so you can stock up with breakfast items and essentials.  This is important because there is no restaurant on the premises (but there are plenty of places to eat…

title: Vacation
review: Great family hotel located right on the Beach in a very calm area. The pools are heated and very nice. Barbecues available for guest to use. Free coffee and activities like shuffleboard and beach volley available. We had a great stay.

title: Vacation week
review: Great experience! Well maintained, all rooms have view of the beach. Rooms neat, bright, and clean, Full sized refrigerators and stovetop. Staff pleasant and helpful.Outside grilles for guest cooking, which are scrubbed clean every morning.

title: Great Beach Hotel
review: My family and stayed at the Sandpiper and couldn't have been happier.  This is NOT a "big resort"; rather, it is a small, clean hotel RIGHT ON THE BEACH.  No room is more than 100 yards from the beach.  The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean.

title: Celebrating Hubby’s 50th Bday
review: Room 156 was perfect. No stairs. Hubby handicapped and needs to skip stairs and I had knee issues making it hard for me to walk and steps would have been exhausting, so we felt blessed to get this room.  Gorgeous room.  You walk out on huge patio and your view is the beach. You have two lounge chairs, two sitting chairs and two tables. They were perfect for tanning or coffee at first light.   They give you just the right amount of glass dishes to use.  You do need to do dishes, but they leave dish liquid.  There wasn’t an oven, so remember that when buying groceries.  For cooking, you’ll need oil and spices.    This place is serious about their cleanliness. I was in the shower and housekeeping knocks on the bathroom door and opens it - she saw me or most likely would have taken…

title: What a great view
review: This place is super clean and friendly.  Two pools and it’s right on the beach.  We had a beech side room. And the view was awesome. If you have kids I would recommend pool side rooms. Kitchens do not have a oven so no frozen pizzas.

title: We liked it so much we added another night
review: We were really happy with the Sandpiper Resort. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and the kitchen was spotless. The complimentary water and beach bag were a nice touch. The pool was warm and clean.   I liked the wrist band instead of a room key. Convenient.   Steps from the beach on a great stretch of sand! Would definitely return here.

title: Sandpiper Gulf Resort, Fort Myers Beach, FL
review: The good thing about it was that our room was beach front.  There were some negatives.  My wife had to call the first time to get the room serviced though after that more interest was taken in it.  The physical plant is of older vintage though it has been kept up with nice paint, etc.  The heater in our room put out adequate heat but when it shut down, it let out a loud groan which could interfere with sleep.  While in Fort Myers Beach, we investigated other potential lodgeing places and sadly, if we had known better, we could have stayed in a nicer place for less money.  Also, be aware, that one of the buildings has an elevator and the other doesn't.  We were in a ground floor room but if we had been on the third floor would have found going up and down stairs a bit tedious.

title: GOOD…BUT NOT FANATASTIC LIKE LAST YEAR
review: 1/22/18  We stayed at the Sandpiper Gulf for just a few days in mid-January of 2018 because we had booked a cruise for the latter part of our winter vacation this year.    We had stayed at the resort for a week at about the same time in 2017 and absolutely loved the place, so much so that we didn’t check any other locations in the Fort Myers Beach area for this year’s trip.   Why tamper with near perfection?  Our experience this year was, by and large, also very good.   The resort is charmingly retro without striving to cater to the chic set by being faux charmingly retro.   The pools are nice and the courtyard and other grounds are well maintained.   The staff is mostly helpful, attentive, and knowledgeable.   The beach is utterly fantastic; I don’t think we’ve seen a beach…

title: Very nice resort located right on the beach!
review: This is a very nice and quiet resort with a very nice staff. We were there from Christmas Day to New Year' day and we had very nice weather up until the last dat we were there. They have two pools and are located right on the beach. The rooms are a good size with two queen sized beds. They only have one room with a single King Sized bed. The rooms have a full kitchen with a full refridgerator, stove, microwave, and dishes. They have rooms that face the ocean, garden, or pool so they can accomadate a lot of customer's budgets. Beach towels are provided by the resort and pool loungers are provided by the pool. You have to pay extra for beach loungers on the beach that aren't very comfortable. You need a car or plan to cook because the resort does not have a restaurant and is…

title: Honeymoon
review: My husband and I spent a week at the Sandpiper for our honeymoon, and I am so glad we did. We upgraded to a beach front room, which was probably one of the best purchases on our whole trip. Only thing I wasn't aware of is that they are only double queen rooms, which isn't a big deal we just weren't expecting it.  On the subject of beds, they aren't comfortable, which is why this isnt a 5 star rating. I never expect hotel beds to be comfortable, but these were the worst I had slept on, they almost had a curve going up in the center of them, very weird.  Staff is amazing and very accommodating. The beach was great, as well as the heated pools. Not close to much, but that is what we were looking for. Worth every single penny, and hoping to come back again!   Tip: make sure to rent…

title: Pleasant delight on the beach!
review: Visited Sandpiper Gulf Resort in Dec. The stay was wonderful. The rooms were remodeled, including the bathroom which made it super clean. The kitchen had a stove top which pots and pans.Coffee was available every day by the front desk which was very convenient for the mornings we didn't want to make coffee in our room.  Beach chairs & umbrellas are available for rent at a discounted rate to guests. Beach towels are also available and can be exchanged as many times you need.I highly recommend this place, and can't wait to go back!

title: NO NOTIFICATION OF CHARGE TO CREDIT CARD
review: My boyfriend has Parkinson Disease and had an accident on the sofa. We reported it immediately at the front desk and was told it was no problem that accidents happen. There was never a mention of a charge and that they would send someone up to clean it. No one came up to clean it. When my credit card came through they had charged $60.00 without my permission or knowledge. When I called Bonnie(Manager)she apologized and said I should have been called but made no move to correct it. We are disappointed and will choose better next time. Be careful of charges made after you leave.

title: Another great stay
review: We checked in about 10pm and were greated warmly. We were given our room keys( which are a waterproof wristband)  and given a map of the hotel and the best place to park near our room, which pool is adults only, where to find fresh brewed coffee and about the hotel. We were even give a hand to our room with our cases. Studio room overlooked the pool and we had a great view of the sandy white beach. Room was great with 2 beds, stove, full fridge and all appliances that you need. Good bathroom with hot shower and daily house keeping. There is also a safe in the room tucked away in the closet. Rooms are no smoking but you can smoke on your balcony. Publix is just down the road to pick up any items you may need. We love, love,love this resort

title: Right on the Beach!
review: I stayed at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort last weekend and it was very nice. The location was incredible and was just steps from the beach. It had a kitchenette in the room which was awesome because we just went to Publix down the street and bought food to eat/make. The only downside was there was no continental breakfast... but they did have coffee outside the office which was nice. You also need to make sure you put your do not disturb sign on your front door or you'll have housekeeping knocking on your door at 9am. Overall this was a great place to stay and I would love to go back sometime!
