title: QUALITY HOTEL AND QUALITY SERVICES THROUGH AND THROUGH
review: Our first trip to the gulf side with thousands of hotels along the beach fronts. Our travel agency suggested Sandpiper Gulf Resort due to their excellent reviews and positive feedbacks from their customers. It is stressful enough to entrust the agent but more stressful to located a resort on our own with no idea to start. We are so happy we booked at Sandpiper with our agent because it is everything we dreamed and hoped for, and more! Absolutely beautiful and stunning, on the beach and up and down the island. The area is super clean and meticulously cleaned daily. Staffs available 24/7 and are responsive, knowledgeable, and prompt to act. We will return and can't wait. Even the owner herself jumped into action and was very attentive and courteous to assist me with parking and…

title: Beautiful beach!
review: Stayed 3 nights post cruise, 2 adults. Check in was easy, but there is no elevator, book downstairs room if you have mobility issues. I had to walk up 2 flights with a bad heart and knee. Other than this issue, the room was very clean, complimentary water and bag. The only thing I did not like...the toilet/tub had a door, but the sink area did not have any privacy at all, the 2 beds were right there, needs to have a curtain or a door. Two pools, one adult which is nice, we were closer to the family pool, ugh, loud kids spitting water and screaming. This is a beachfront property, beach was beautiful, soft white sand with shells. Parking was horrible, I called the number on the front door one night, the guy was very nice, came out and showed us where to park, at the building next…

title: Perfect vacation!
review: My vacation experience was perfect!  Location was within walking distance to grocery store and restaurants.  Loved the adult pool.  But most of all was the cleanliness of the rooms.  Housekeeping great!  Got to the hotel early and was able to get into our room almost 2 hours before check in time.  Front desk staff was nice.  Beach front room with balcony was a plus for me.  We would sit out there in the afternoon enjoying the sun and watching the sunset in the evening.  Lots of dolphins playing out in the golf waters in the early morning hours.

title: Diana Sarratt
review: We had a wonderful experience at the Sandpiper! The staff is very courteous and friendly especially Mike Kirby ! We arrived really late and he got us in our room and let us know about the resort . Thank you to everyone for making our stay so wonderful!!

title: 25yr Anniversary in Paradise
review: Celebrating our 25th year anniversary and parents of 5 we needed a little Paradise. We definitely got it at Sandpiper Resort. The location was perfect and the views breathtaking. The room was cozy, clean and well equipped. Publix was right down the street which made it easy to stock up on food for the weekend.  Parking was available in front of our room. The staff was friendly and knowledgable of area and the sister location Pink Shell for dining.  The beachfront rooms are comfortable and private. You can hear the ocean and birds has you relax in your bed and see the white sand & beach while watching the Sunset = Paradise. Definitely a romantic place to celebrate any occassion. Exteremly satisfied with location,  hotel, staff and room. AAA membership was honored.

title: Relaxation At Its Best!
review: This was our first visit to Ft. Myers Beach, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort.  We had a 3rd floor oceanfront room that was so relaxing for our morning coffee and breakfast.  The room was impeccably clean and the kitchen well stocked, which included an excellent selection of glassware.  That combined with easy access to Publix (a local supermarket with an excellent bakery and deli -- less than a mile from the resort) served us perfectly for breakfast and snacking throughout the day.  We also enjoyed having dessert or drinks in the evening on the balcony.  The resort location on the beach was tremendous for leisurely walks along the coastline.  For those who like outdoor beach bars, a simple 10 - 15 minute walk on the beach leads to a cute tiki bar…

title: Relax, Relax, Relax
review: Great laid back location, no restaurant, no bar, quiet, grocery store close by.  Clean room and comfy bed.  Having the efficiency room was great.  Used the para-sailing and the jet-ski's you can rent right in front of the hotel.  Jet ski dolphin tour was great, saw lots of dolphins.  Nice view, nice beach. It was hotter than I expected, but the pool's and beach were great to cool off.

title: Fantastic!!!
review: We landed in Fort Myers, picked up our rental car and drove to Fort Myers Beach, we passed several hotels then saw this one.  My husband and I looked at each other and said hey it's yellow, (one of my favorite colors), so lets check it out.  We went in and were greeted with a somewhat reserved but friendly reception, their were two on the desk at the time and one was clearly being trained.  We asked did they have any rooms available with a beach view, and they said yes, so then we asked could we see the room, the trainee took us around to the room, which truly was directly on the beach as in full view, my husband could walk up to our patio and take a sip of a cold drink, if he wished.  So of course we said SOLD!!! and checked in.  The first thing that was so impressive was how…

title: In need of update
review: Room in need of update, furniture shabby and stained, bed linen stained. On the positive side, bed was comfortable. Most staff were helpful. Beautiful view from room, great  beach. Liked the fact they had separate pools one for families and one for adults.

title: Love this place so much
review: This was our second stay at this beautiful resort. Right on the white sands of the Gulf of Mexico. We booked one of the beach front rooms and we were not disappointed. Sunsets every night, and dolphins every morning. It's such a quiet hotel, even in August, on more than one occasion we had the pool to ourselves!!! The staff are friendly and informative and the resort very clean. There is a Publix just 0.5 miles away and the lively pier and Times Square about 3 miles up the road. Lovers Key just a mile or so south of the hotel is well worth a visit but otherwise the beach and pool area provide the best relaxation xxx each room has a small kitchenette and we made good use of this, no need to travel to a restaurant with a view, we had the best view already. There are also numerous…

title: Could be better
review: Didn't start too well, when we arrived we were told we were too early to check-in . This wasn't a problem but the member of staff seemed to take it as a personal insult that we were early and went to great lengths to point out the offical check in time, that we would have received this confirmation at the time of booking etc. We did have a car full of suitcases so it would have been convenient if we could have left them in a secure place but after the frost reception we just left and came back later. The same member of staff was on the desk when we checked out, during which she interrupted the process to have a chat with one of the maintenance men.  On to the hotel itself, we had a poolside room on the 2nd floor . A good sized room,  comfortable beds with a small kitchenette, no…

title: Weekend escape
review: Is the perfect beach place for a family get away weekend, is nice walking to the beach parking is very convenient, love being able to grill just outside the room. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Will definitely to stay there again.

title: Another great stay at the Sandpiper
review: This is my second stay at the Sandpiper. Came here last year with my husband and grandson. My grandson loved it and said it was paradise. Last year we stayed on the first floor in a courtyard room. It had great access to the pool.   Those rooms were full so I chose a slightly more expensive ocean front room and again requested the first floor. It was well worth the extra money. We were literally right on the beach. We had a large patio and if you climbed over the railing you would be in the sand!   The only minor issue we had was a drip coming onto our patio from an upper floor. The dripping water would intermittently splash you as you sat outside. Otherwise the room was perfect.   I am always impressed with the maintenance on this property. It is older but updated and well…

title: Nice off season visit
review: We were really impressed with our beachview room (#369) Thank you Kristen at the desk for holding our luggage until our room was ready. Excellent housekeeping staff also did great at keeping the sand under control and keeping our room tidy. Would recommend to anyone coming out for a nice relaxing stay

title: Excellent hotel
review: A very nice mid-sized hotel with really friendly staff. Good location right on the beach but a car is needed to go to Fort Meyers Beach city. The room was very well equipped with a nice kitchen, big fridge, freezer and a microwave owen. They also had 2 big grill outside which we used two times.  We would definitely recommend this hotel and use it again if we come back to this area.

title: Perfect Beach hotel!
review: I stayed in the beachfront room and found this hotel a gem. It sits right on the ocean. I liked it was just out of town in the quite area. You can walk to 2 beach bars. The pool was small but efficient, one big plus is using the sister property pink shell. The reception help were very helpful. The only thin that would be nice is to have food onsite. I found the rooms to be clean and well appointed. I will stay here again on my next visit.

title: Not really what I expected
review: We stayed 1 night and I struggled with this hotel. On the plus side, staff were friendly, the beach was really nice and location by the sea good. On the downside, I had missed that there was no breakfast on site, which was a pain. The beds were very soft and our room was one of the closest to the main road and so was noisy, swimming pools were smallish. Overall, not for me and I would not stay again, but if you are after self-catering accommodation by the beach, and like soft beds, perhaps one for you!

title: OK
review: Beautiful view and convenient beach access. The 2 queen bed rooms were actually full size beds though and were hard. The kitchen had lots of really tiny white bugs all over the counters. Also the evening we arrived there was about 10 young adults in the parking lot yelling and arguing. It was very discouraging that the employee working didn't seem concerned when we checked in. She just said "Well do you not want to stay here then". After a 20 hour drive what else were we suppose to do. They also put a $150.00 hold on my credit card that was not disclosed in advance for possible incidentals. The Publix grocery store down the street has an amazing deli and bakery!!!! That was also the best food we ate all week. Not impressed with any restaurant we ate at all week. Time square was…

title: Nice and Quite
review: Nice place with clean rooms. Everywhere you look they have people working on the  place. Located far enough away from the commercial area that it's quite. A little bit too far to walk to dinner. Beach was beautiful.

title: A May getaway👣
review: I try to get away a couple times a year, just to step back  and BREATHE!   I only live 1/2 an hour away, but when I get to the Sandpiper I'm in another world.  I always stay in a beachfront unit, because being disabled I cannot actually get out on the sand.  This first floor unit has a large terrace so I actually feel like I'm on the beach👣!  It's wonderful! From the on-site manager, Bonni, to Angel at the front desk, to Alex from maintenance, they can't do enough for you.  I could never get away like this without their care and concern for their guests.    This is not a new resort, but the grounds are impeccable, and the rooms are always spotless.  I call it my home-away-from-home 👣

title: Pros & Cons
review: Pros: Great location for families Adult only pool Ocean view rooms could legitimately be called ocean front- a pool is the only thing separating you and the sand Their sister property is the Pink Shell which is fabulous resort-you get access to everything there!!!! You get a discount on jet ski rental because you stay here ($20 off) Has shuffle board & cornhole you can use Maintenance blew up our floaties for us Front desk staff were friendly Clean In suites there is a sliding door between the bedroom and living room area which was nice for privacy and sleeping  Cons: The wifi blocks Netflix, Amazon Prime & Hulu !  That's a big one for us!   The wifi blocks Groupon & Living social!  Boo! Our sweet was a bit rundown, things were definitely worn The cups in the cupboard were dirty…

title: VACATION WEEKEND  GETAWAY
review: This place met and exceeded all out expectations. It was just what we wanted and more. Beautifully decorated and quaint accommodations, beautiful grounds, and the staff was so very cordial and everyone was so pleasant and friendly..  Angel at the front desk check in and Mike in security were wonderful and so accommodating.  Loved the flowing coffee throughout the day by the office  Just a little comfort of home. What I loved also it was far enough to away from all the crowds but close enough to shops and food.  We will definitely make this our little getaway in FT Myers

title: Quiet resort with wonderful service
review: We stayed at Sandpiper for a week. We had excellent service at every turn. The resort was sparkling clean. The room was beautiful. We highly recommend paying the extra and getting a beachfront room. An extra thanks to Britney at the front desk who was helpful when we both got sick! We can't wait to return.

title: Beautiful Beach
review: Even though our room was a pool view, we had a beautiful view of the beach. Room was very clean. Love that it had tile floors and not carpet. Beds were comfy. Not really any places to walk to for food but Publix is nearby and we just ordered pizza. There was quite a few people esp young kids in the courtyard who were very loud at around 10-11pm. The rooms and doors are pretty sound proof since the noise didn't wake my kids but it was a little annoying when trying to enjoy a night on the patio. I think the management eventually told them to keep it down. All in all great vacation and would definitely return again.

title: Winter get away
review: Right on the beach ! Miles of white soft sand to walk on just steps from our room.  Very spacious room / apt. Eat in kitchen with full size refrigerator. All the dishes ,glasses ,pots,cups ,flatware the one would need . Beautifully decorated !  2 pools to choose from. The quiet adult pool or a family pool. Coffee / tea in the lobby every morning and most of the day . Most restaurants a short car ride away. When we visited there was Construction  on the road to and from the main town so traffic was horrendous to go out and about. The road will a pleasure once completed.

title: Escape from the cold Northeast
review: We stayed for a week at Sandpiper Gulf Resort.  Left NY where it was 35 degrees and arrived to 80s and 90s!  Lovely accommodations.  Plenty of space in our beachfront room, nice kitchenette and patio.  Be warned - no elevators, so we lugged our luggage and groceries to 3rd floor...the only inconvenience.  Most meals we took the rental car and explored Ft. Myers and Naples since nothing within walking distance.  Plenty of shopping, restaurants nearby.  Drove to Sanibel & Captiva but found just as nice shells right at our hotel.  Saw dolphins and a manatees and beautiful sunsets.  Would definitely recommend for location and cleanliness.  Turn your beach towels in for fresh ones as needed.  2 complimentary large bottles of VOSS water and a cute Sandpiper tote bag awaited in the…

title: Very nice place on the beach
review: It was very nice place quiet.  The adult and separate children's pool was nice idea. The room was clean, beachfront was directly on the beach. They offered coffee and a paper. No breakfast.  You need a car to get to eating which was fine we had a rental car.  There was a publix right up the rode. We used their gas grills very nice.  And a liquor store right up the road.  The restaurant up in the plaza had half off pizza.  Very good.

title: Great room, beautiful beach, and adult only pool!
review: Loved our week long sray at Sandpiper! We soaked up sun, went parasailing, and explored the gulf on wave runners with a dolphin tour. We used the kitchen and also grilled fresh shrimp on the hotel's provided grills. Quiet and beautiful. Only thing missing....a restaurant on site or walking distance. Going up Estero and coming back down is not an easy task.  The sister property is lovely too! The Pink Shell has many amenities, but seems more family oriented and we don't have children. We will be back! ❤️

title: Lovely quiet resort
review: We had a king sized room facing the ocean and the pool. The room could have easily accomodated 4 people, plus it had a kitchen and dining area. The decor was a little dated but clean and comfortable. (super soft beds, not to my liking but may be for some).    The front desk staff was amazing both upon check in and check out. The beach is beautiful and clean. There are a pair of Dolphins what swim up the coast every morning and back down south in the evenings. Every day! They swim pretty close to the shore and are a joy to watch.

title: Excellent place to stay...with a couple small caveats
review: The Sandpiper Gulf Resort is a great place to stay, particularly if you can get a beach-side room.  It's a very clean, well-maintained, and well-run resort and all buildings are no-smoking.   The rooms were surprisingly quiet, and we only heard our neighbors once in a while even with the patio door open.  The adults-only pool is a real plus for couples or singles looking for some quiet time, but there's also a family pool for families with kids, and then of course there's the beach.  It's covered in soft white sand, and down by the shore there are plenty of small shells for collectors.  If you like, you can rent a jet ski or paddle board, or take a dolphin tour.  Unlike some other places we've been on the Florida Gulf Coast it's possible to walk nearly a mile in either direction…

title: Perfect!
review: I couldn't have been more pleased with my stay at the sandpiper. Location and amenities were amazing! We had a beachfront room on the third floor and were able to sleep with the door open and hear the ocean each night which was so relaxing. Our room was updated and spacious. We also visited the pink she'll and had fun swimming in the octapool as well as a great breakfast. Would highly recommend.

title: Right on the beach - midisland family resort
review: Our room was 225 on the second floor overlooking the family swimming pool.  Nice room with 2 double beds, sofa, and kitchenette.  We like this place because there is an adult pool and  family pool, plenty of well maintained webber gas grills, its a mid-island resort (so the beach isn't crazy hectic) and the traffic isn't bad, its close to Public grocery Store, also they keep coffee on all day as well as a cooler with ice water.   They provide super nice beach towels.  We found that you can sometimes find a deal on room rates online, as much as $100/night or 30% off.  However if you call the desk they seem to always quote the normal full rate.  However last year when we found a good rate online and then called the resort direct, the resort honored the online price - which is good…

title: Great trip
review: Spent 4 days with my family at the sandpiper we had a great trip!!!  Took a short walk to Publix for supplies took a cheap cap ride back to resort.  Staff was very friendly.  We reserved lawn chairs and umbrellas for our trip as soon as we got there and they were ready for us each morning.  I highly recommend the salty crab for a great place to eat..

title: Excellent stay- immaculate condition
review: Perfect location on the beach- away from the congestion of Times Square, but very accessible to great restaurants via taxi/Uber. Publix only 12 minutes walk. Very nice and well kept property- friendly and accommodating staff. Rooms were very nice size for week stay, and housekeeping did a great job cleaning/replenishing. Beach area one of the nicest on the beach, handy res/sports stand and cheap $15/day umbrellas. They keep it immaculate including well-kept pools. Perfect get away- this property is a great value and gem. I would highly recommend this property.

title: Perfect Location
review: All of the staff at the Sandpiper were very friendly and helpful.  We chose a beach view room which had a nice sized balcony with a great view!  The room itself was very clean and the king sized bed was comfortable.  The resort offers 2 pools, a family pool and an 18+ pool; the beach view rooms are in front of the 18+ pool. The beach area in front of the resort was flat and not busy, which was great for walks.  The area was very quiet, both during the day and evening.  The location of this resort is perfect!

title: Great location
review: Very nice hotels. Great rooms with a kitchen and sitting area and balcony. Very clean. You can walk out of the hotel and you are on the beach. The family pool is small. The location is amazing. The beaches are beautiful.Great sunrise and sunset views.

title: Perfect for our family of 5!
review: We loved the Sandpiper! Beautiful pool and perfect beach! They were so close to our room with a kitchenette so we could easily feed the kids and get back to having fun! There was plenty of room for my family of 5. Daily housekeeping. Friendly staff. Everything we needed was in the room. Guests were laid back and didn't save chairs if they weren't using them, there was always one available even during spring break week!   Great Location on the beach, not too crowded and jet ski tours and parasailing right out front! Great location near Snook Bight marina for fishing and dolphin tours with Good time charters (5 min drive). 8 min drive to Adventures in Kayaking (my kids favorite activity) Also just 5 min drive from Publix which had good food and beach toys and chairs. We really…

title: Disappointing location
review: I thought that this facility would be closer to Sanibel. Expedia's listing was misleading. The property is nice enough, although there are a lot of hidden fees, and it is nothing super special. I had hoped I would be getting a great bargain based on the ads, but instead, I felt disappointed.

title: Locaction location location
review: I can't imagine any hotel anywhere being closer to the beach than this. It's literally right on the beach. That's the best part. We rented a room with a beach view ("Beachfront Room") and watched the sunset from our balcony every night. It was definitely worth the extra money for this. The other highlight was going on a jet-ski tour to look at dolphins. We all got very sunburned on this tour, despite wearing lots of sunscreen, so you should use more than you think is possible.) It's also important to note, as others have, that there is no restaurant in the hotel. And the kitchenette is smallish. But all still worth it to be so close to the beach.

title: Best on the island
review: We spent a week in a Beachfront room, with two queen beds, a couch, kitchenette with table, and large first-floor balcony. It was the closest resort to the ocean, which meant unequaled views and the beach came right up to the building. Sunsets are visible from practically any ocean-facing room, and are beautiful.   The rooms on higher floors seemed to have smaller balconies, but still amazing views (and fewer people in the way for sunset pictures) but the higher-floor balconies were still good-sized and had patio furniture to enjoy the Florida sun.   The resort has two pools (one for kids and one for adults), towels can be checked out for free, and chairs, umbrellas, and jet skis can be rented on the beach directly in front of the hotel.   The only thing to know is that there…

title: Go for the Beach!!
review: Three of Four stars, I couldn't decide.  Sandpiper is, as many people said, "tired" and somewhat overpriced, but the location is 5 star for sure in terms of the beach access.  The Gulf front rooms have views that can't be beat.  The rooms themselves are worn, but they work.  We chose Sandpiper for the 'on the beach' location, the pools, and the kitchenette.  It delivered on all three.  The adult pool is small, but empty so we often had it to ourselves.  I loved having clean beach towels everyday, and liked the welcome beach tote (and bottle of water on the first day only).  I didn't love having to pay for beach chair rentals every day, but maybe that isn't unusual ($15 per day for two chairs and an umbrella); and we had to get outside early (9am) to make sure we had them.  But…

title: Great location, but tired.
review: The accommodations don't live up to the price.  For $350+ per night I expect better than cheap, beaten up furniture and a smelly room.  Check in was extraordinarily slow, one person, who could care less about the long line.  Check in took 20 + mins.  Also, damage deposit was held for each room without mention at reservation.  Pretty sleazy!  Beautiful beach, but very remote.  LOTS of traffic and few restaurant options.  I'm giving it a luxury rating because of the high price it's anything but.

title: Great views!
review: My husband and I requested a beach view room. We were very happy with the view. The room was average for the price. We have mixed emotions about our visit. we came in March and I knew it was peak season. I do my homework and check reviews and prices. People commented on how quiet it was. It wasn't. We were outside the pool gate that slams all day starting in the early morning. You jump every time it slams. The stairs were also outside our first floor room. Everyone in the place ran screaming past at all hours. Then we have the pool two rooms away. Kids screamed most of our stay (6 days). We have 3 kids and never allowed our kids to behave this way. We called the office 3 times to complain. The last time was after 10pm. The sign on the pool states it closes at dusk which never…

title: First Experience
review: This place is over rated.  If you want morning coffee buy it before you get there.  There are pots in room but nothing to make coffee with.  Office staff not particularly friendly. Views are outstanding of course.

title: Best Place On The Beach !
review: Awesome hotel. Staff is amazing and free beach towels and water daily is a big plus ! Heated pools are great for cool evenings. Wish there were more restaurants close by but full kitchen is great for making your own meals ! Ask for beachfront room , the view is wonderful !

title: Great location, nice staff and CLEAN
review: We really enjoyed our time here. It's far enough away from the busy Times Square area but still close enough if you want to spend some time there. They are also right on the beach which is great for morning walks or to see the sunset.   But what set them apart for me was how clean they kept the place. The courtyard is immaculate with free grills and a nice pool and shuffleboard.  It seems to be very well managed.   We will likely return, next time with a beach side balcony if we can make it happen.

title: Anniversary Weekend
review: Our children gave us this weekend for our anniversary.  We stayed in The Penthouse. It was heaven. We were treated liked royalty from check-in to check-out. The view is unbelievable!!!  The rooms are equipped with everything you need. There is an adult pool which is nice. You are only feet from the ocean. We can't wait to return with our kids. The only suggestion I would give is to somehow add some kind of little grill for as there is no source of food unless you bring it or cook it yourself. Otherwise it is heaven!!!  Thank you so much for a wonderful experience!!

title: Nice beachfront hotel
review: Lovely beachfront hotel. Supermarket (Publix) only a short walk away, so really handy if your planning on self-catering. The location is quiet and there's not a huge amount to do in the evening. There's only one restaurant (Bayfront Bistro) nearby and that's next to the Publix.  There are 2 pools. A family and an adult pool. Fresh coffee available all day from outside the main reception near the family pool. BBQ facilities on site. Not sure how clean these were as we didn't use them. Although we did see many people taking advantage of them.  Would I stay here again? Probably not. The location was a little too quiet for my husband and I. However I would definitely recommend the Sandpiper for families seeking a safe family-friendly beach vacation.

title: Great family friendly beach front hotel with amazing views!
review: Our family of 4 (two little ones) stayed here for 4 days and it was perfect.  The room was spacious, clean and the kitchen was well stocked.  There was a publix close by so it was convenient for food and a beer run.  Umbrellas and chairs for rent right outside of the room were great for the kids.  Access for their sister hotel, The Pink Shell, was a plus. We went for a day, the kids loved the pool and it was great to have a poolside restaurant and bar.   There was a shuttle stop close by to take you downtown to the chaos of the restaurant and street performers.  We had a great time and would go again.

title: Nice stay on the beach
review: We stayed 4 days at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort located mid island on Estero. The resort is small, which I find appealing.  Our room was very clean with adequate room ,up to date, and reasonably quiet.  The rooms have a small kitchenette, sans oven, but with a nice table for four. There are also BBQ grills which you may use. It was easy to get to the nearby Publix supermarket which is very well stocked.  One could even walk to Publix from the Sandpiper. There is a small loveseat/ sofa and sitting chair.  There were two comfortable queen beds in our room.  The bathrooms were fine.  We had a nice view of the pool.  There are two pools.  A larger family pool and a small aduts only pool.  We were steps from the beautiful beach where you can rent an umbrella and chairs.  There is a…

title: Fantastic beach front room overlooking the Gulf - WOW!!!!
review: We had booked a room with a sea view but, oh what a shame they had sold out of these so we got a free upgrade to a beach front apartment!!  We were very pleased with this and our room was superb. 2 queen beds, very nice bathroom with separate sink area, room safe, good aircon and large flat screen TV. We had a kitchen with microwave oven, hob, toaster and fridge/freezer plus ALL utensils cups plates dishes you name it. When we went onto the balcony we could not beileve our luck! The view was amazing up and down the beach and just 100yd from the sea!  Great facilities at this hotel with laundry facilities ice machines and free coffe and iced water at reception available all day.  Nice pool areas and beach towels available plus you step right onto the beach from the hotel. You use…

title: Anniversary Getaway!
review: Very affordable hotel that did not lack class. Loved the quiet adult pool and the location on the beach. The hotel was very clean and the kitchenette was very handy as we ate breakfast and lunch there daily. I would recommend to anyone!

title: Amazing views
review: My husband and I came here for a short get away. We were on 3rd floor with ocean front view. Sitting on the balcony listening to the ocean and eating your meals, is wonderful! Great property, clean, and Mike P is great. He helped us with all our questions. Will visit again.

title: We loved it so much, we are already booked for next year!
review: If you're looking for a place to relax and unwind, this is it!  Clean rooms, convenient location, great amenities, adults only pool, white powdery beach and the views are amazing!  We stayed Monday through Friday and had wished we had another day.  The staff is very accommodating and the resort is welcoming to both couples or families.  We  enjoyed it so very much, that we have already reserved our rooms for next year.  We are telling everyone about Sandpiper Gulf Resort....maybe we are their next spokes-couple!  You will not be disappointed!  Lovin' me some Sandpiper Gulf Resort!

title: Great family resort!
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper this past weekend and just loved it here! Mike P. at the front desk was so helpful and accommodating! We really appreciated his great service. Our room was a gulf view and we thought it was great! The kitchenette was wonderful to have so we could make breakfast and sandwiches in the room. The beds were very comfortable! Our girls (ages 9 and 12) loved the heated pool and the beach was right outside our door. We will definitely stay here again!

title: Very relaxing week
review: My wife and I needed someplace to get away from the cold for a week.  This was the ideal place.  Very small resort.  We stayed in one of the gulf view king rooms on the 4th floor.  Fantastic.  Everything we needed for our stay.  They even provide beach towels and it was the best resort we found.  Everybody was friendly and helpful.  It was quiet except for the waves but that didn't keep me awake.  Very little street noise.  Nothing close for eating but a publix 1/2 mile north and fish markets just over the sky bridge.  We'll be back.

title: Service
review: We have been here now for about 8 or 9 years and still the same high standard of service(Angel, Marcia and the new star Molly) are great, and Mike as a night securityguard is irreplaceable! Coffee in the (real) earlymorning and always a good talk. Rooms clean and great. However the US$ has increased significantly against the Euro. If the Management/Company rices their prices again. it could be our last year, which would be a pity!

title: No complaints
review: It gives us great satisfaction to know that we continue to deliver the kind of experience you would expect year after year. We are always happy to welcome our repeat guests back to the Sandpiper. It was our pleasure taking care of you once again.   Kindest regards,  Maredith Rizzo Public Relations Manager

title: Great in every way!
review: The grounds are well maintained and the room was extra clean!  The staff is very friendly from Angel, at the front desk, to the housekeeping staff.  We were glad we had an elevator to the 4th floor in the "tower", which had a beautiful view of the Gulf overlooking the swimming pool.

title: fabulous
review: Thank you for your positive review of the Sandpiper. We are delighted to read that you noticed the cleanliness of the resort and the well-kept grounds. We hope to welcome you back on your next visit to Fort Myers Beach.  Kindest regards,  Maredith Rizzo Public Relations Manager

title: Nice Place but no food/drink on site
review: We had a pool view studio that was a great size. From our balcony you could see the beach and you could walk there in less than 2 minutes. Our room was spotless and housekeeping came in daily and did a great job.  We had a small counter top cooker, full fridge/freezer with coffee pot,toaster and tons on utensils and crockery. They also give you a beach bag and 2 bottles of water.Bathroom was nice size with a good shower. Lots of storage and wardrobe space and an in room safe. There are pool towels available from the front desk and you can change these as often as you like. They also have two pools and one is a family pool and one is an ovr 18's pool.Your room key is a rubber wristband that you can wear in the pool so you dont have to worry about keeping your key safe while your…

title: Right on the beach!
review: We are happy to hear of your excellent time at Sandpiper! It is our daily quest to provide a memorable experience and to provide exactly what you came for- superior service and a vacation that leaves you reminiscing about it for months. Thank you for your support and your highest recommendations! We look forward to your return.  Kindest regards,  Maredith Rizzo Public Relations Manager

title: Great location
review: I stayed here 6 days and the rooms are large and clean.  They even include a small kitchen.  The pool is nice and the grounds are quiet in the evening.  The only wish I had was that food/drink was available on site.  There is no food/drink within reasonable walking distance either.  The worst part of my visit had nothing to do with the hotel.  The only road on the island is torn up and near impossible to drive without spending 30 minutes to go just a few miles.  And this is a 10 year project.

title: Nice and quiet hotel
review: Right next to the beach and a couple pools.  Closest restaurant app 1 km away. Nice place. If you are fine cooking yourself or go by car some km this is the place to stay at. Yesterday we saw a couple of delphins playing around in the sea, from our balcony.

title: Fun GRoup Event   Tri-County Challenger
review: Dear fyndiga,  Thank you for choosing Sandpiper Gulf Resort for your family getaway! We are fortunate to have such an extraordinary beachfront location. Thank you again for your visit and for sharing your experience. We look forward to welcoming you back someday soon!  Kindest regards,  Maredith Rizzo Public Relations Manager

title: Good deal on a clean place
review: Great location, great service and friendly staff.  Well managed by Bonni Delizia.   Rooms are clean, and furnished very nicely. Two pools to choose from. Right on the Beach on the quiet side of island.  Beach toys to rent are found just next door.   Alex Moc, the Engineer was quite helpful during our stay.   We hope to stay there again in the coming year. The kids from our group are special needs.  Although they have no handicap rooms they have several first floor and elevator rooms that work quite well.

title: Sandpiper Gulf Resort
review: Dear Estero_FlBeachbum,  Thank you for this detailed review of our resort and for mentioning the associates who added to the value of your stay. We are happy to have left you with a great impression of the Sandpiper through our service. We would be delighted to have your group stay with us again.  Kindest regards,  Maredith Rizzo Public Relations Manager

title: What a lovely place!
review: Our room was island view in the tower by the adult pool but we could see the gulf from the balcony. Room was very clean with nice furnishings. King bed was very comfy. Bathroom looked like it had recently been 'redone. The grounds were beautiful and the beach was great. The pool closes at dusk, which is a disappointment . We just wish we could have stayed longer! Got a free beach bag at check in ,a nice touch!

title: Great Place
review: The hotel was well maintained and super clean. Great for a family with kids. Great beach view and location. Close to a Publix supermarket. Near restaurants. The room had a 2 burner flat stove top. A full size refrigerator, utensils, bowls, plates and cookware. The only thing was, our beds didn't get made everyday. I had to make them.

title: Comfortable, clean and classy!
review: Thank you for choosing to stay at our resort on your recent visit to Fort Myers Beach.  You have mentioned some great information on what to expect. We look forward to welcoming you back to this area of Southwest Florida and we hope to be your first choice when deciding where to stay.  Kindest regards,  Maredith Rizzo Public Relations Manager

title: Love this place!
review: We had a beachfront unit! Totally worth the extra cost!! Nice furnishings, comfy, clean room. Beautiful beach just a few steps away. The Gulf of Mexico greets you as soon as you wake up......just awesome!!! Beach activities next door. Patios are huge and enclosed, nice!

title: Blown away!
review: Thank you for your visit and for taking the time to share your positive experience at our beach resort. We look forward to welcoming you back to enjoy the amazing views.  Kindest regards,  Maredith Rizzo Public Relations Manager

title: Great value for Fall beach getaway.
review: Have to say, I was impressed upon check in. The front desk people were so friendly and gave us a thorough run down on everything, from where to get beach towels to where the best places to eat are. The room was fabulous. Very clean, full size fridge, coffee maker (a necessity for me), microwave, stove, cups, etc. They even leave a complimentary beach bag and bottled water in the room. As an added bonus, the room key is actually a water proof bracelet that you swipe near the doorknob to get in. The kids thought that was the most awesome thing ever, and it was very convenient to not dig in my purse for a plastic card. Our room had a very spacious balcony overlooking the family pool, and the beach is literally steps away. There are also washers and dryers available, which is always…

title: Holiday.
review: We loved it here. The rooms were lovely so clean and straight on the beach. The staff were really nice. Lovely to have a adult pool to relax at. Barbecue facility's a bonus. Would not hesitate to stay Hera again.

title: Labor Day 2016
review: Upon arrival I was greeted with a wonderful hello, check in was easy and quick, we received our yellow wrist bands as room keys and headed to room. We had a bottom floor room with a pool view, it was clean and beautiful, very resort feeling with the yellow walls and pineapple decor, tile floors, kitchenette is well stocked, 2 burner stove and nice microwave, plenty of towels, and seating for 4 at kitchen table, patio had 2 chairs and 1 lounger. Pool was 10 steps away and beach was 20. You could rent chairs and umbrella for only 15.00 a day, beach towels no charge as long as you bring them back. The pool got a little crazy with the kids glad there was an adult pool! Coffee from 7 am - 11pm, there were coffee machines in room also, bring your own coffee and filters, plenty of…

title: Relaxing
review: We staying in the penthouse, a small apartment above the front desk with a large balcony and kitchen etc. The area was recently redone and the entire property was in good shape. The rest of our family stayed on the first floor gulf side and had a nice patio gulf view. The pools were in good condition and we had 20 second walk to the gulf itself. Many amenities are offered and staff is very helpful.

title: End of Summer Weekend Getaway
review: The complete satisfaction of our guests is our number one priority. It means so much to hear that you found the most enjoyable vacation at the Sandpiper. Thank you for your visit and support. We do hope you’ll make it back, as our entire team looks forward to providing you with another memorable visit.  Kindest regards,  Maredith Rizzo Public Relations Manager

title: Another great stay!
review: Just what was needed before school started.  8/12-8/16. Great little hotel that brought back memories of our vacations when we were kids. Old style Florida hotel, 2 story building with our balcony overlooking the pool and gardens. Everthing is well kept and up-to-date. Weber bbqs right by the pools to grill your steaks while you relax and enjoy the sunsets. The sand is literally just outside your door. Mid Island Watersports is conveniently located right on the beach. Jetskis, beach chairs and umbrella rentals, as well as parasailing. Hotel is located just south of Times Square on the quiet end of Estero.  You can bike ride to the pier and all the restaurants if you want. Will definitely be returning when looking for some rest and relaxation.

title: AMAZING
review: We've stayed here many times, it's great! It's far enough down the beach that you avoid the craziness and it's an easy drive to Bonita for great food and shopping. The rooms are clean and you don't have to worry about keeping track of your room key because they give you a silicone wrist band that allows you access to your room and the pool. Bonus, you can take it off for sleeping.

title: About average
review: After checking reviews I decided to give this place a shot. It's a nice location right on the beach. I'm not big on yellow, but the bright yellow color gives it the beach feel. Check in is a bit slow. There is no restaurant or bar so you need to drive or uber.

title: Nice location on the beach
review: Dear Ricky K,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our Resort on your first visit to Fort Myers Beach.  You have mentioned some great information on what to expect. We look forward to welcoming you back to this area of Southwest Florida and we hope to be your first choice when deciding where to stay.  Kindest regards,  Maredith Rizzo Public Relations Manager

title: Grandson called it Paradise!
review: We spent 7 nights in this hotel in july 2016. The rooms were clean and spacious and the kitchenette was well equipped and usable for breakfast and lunch. We used the barbecue two nights and it worked fine. There are free coffee, tea and water all day which is a nice touch. We only used the kids pool which was good, there were plenty of available sunchairs. We could have used more sun umbrellas during the hottest hours of the day but that is a minor thing.. Most of the restaurants in Fort Myers beach are located near Times Square so you need a car or taxi to get to them. The beach located right outside the hotel was clean and there were lots of space. The only minus was the constant noise from the air conditioners which are all located on the patios so whenever we were outside…

title: Jose stayed 7/23/16
review: You experienced some wonderful adventures while in our great location of Southwest Florida. We are known for our amazing beaches and sunsets, but as you discovered, there are many places nearby worth visiting. Altogether, this makes for a great vacation. Thank you for reviewing our resort and we look forward to your return.  Kindest regards,  Maredith Rizzo Public Relations Manager

title: Nice three-night stay
review: My dtr and I took a quick 3-nite getaway to Ft Myers Beach, and really enjoyed this hotel. Upgraded to an oceanview next to adult pool, which was a nice surprise. Great beachfront location, with water sports, beach chairs and umbrellas available right there. The co. has a nice $15 deal for chairs/umbrella for hotel guests. This place is well south of the busier, and frankly "tackier", Ft Myers Beach proper. Our king-bedded room was very clean, the furnishings modern West Indian feel and design. Nice kitchenette with table, pullout couch and balcony overlooking pool and beach. Would stay here again. Tonite we move to the sister property on the northern tip of Estero Isl, Pink Shell Resort. The two properties share privileges.  Highly recommend kayaking at Lovers Key St Park for…

title: Great Resort
review: I am so delighted that you found the Sandpiper to be a wonderful resort. Thank you for your compliments of our superb accommodations and service. It gives us great pride to know that your experience was above your expectations. We look forward to your next visit.  Kindest regards,  Maredith Rizzo Public Relations Manager

title: Another great stay
review: A small, quiet resort right on the beach.  The room was excellent with an updated small kitchen. We had a small dining area.  Two large beds, a dressing room and bathroom We had our own patio that was right on the beach.  Couldn't ask for a better location.

title: Very friendly staff
review: Second year in a row to go to this motel.  This is something we never do.  We were as impressed the second year as we were the first.  The rooms are so clean.  The pools are very nice and clean.  Everyone is so helpful.  Located on the beach and plenty parking.  They give you towels to take to the pool or beach and this is great.  Can rent jet skies on the beach and take dolphin tours from the beach in front of the hotel.

title: Great location right on the beach. Clean and Friendly
review: We stayed 4 nights June 30 to July 4th.  This is a very clean facility.  We liked our room overlooking the adult pool and we indeed had a beach view.    Front desk staff was very nice and gave us a lot of their time to chat.  We met Angel, Michelle and Ezekielle... all of them went above and beyond to make us happy.   The beach is not as clean as we had hoped for.  The sand is beautiful, however lots of seaweed and the water is not blue,  It is like a lake until you get out pretty far. We heard from the locals it is because the city is dumping water from a dam to that side of the inlet.   The jet ski owners were nice and we enjoyed the dolphin tour, saw 6 of them.

title: Awesome
review: Room was very nice. Tim at the front desk was wonderful. Our flight got in late and he stuck around to help us check in. Very friendly. The resort was very pretty. But we were mainly on Sanibel Island the whole time. So this year we will be staying on the island the whole time.

title: Really low quality.
review: Stayed 2 nights at the SP before I had to move over to the Pink Shell.  The facility was over-run with a family reunion and under-staffed.  My room was not ready when I arrived and I got no call from the front desk when it was.  I had to wait in a line 4 to 5 deep each time I needed something as the front desk was so poorly staffed.  They do not have someone at the desk 24 hours so for early check out you need to track down a security guard.  Just a really poor operation.  The room itself was dated and there were tiny little bugs crawling around both the bathroom sink and kitchenette sink.  In contrast the Pink Shell is excellent.

title: Relaxing vacation on the beach
review: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights. It was the perfect place to stay for a relaxing vacation. The resort is away from all the traffic and construction so it is quiet. The resort has a separate pool for adults which is great. The room was identified as beach view and it was true to the name. We had a balcony that overlooked the adult pool and looked directly to the beach. The room has a nice little kitchenette that was great for breakfast and lunch. The one thing that was a little confusing about the room was that the AC unit for the room was located in the kitchen so it had to be on all the time to keep the bedroom area cool which meant it was loud sometimes at night when trying to sleep. There is also a Publix right up the road which is great to buy groceries for the week.…

title: Wonderful
review: We had a wonderful time here.  The room was gorgeous, it had a kitchenette, a table, sofa area, and two beds and it was very clean.  All the beds were very comfortable, even the sofa bed.  When you walk out of your room, the beach is right there.  We're definitely returning whenever we travel back to this area!  Why look for another place when we found the best?

title: It's just OK
review: I don't think it's worth the price personally. The rooms are clean, but very small. The bathroom is almost a closet. The pool for families is small as well and 6'9 I think is a little deep for a family pool. You can rent beach chairs, but the beach wasn't crowded enough to need to do that. Our DVD player didn't work and no one came to fix it. The rooms are decorated ok nothing fancy. It's clean , the beds are comfortable, but I really don't think the room even being beach front that is of this size is worth what we paid a night. I've rented larger condo's for less with a lot more space.

title: bad customer care
review: Overall property is fine for the category. unfortunately the customer care is bad. Our debitcard was charged with usd 150.00 ( not blocked!) after our request via e mail and phone to credit back the amount still no reaction after 3 weeks! On the webpage they ensure to reply your emails within 48h, but that's not the case. They just don't care! Very disappointing! We finally contacted the card company which helped us.

title: Vacation
review: Excellent room. View was fabulous, beach was beautiful, employees very friendly. Having kitchen was convenient. Near to lots of good restaurant's and other activities. Beds were very comfortable. Bring your own beach towel or you will have to rent one. Washer and dryer is available. Beach umbrellas and chairs are $15 per day. Nice pools. Free coffee daily by office.

title: Summer Vacation
review: Place was great. We stayed in the penthouse the maid service was excellent. Dishes were drone for us every day. Had a beautiful view of the ocean from our balcony that wrapped all the way around the room. Bed was very comfortable and the bedroom was spacious and well appointed. Living room was comfortable tv was limited but we didn't go to the ocean to watch tv. Kitchen had everything we needed.  Amenities in the lobby were always attended to. The sand on the beach was the whitest We had ever seen.

title: This is the place
review: I loved this resort. It's located in the perfect place: a few meters from Publix, close to the night life but far enough to be peaceful and quiet. The rooms are adorable, kitchen fully equipped with all you need to cook. There are a lot of details which make your stay perfect: a complimentary bag with the hotel logo, water bottles with a nice design, towels arranged in a beatiful manner. There are barbecues and tables and chairs in front of the beach for anyone to use them, free coffee and limonade all day long. They don't provide beach chairs or umbrella but you can get them for 15 US$ a day with a specil discount. The beach is wonderful, water ir warmer than pool, sunsets are amazing. The only thing is there are stingrays from May to October, so you cannot stay in the water…

title: Awesome
review: This was a great weekend, they upgraded us, this was a wonderful place to stay, staff was great, rooms was awsome, the entire weekend was what a weekend getaway is all about. Will definitely stay here again. Thank you sandpiper you have a wonderful place to stay.

title: Great resort!
review: This resort is a great place to stay. It is located mid island right on the beach. The rooms offer a kitchenette with a full size fridge, stove top, microwave, sink and dishes. The pools were great(went to both kids and adult pool) ! The hotel keys were waterproof wrist bands that you could wear to the beach and pool which was great! Loved the pool side room and the ability to walk right out on the beach. The hotel offers beach towels the you can exchange whenever. The staff was amazing! Overall I highly recommend this hotel for family, friends, couples, or anyone!

title: Great place to stay on Ft. Myers Beach
review: The Sandpiper is a small, quiet resort located about halfway on Estero Island, fight on the beach, with suites offering comfort and convenience. Two pools are provided, one just for adults. Umbrellas and beach chairs are offered at $15 per day, and wave riders and para- sailing are available, with guests offered a discount.  Free parking, elevators, and morning coffee are also some of the amenities. The staff is friendly and knowledgable, all units have a porch, most with an ocean view. We stayed in room 203 overlooking the adult pool, beach and ocean. Restaurants are nearby by car, and the only caution is the roadwork going on in the "Times Square" area, which can cause long delays especially in the evening.

title: Great Weekend!
review: I spent 3 nights with four friends for a short, much needed, trip. We had a wonderful time. The room and balcony were amazing. As school administrators we loved and enjoyed the adult pool area. Beach was great! Can't wait to go back with my husband!

title: I was impressed, ready to go back already!
review: What a relaxing vacation.  We booked a beach view room in the adult building, got upgraded to third floor beachfront in main building.  Great view, clean room, plenty of hot water, bed was decent, not to soft.  Kitchenette was great, full size fridge came in handy, the freezer would freeze ice just fine, but had a hard time with ice cream.  Used the gas grills 4 of our 5 nights, each night the grill tools were found clean.  The room was quiet, didn't hear much of anything on the third floor except my knees cracking as I walked up the stairs.  The beach was great, water is just steps away from the hotel, don't get me wrong, plenty of sand, but not a mile hike to the surf.  Beach service was a steal at $15 a day for two chairs and an umbrella.    Staff seemed friendly, though the…

title: Request beach front and not beach view.
review: We requested a "beach view" room and it was excellent...but I later found out the 12 units right on the beach are "beach front."  Maybe I should have known that!  Anyway, the room was large, clean and comfortable.  We were on the 2nd floor and the balcony overlooked the adult pool and the beach.  The only minor issue with the view is a large tree right in the middle of the view that bi-sects the beach view.  The staff was courteous and helpful and it was not crowded, we went during the week in May so all of the snowbirds had left.

title: Nice but efficiency rooms need updating
review: Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean but appliances needed updating. The refrigerator was missing parts and  one of the fry pans was all scratched up as well as the grill pan for the microwave. There were no glass bowls for storing food, only plastic.   There were stains on the bed ruffle as well as on the shower curtain. Bed was very comfortable but sheets did not come close to staying tucked in.   Pool was great and was kept  clean.  I enjoyed the morning coffee and newspaper.

title: Wonderful!
review: Beautiful location, clean and friendly  We really enjoyed our stay here. We based our choice by reading trip advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The location on the beach is the best. My family and I are hoping to go back next year!

Lovely hotel right on the beach front. Very quiet area. Friendly staff. We had to move rooms as the drainage blocked up in our room, but they moved us to a more superior room with no fuss and gave us some complimentary biscuits etc. There is complimentary water in the fridge in each room and a fully stocked kitchenette. Would visit again, no hesitation.

title: Nice vacation
review: My husband and I stayed here for a week. We liked everything about the hotel with the exception of its location. We had to either drive everywhere or catch the trolley. If only this place were a little closer to times square it would be perfect.

title: Nice hotel great staff
review: We arrived at the hotel in the late afternoon, easy to find and good parking place.directly on a beautiful beach and 10$ away from the time square (absolutely a recommended to go for a nice dinner out, watching the sunset!!). The day of checkout I had to go to the doctor because I was really sick, so we asked for a late check out, that was possible without extra charge till 12:00. My compliments to the lady who checked us in! Really nice and welcoming and gave us nice tips about the area, she was really kind and welcoming, one of the best check-ins I've experienced in this trip! (9 different hotels...) thank you!

title: An excellent stay
review: We booked a room with kitchenette for three nights. The reason to book it was to have a pool and beach nearby. The system they use to have access to room/pool is via a wireless bracelet which is very good you can go to the see or pool without taking your wallet/keys with you. When we arrived there was an electricity power drop but checking in was done anyhow and everybody got a free flashlight. I think this is excellent service, also the people I spoke where all very helpful and friendly. Free parking is needed in that area. Beach is good also for jetski tours and watching the sun set. Other services are the free grill for BBQ-ing and nowadays important the excellent wifi connection. The only thing I noticed was the relative low quality of the kitchen tools/cutlery and the lack…

title: Warning
review: I should have wrote this review a long time ago, but better late then never. I would love to give this resort a 5, we have been to it twice last year and loved it. The last time we stayed we got a room in the top floor and it was great, but when we stepped out to the balcony our 14 month old son got close to the rail and was able to wiggle his little body in between them. Luckily for us we were quick enough to grab him and pull him back, he was not allowed in the balcony after that. When I told the front desk they just brushed it off. Because of that I won't be going back. So please if you have young children watch them like Hawks when near the balcony and don't stay on the top floor.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
review: Stayed at the Sandpiper April 14-19, 2016.  We were very impressed with resort.  Hadn't expected it to be so nice.  We had a great room on the 5th floor, beach view.  Clean.  Kitchenette lacking a few things but great to be able to make our own breakfast, keep beer cold, have a few snacks on hand.  Beach & sand are great!  Great location.  Road construction is a hassle but what can you do?  Liked the 2 pools, 1 for family, 1 for adults.  Tiki Bar just a short walk down the beach always comes in handy!  Staff was pleasant.  Would definitely stay there again and recommend.

title: Will update on the outcome later
review: Read the post,will update later, as i posted the power has been out for a while, the lady at the fromt desk doesnt really have any customers skills she told us the store was down the street if we wanted to buy a cooler, the manager is not accessible no tv no fridge no a/c my beer is warm so i will post at another time to update the outcome, i mean come on a free dinner would be nice.

title: Nice, clean rooms directly on the beach!
review: We enjoyed our stay at the Sandpiper. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful. Our pool side second floor room overlooked the family pool and had a view of the gulf. We had two queen sized beds, sitting area with pullout bed, kitchenette and bath. The bathroom was very clean with plenty of hot water. Hair dryer provided, along with shampoo and soap. Other amenities included were a safe, iron, coffee pot, toaster, microwave, stovetop, refrigerator, water bottles, beach bag. I like having the coffee and tea bar available. Ice machine, pop machines, coin op laundry available on each floor. There is a computer in the office area for use. Wifi also provided. Books to read are available in the office for free during your stay along with various sundries for purchase that you…

title: A little tired in places but a great resort all round
review: Firstly the positives; Great location right on Fort Myers Beach, nice pool area, good size rooms, common Bar-B-Q area spotless, comfortable beds & great family atmosphere. For the negatives; Rooms are a little tired in places - particularly the kitchenette's which are both cramped and old, the outdoor patios could do with a furniture upgrade - they should have a dining table and chairs for starters, internet is fine but by no means 'rapid' (at least there is no extra charge) and finally the beach towel counting and changing each day is a little frustrating but I guess beach towels have been walking! On the whole a good option for families looking for a relaxed beach holiday close to supermarket and amenities. Would stay again.

title: Very well kept small resort with friendly staff.
review: We stayed in a 5th floor, 1 BR suite which was immaculate (elevator or stairs available).  The kitchen was adequately supplied to make, or heat, meals which we used for breakfast and lunches.  We had a beautiful view of the beach and water and although the resort was fully booked while we were there it was quiet in our condo and we felt very much at rest.  The beach is not as wide in front of this resort as it is further up the beach but it is right at your feet as you step off the resort.  We were there after a bad storm and the beach was a mess of seaweed, shells and ocean debris.  I don't think it is like that all the time, but you might want to ask to be sure.

title: Awesome experience!!  Great for families!
review: We really enjoyed our experience staying there! The front office staff was always helpful, the location, just feet from the Gulf, was incredible and the cost was not overwhelming! Definitely a place to stay if you are going with a family. 2 pools. Shuffleboard, corn hole boards. Mid Atlantic Waters ports is located directly behind the hotel, so you cant beat the convenience.

title: Great Beach Resort
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort in early February 2016.  The entire experience was really great.  The staff was very helpful with everything from correcting as slight repair in the room to suggestions for places to eat.  We had a beach front room that was very comfortable, nice kitchen and great view of the gulf.  I swam in both pools frequently and found them to be clean every day.  The beach was very nice with great views of the sunset.  I would highly recommend the Sandpiper to anyone that was looking for a great place to stay without all the glitz of the Hilton on Marco Island, and of course the stay was much less expensive.

title: Great amenities, great beach, great pool area
review: Located centrally on the Estero island, this is a nice property with cute white themed beach rooms. Has shuffle board, a wonderful pool, located right next to a commercial jetski/paddle board rental place. Has a security guard at night, free coffee, and friendly staff. They keep raising their prices each year and have priced us out though!

title: Nice room, great beach
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort for a week in March, 2016. It was our first experience with Fort Myers Beach, though we have stayed on Sanibel a couple of times. We enjoyed our stay greatly, and definitely would recommend  the Sandpiper. It is located midway down the island, well away from the major party atmosphere at the north end of the island (a plus or minus depending on your point of view), so it is fairly quiet. The room had a nice view of the gulf, and was quite comfortable, with a king-size bed with a good mattress, plenty of hot water, and a very functional kitchenette with a full refrigerator, microwave, and a cook top (no oven). Basic cookware, plates and utensils are provided, so eating in is a good option at least some of the time. There was a pleasant…

title: Excellent!!!
review: My husband and I were looking for a quick get away for our family and booked here. Couldn't have asked for a better resort!! Clean, family friendly, and the beach right outside our door! I was able enjoy the pool with our 3 year old and my husband and son enjoyed the ocean. When the kids wanted to swap we would meet at the gate. :) Can't wait for our next trip.

title: Awesome Resort, soooo worth the money!
review: I stayed here in mid February and had an amazing time. Our room was super clean, and appeared to be completely updated. It came with a full size fridge, microwave, etc. Housekeeping did an awesome job with keeping it clean and it was always cleaned in a timely manner.   Don't worry about bringing your beach chairs and umbrella. There is a company right on the beach that I think is partnered with the resort that offers beach chair and umbrella rentals ($15 a day), jet skiing, parasailing, etc.   If you're looking for a nice quiet hotel away from the busy crowds, then this is a great place! We will definitely return!!

title: Couldn't have been better!
review: I don't even have to go into the location being right on the beach, or that there really isn't a room that I could imagine you wouldn't have some view of the beach from, or the quality of the room, pool, etc.  Let's talk about something that can really ruin a trip - staff.  They were AMAZING!!!  It's apparent that this resort places a high emphasis on the quality and friendliness of staff!!  I will mention that I want to return because when I can take time off to vacation, I want to relax.  I LOVE the location away from the crowds.  I LOVE that I could walk to the grocery store via the beach :)  I love that we could grill a meal on very nice grills.  I love that there is a full kitchen for snacks or more if you want.  I loved that the trolley made getting around simple. Thank…

title: Dynamite views that provides all south Florida should
review: We hunted for a resort when the condo we always stayed at could not longer accommodate us.  The Sandpiper was a continually high-rated facility with some good amenities.  It exceeded our expectations, was ultra-clean with a beach front that's likely the best on Estero.  We'd stay back here in a heartbeat if they'd take us back!

title: A great retreat on the beach!
review: We are so happy we decided to stay mid island at the Sandpiper Resort.  We were not in all that traffic due to all the road construction or the crowds down in the north part of the island.  Our room was beachfront right next to the kiddie pool.  I thought that was going to be a problem with noise but wasn't at all. The room was spacious for the two of us and with Publix close by we were able to get some things to keep on hand for breakfast or lunch. It was wonderful having some wine and cheese right on our own patio for the spectacular sunset each night! Then, just walk out and go for a moonlight walk on the beach.   Our room was clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was very tiny, I was surprised by that, but it worked for the 2 of us. (though it might be tight for a family)…

title: Great place on the beach.
review: Wonderful place, situated directly on the beach. Large beautiful room with a well equipped kitchenette. Plenty of space for our family of four. The kids loved the pool and the beach. A publix close by, but a car is preferd if you want to dine out. Would absolutely stay here again!

title: getting to be over priced
review: supposedly has a repeater discount-forget about it-price increase of $50+ from 2014. because of remodel, at least that was the reason I was given. needed to do more than tile the floors, which was an improvement over damp carpet, and faux stone surround in the shower area, mattresses could/should be replaced. noisier than I remembered it being.

title: A Fun Spot
review: We arrived late at night after a long day of driving and decided to stay at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort for the night before going over to Sanibel for our reservations. The room was very nice with comfy beds, a kitchenette, dining table, separate room for TV watching with a couch/bed as well as a deck facing the beautiful Gulf of Mexico.  We used the beach area briefly, but didn't get to use the pool and other amenities.

title: Birthday family vacation.
review: Great place for a family vacation! Right on the beach , it has every essential thing needed, clean and comfy .you can see dolphins that come by occasionally. Also a good place to do seashells scavenger hunt. The only thing os that on the rooms there is no coffee or tea available.

title: Nice beach and pools
review: This is a modest place on the beach side of the road in Ft. Meyers Beach.  Room was comfortable with a nice balcony looking over the ocean.  Note:  no elevator, lots of stairs.  There are two nice pools, one reserved for adults.

title: Sun, lovely and comfortable
review: We stayed last week at Sandpiper Gulf Resort, and were delighted with our time there in a pool view room.  The room was beautifully decorated and the entire property is immaculate. The pool is directly on the gulf, the situation could not have been better. We look forward to returning again, and wish to thank all the staff for their courtesy and high standards.

title: great beach and view room
review: we had a very nice beachfront room with lots of upgrades and good daily housekeeping. They even provide complimentary waters and beach bag. The location is very convenient and central, although Ft Myers Beach traffic can be busy. Love that there is an adult pool. The only thing that kept this from a 5 star rating is that a couple of the desk staff were not very friendly or helpful and we did not find out until our last day that we could have used the "sister" resort facilities at the north end of the beach

title: Wonderful visit
review: We checked into The Sandpiper Resort on the day of arrival in Fort Myers, where the receptionist was extremely helpful and friendly.  We paid very good rates for a top floor balcony room with a super ocean view.  The resort and room was excellent, the swimming pool was very warm and clean, we were able to walk straight onto the beach from the resort.  The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would thoroughly recommend this resort.

title: great hotel for beach lovers
review: We didn't have a beach front room, but we did have room 239, overall one off the end overlooking the parking lot.  But what the heck, we weren't in the room much.  It was a super short walk to wither of the pools and the hotel is right on the beach.  It was a little chilly here in January and there was a major storm the night we arrived.  Local flooding and some beach erosion.    I did report to the main office that the rain had come in and pelted our door.  The bottom door jam's rubber stopper had deteriorated over time, so the rain water leaked into the room.  It took several towels to clean up the water.  They never did come and fix it while we were there, but it also didn't rain again, so harm in the short run.  But they really should fix it. There were coin op washer and…

title: Best beach view!
review: We had a 1st floor balcony overlooking the beautiful beach!  Publix is close by so we went and bought some food to eat dinner and have cocktails on our balcony while we watched the sunset.  Just incredible!  Dolphins were close to shore in the morning.  Stars at night on the beach are beautiful!  Quiet stretch with no restaurants and no crowds.  Room had big refrigerator, dishes, glasses, silverware.  Not a big resort so it's easy to get from car to room to beach or pool.  They also gave a complimentary beach bag and 2 big bottles of water!  Great spot!

title: Great location on Fort Myers Beach
review: Our first visit to Fort Myers Beach and not disappointed. We had a Beach View room and were able to watch the sunset and also saw Dolphins from the balcony. Not having to carry a key card or actual key, but use a wrist strap was very useful. The beach was so clean and easy for walking.

title: Beautiful Resort, Beautiful views
review: My husband and I planned a last minute vacation less than 3 weeks ago and decided to stay at the Sandpiper.  Our check in was very late due to the flight we had, but once we arrived the staff was very accommodating.  I had requested a quiet room with a gulf view, and we had a corner unit on the third floor which was perfect.  The weather was unusually cool with daytime highs not even reaching 70, so we took advantage of the spa and workout area at the 'sister resort'--The Pink Shell.  The staff there was wonderful, and overall we couldn't have asked for a more relaxing visit.  We were also impressed by the staff's daily cleaning of the beach area in front of the property.  No nasty debris at the Sandpiper!!  We'd highly recommend to anyone that they visit this gem.

title: Relaxing!
review: We absolutely loved our stay at the Sandpiper! Everything went so smoothly and found everyone to be very friendly and accomodating.  The views were amazing! Already planning our trip next year since we enjoyed it so much!

title: Lovely old school Florida
review: Great location on the beach yet away from the crowds. great room - loved having the kitchenette. Every room has a lanai or balcony which is nice. Very clean with all around great service. Pools are immaculate and well-heated. Great place & would stay again.

title: Cozy and Relaxing!
review: Absolutely loved our stay at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort! From check-in to check-out everything was perfect! The hotel was right on the beach and offered beautiful views of the gulf. The two pools offered family fun as well as quiet time in the adult only pool. Our room was spacious and we loved the kitchen which was equipped with everything we needed to prepare food. Guest laundry was a plus! I recommend our room, 364, beach front. Parking was right by the room, guest laundry was on floors 1 and 2. Compliments to Angel and Michelle who worked at the front desk. They were wonderful! They answered all my questions and also gave great suggestions for places to visit. Without question, if I'm in the Fort Myers Beach area again, I will definitely stay at the Sandpiper!

title: We had some pests sharing the room
review: First of all, I rated this "Average" because I don't think it's quite fair to condemn the whole property/hotel because of some insects. Otherwise, I would probably rate it lower because the minute I saw cock roaches in our room (I asked for another room, but it was a full house), it influenced my whole impression of the place. That may be unfair considering: the maids appeared to do a very thorough cleaning each day; the amenities are nice enough for an older property; the view of from our room could not be better; and the location is one of the most desirable, imho. That said, when I pay that much for accommodations (too embarrassed to say how much I paid for beach front room), I would not expect roaches to be in the room...not just upon arrival, but each day, we saw those…

title: Great place to stay!
review: We just stayed at the Sandpiper from Christmas to New Years and we loved it. The rooms are nice, great having a little kitchenette. The staff is nice and helpful. The kids loved the pool and the beach. It is a little more quiet section of Ft Myers beach, there are really no restaurants in walking distance but we had a car so we worked around that just fine. Every well maintained property.

title: Sandpiper Gulf Resort
review: I thought this was a very nice place to stay.  Easy to get to, away from the "downtown" area.  The beach was wonderful.  The staff was very accommodating and the cleaning staff was exceptional.  (Even did the dishes one day - that was NOT their job to do.)  Although I didn't use it it's nice there was an adult pool.  Sometimes you just don't want to hear the kids laughing (or fighting).  Really liked that they had grills you could use.  I would tell anyone to stay here.  Loved it.

title: Very pleasant vacation
review: We spent 10 days at the Sandpiper Gulf Hotel. It's very clean. Extremely friendly staff, good location, white sand and endless shore, fresh coffee until 11:00 pm made our vacation very pleasant. Definetly will be back next year

title: Nice place, but had a few problems
review: Nice rooms, updated, property kept up. DO NOT book court view rooms. The rooms are at the back of the hotel near the road which is noisy. Your view consist of the office building wall or a parking lot. We were willing to pay more and upgrade but the desk said there wasn't any rooms available for the length of our stay. Interestingly enough the vacancy sign was up all week! Most staff pleasant, but the front desk people weren't overly friendly! Also if you plan on driving up to the Times Square area for meals plan in at least an hour to go the 3 miles. Plenty of places to eat if you go south instead. Most likely will not be back to this hotel!!!

title: Wonderful family resort....
review: Dear grecfr, Thank you for your review. I'm glad that you found our resort to be nice, but I'm sorry to hear you were disappointed with your accommodation.
