I am happy to read that you did have a wonderful time and we look forward to welcoming you back.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Sandpiper Vacation
review: We just spent our 4 year anniversary at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort 2 weeks ago and this is a hidden paradise on the southern area of Ft Myers Beach. This was our first visit to the area and it won't be our last. The room was beautiful clean and with a full kitchen and a full size fridge you can't go wrong. Publix is only 2 minutes north. We had a huge balcony overlooking the adult pool with a killer gulf view from the 5th floor. The 2 pools are a great plus if you have kids or just want some alone time with your partner. Huge plus on the entire adult pool area and 5 story building of to the side of the resort. The hotel is doing some beautiful upgrades and renovating as needed and there was some construction noise to contend with. That issue was generously and professionally…

title: It is a very convenient location, very clean, currently remodeling, family friendly. Near grocery store and many places.
review: I love staying at Sandpiper, the family gets together there every year. Family friendly, yet if you don't want to be around children they also have a separate pool for adults. Excellent prices, clean, I love having the kitchen it is like staying in a studio apartment. Kitchen is fully equipped with dishes, pots and pans and utensils. Two queen size beds and a sofa bed, you just cant beat it.

title: Great resort and very nice personnel
review: I am delighted to know that your family meets every year at the Sandpiper. We are happy to be your favorite family resort and thank you for your highest recommendations. We look forward to welcoming you back again next year.   Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Fantastic property in every way
review: We had a pleasant stay in the Sandpiper. From the moment we arrived, the staff is very friendly.The room was very clean. Also the few steps to the beach. Free wifi. Unfortunatly we stayed 3 days. Next time we will stay longer.

title: A Quiet Getaway
review: Thank you for sharing your recent experience at our resort. I am happy to read that you found your accommodation to be clean and exactly what you had hoped for. We look forward to welcoming you back.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: A peaceful stay
review: Already plan on going back. Staff was wonderful especially An-hel at the front desk. Beach was perfect and beach front rooms made us feel it was our own private gulf. Everyone was friendly and attentive- whole place was clean and functional. We cooked in our room and used the full fridge to our advantage. The best shells we found were right out front and we went to Sanibel and Captiva beaches. The new upgraded rooms are attractive.  It was all exactly as advertised and priced very fair. As you can tell we are big fans after our week there!

title: Wonderful hotel  (Only one complaint)
review: Very nice hotel, very happy with our stay.  Clean, great location, and safe.  24 hour security was wonderful and very helpful with our bags and suggestions about what to do in the area.  We had a bit of a problem with the front desk clerk, he was very rude, (I have let the owners know about him)  But everything else was very good.  Will stay here again.  They are currently remodeling so this hotel will be even better soon!

title: Paradise in Fort Myers Beach
review: Thank you for your recent stay at our resort.  I am sorry to hear of your complaint, this has been addressed.  I am happy to know that you did have a great stay and we look forward to welcoming you back again very soon.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Great Getaway! - Clean, welcoming, relaxing and fun for entire family!
review: We found the resort on the internet and were impressed by the reviews, knowing they are not always the full truth. In this case, however, everything was correct. It's a perfect getaway. The rooms are spacious, the kitchen is small but you have everything you need, the Barbecue grills on the property are marvellous. We had a beach room on the 1st floor and enjoyed the sunset every evening with a Steak and good wine. Currently the rooms undergo some renovation (which is necessary). Thus, it should be even better in future.

title: No choice in rooms
review: Thank you for your highest recommendations.  It is so important to us to provide a true representation through our website and social media.  I am happy to know that we exceeded your expectations.  We look forward to your return on your next Fort Myers Beach vacation.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Have a Great Time
review: We needed a break from the hecticness of life.  Even though we only had four days, they were well spent at the Sandpiper!  The beaches were beautiful!  We were swimming with dolfins and watching manatees romp in the waters! The room was clean and spacious.  Loved that we could have our breakfast and lunch in our room and not take too much time away from playing in the surf or pool or shuffleboard!  Boys learned how to paddleboard and enjoyed the nature walk at sister property the Pink Shell.  It did the trick!! Everyone enjoyed their time at the Sandpiper!

title: Fantastic!
review: We've just returned from 6 nights at one of our favourite locations - Fort Myers Beach.  Having fell in love with Fort Myers Beach when we first visited 6 years ago (stayed at the Pink Shell) we were so excited to be returning and we were not disappointed.  We were a little bit nervous about staying a smaller hotel with limited facilities but we loved everything about this hotel.   The staff were very welcoming and happy to provide some local knowledge.  Free use of beach towels - with clean/fresh ones never in short supply - is always a nice touch for us Brits.  We had an oceanfront room (which was unexpected as we had only booked a pool view) and it was lovely.  Very comfy beds, lovely shower and a much bigger kitchenette than expected.  The terrace on the ground floor was of…

title: Fantastic, convenient, clean and fun!!!
review: I am delighted to hear that you had such a great time and that you are already planning your next visit!  Thank you for submitting this review and we look forward to welcoming you back on your next Fort Myers Beach vacation.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Fun, Friendly Family Resort
review: Quaint resort, clean rooms, family friendly, beach access- great place to stay!! Can't wait to come back!! Beach has umbrella and chair rentals for $13 per day. They also have jet ski and SUP board rentals too!!

title: A very good resort for families
review: Thank you for this nice review of the Sandpiper Gulf Resort.  I am happy to know that you had a relaxing vacation at our resort.  We are devoted to providing our guests with all the elements to create a memorable stay.  Cleanliness and helpfulness of staff is all very important to us and a continuous effort to maintain and enrich.  We look forward to your next visit!  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Great place to enjoy the beach away from the crowds
review: Stayed in a ground floor courtyard view unit for a week with our family if four.  Room was very clean and was cleaned every day. Beds were comfortable. Room had a hair dryer, flat screen TV with HBO, safe, microwave, full fridge, and two burner range. There was plenty of closet and drawer space for our stuff as well as ample space to eat and relax. High quality toiletries were provided too. Towel service was available for beach towels.   The family pool is fun to hang around and has a great view. The resort is right in the beach and about 100 feet from the Gulf. We saw several Dolphin during our stay, and the beach is great for shelling and finding various sea critters.   So many nice restaurants on and around the island. We spent a day at the sister resort at the other end if…

title: Very nice place
review: Just got back from 4 days vacation , stayed in beach front room amazing , first floor , huge balcony , clean , nice room .nice staff , can't complain really nice place .just maybe some tiki bar would be nice or game room for kids .

title: Beautiful beach view!
review: Thank you for the excellent review of our resort.  We are delighted to read that you found great value in our staff and accommodations.  We hope to see you again and we will continue to provide you with the great service you expect to receive at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Will Return Soon
review: We just spent 7 days at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort, and hope to come back next year! The room was clean, the staff very friendly and helpful, and the beach was only steps away! I was surprised how quiet it was after 10:00, no kids running around or loud music blaring. They have two nice, clean gas grills for the guests to use, and we used them many times.   They have very large, soft beach towels for guests, and you turn them in anytime for clean ones. They also have onsite beach chair rentals for $13 a day, but we purchased two down the street at Publix for $10 each. The Publix was just down the street, and we bought all our groceries there.  They also rent waverunners (discounted price for guests) and parasailing trips. We rented wave runners on our last full day, and wished we…

title: Great place, friendly staff.  Perfect vacation getaway!
review: We are happy to read you had such a great time and are planning a return trip.  Thank you for submitting a review of our property and for sharing your great experience with others.  We look forward to your return.    Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Beautiful Beach, Great Location
review: We recently stayed 4 days here and honestly can't wait to go back.  In fact, we hope go to again next summer.  Pros: Smaller resort so it wasn't crowded, pool side rooms are excellent for kids (my daughter loved running out the sliding glass door & jumping in the pool), just steps away from the beautiful white sand, comfortable beds, and friendly/helpful staff.  Cons: I wish the bathrooms were larger & the stove needs updated. No elevator so request a ground floor if you can't do stairs.

title: Great hotel
review: Stayed here for the 4of july. Had a great experience. We were in the penthouse which was roomy and offered great view of the gulf and pool. Loved The BBQ grills throughout the facility. Hotel was a few miles from downtown. Water sports offered right on the facility such as jet skiing parasailing etc. Can't wait to go back!

title: Perfect Staycation
review: Thank you for your review and for giving us such a wonderful rating!  We are so happy you enjoyed your stay at the Sandpiper and we look forward to your return.    Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Happy 4th July weekend
review: As a local I try to stay twice a year. I love the Sandpiper, it is perfect for my lil family of 3. The convenience of the kitchens in the room and the BBQ grills on the pool deck are priceless with a two year old. We love the staff and the location. We have not been back this year but definitely will plan for a fall trip. Can't wait to stay here again!

title: Nice Place
review: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Sandpiper as we really enjoy serving our local guests!  We look forward to seeing you in the Fall.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Did not stay here, but wished I had!
review: Stayed here for a week nice and relaxing place beachfront resort. It was nice to get away from work and do some fishing,sun tanning ,wave runners,one pool for kids and another one for adults. Small kitchen also four BBQ to grill your fresh catch or steak. Store are close to the place . Watch the fireworks from the balcony was great. The place did get crowded for the 4th July weekend so reserve early.It was nice to walk thru the beach and not wanting to go home.

title: Repeat Customer
review: I've stayed here several times and I keep coming back.  I've had a courtyard view, a partial beach view, and an island view.  All of the rooms were clean, accommodating, and the beds were comfortable.   I love the key bracelets so I can wander the beach and not worry about holding anything.  The staff is very helpful and answers to any concerns.  The only drawback I had was the island view room layout.  I like to sleep in very cold temperatures and the air tends to blow directly to the kitchen area so the bed area closest to the door stays warm.  Other than that, every time I've ever stayed there was absolutely excellent and I will definitely be back.  I hope to do ocean front next time and have the comparison of all the different types of rooms.

title: Great family place to stay.
review: Thank you for returning to the Sandpiper year after year!  It is our pleasure to provide you with the kind of stay that inspires you to come back.  See you on your next visit.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: We loved this place
review: The room fits our family of 6 perfectly.  The kitchen comes fully equipped and has a small table with 4 chairs.  The room has 2 queen beds and a queen sofa sleeper.  Clean rooms, pool area very nice and maintained.  Love that the keys for the rooms that are actually rubber wristbands you wear and they can get wet.  No loosing the key card.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Coffee served all day as well as hot water for tea,  They also have books in the lobby you can borrow while you stay and inflatable rafts that you can borrow.  They do have beach towels you can get on a daily basis.

title: A great choice for a relaxing vacation
review: I am so delighted to read that you enjoyed your recent stay at the Sandpiper.  We are happy to offer the amenities you mentioned to enhance your experience.  We look forward to your next visit.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Nice place on the beach
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper from April 29th until May 9th, 2014. We had a pool suite, number 120, first floor with a private terrace on ground level, right next to the pool deck, with a low shrub for separation. All the first floor pool suites are alike. There are 2 double beds which have upgraded mattresses. There is a front entrance door off the parking lot and a sliding window wall at the rear for pool deck and patio areas access. The layout is great. A small private bathroom with updated fancy tiling has bath and shower, with adjacent powder room, sink and mirror, open to the sleeping area, and a large (for a hotel room) closet.   The kitchen was very well equipped as far as cookware and dishes and flatware and all of the necessary gadgets like toaster, can opener, spatulas,…

title: wonderful!
review: just spent 5 nights (not long enough!) at this gem. we paid for a beachview room, but were upgraded to beachfront. love the size of this resort---it's not a big high-rise like so many others. there are 2 pools, one for adults only, which is very relaxing. all staff are friendly and helpful. the rooms are clean and comfy with beautiful furnishings. there is a partial kitchen with full-size fridge-freezer and microwave, a 2-burner cooktop, toaster and coffee pot, pots/pans, dishes, glassware and utensils. there is an electronic safe in the closet, which is nice to have. we rented chairs and an umbrella on the beach  for $13/day. beach is wide and flat and has powder-soft white sand.the only thing missing that would make this place perfect is a poolside tiki bar!

title: Sandpiper is a great choice for families and couples alike.
review: I am pleased to know that you had a wonderful stay at the Sandpiper.  Our quaint resort is a great place for relaxation and I am so glad that you agree.  We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to Fort Myers Beach.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Perfect beach and location
review: Sandpiper is a great choice for families and couples alike.  The resort feels secluded and quaint with its courtyard. We love to use the small kitchen and the gas grills in the court yard.  The grills had clean grilling utensils and were well maintained.  The 'adult only' pool is a great advantage for those without small children.  The hotel is right on the beach so you don't have to pack a cooler and drag a ton of stuff to spend the day on the sand.  We have stayed her several times and would certainly recommend it.  The only thing that would make it better is if the hotel allowed small dogs.

title: Awesome Experience
review: Thank you for returning to the Sandpiper and thank you for sharing your wonderful experience with other travelers.  I am delighted to know that you enjoyed your stay and all that we have to offer our guests.  We look forward to your return.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: just perfect
review: Stayed on third floor with ocean front view- beautiful!  Staff at front desk (Kelly checked us in), were very attentive and helpful... The location is just far away from the main area of downtown Ft. Myers Beach, that you feel comfortable and relaxed from dealing with the touristy environment you can be exposed to at other places... A calm beach where we were thrilled to see some dolphins and manatees swim slowly by- the sand dollars and the starfish were abundant...We took our own chairs and had plenty of area to put up a couple of umbrellas and veg out on the beach....If you want to relax and lounge in the florida sun, this is your utopia...I've visited over dozens of beaches through the years and this one has all the perks...rental toys, white sand, calm waters, grocery store…

title: a very yellow but nice place
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper Resort for two nights and throughly enjoyed the visit.  The hotel is of the old architectual design with exterior door leading directly to outside walkway.  This works well in beach places because of the sand issues but is not the most secure design.  They used RFID loaded plastic bracelets for keys and I did wonder how they would change lock code between visitors.  Room was great with two very comfortable queen beds.  It has kitchen area with stove top, microwave, sink, and full size frig.  Nice closet with security safe.  Bathroom was nice with separate toliet/shower room.  A night light in toliet area would be nice addition.  Our balcony overlooked the courtyard which was fine with us.  We spent almost the whole day on the beach using $13 per day…

title: Reviews can be misleading...
review: Thank you for your highest recommendations of the Sandpiper.  I am glad that you enjoyed your visit and the time spent on the beach.  The wristbands are programmed in the same way as other resort card keys.  Reprogrammed for each guest and very safe.  We look forward to your next visit to Fort Myers Beach.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Nice Location and Beach
review: I booked my stay through Expedia, and after reading some of the reviews here I decided to call the  resort directly.  I spoke with Joanna, who seems to be the person who handles the bookings through these travel sites.  She checked my reservation and assured me that the room I booked with Expedia is indeed the room I will be getting.  Also asked about the "no elevator" issue, as I am in my 60's and have COPD, which makes it very difficult if not impossible for me to be climbing staircases in the Florida heat and humidity.  Again, she assured me she would be putting in a request for my reservation, for a room on the ground floor.  All you need to do is call, and be pleasant, it's amazing how responsive people can be when you start out with a smile in your voice!

title: Unexpected boutique gem
review: I am so happy that we were able to meet your requests.  Thank you for mentioning Joanna, she is a wonderful part of our team.  Thank you and we will see you again on your next vacation.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: It was great.
review: When we booked, which was well in advance, we had put in a request for an upper floor room. Although the request was their computer it wasn't taken into consideration. We accually got a lecture from the desk clerk on how booking should be made directly through the hotel and not a third party like Hotels.com, travelosity, Orbitz etc.. While at the desk another couple was checking in and although they had varificatio of booking they didn't get the room classification they had booked and paid for.They received the same lecture on "you shouldn't book through third party sites, book directly with us". The clerk made it clear he wasn't happy with bookings not made directly through their hotel. However after check-in everyhing else went reasonably well. The hotel room was clean with a…

title: Excellent location & price
review: I was skeptical picking a non chain smaller hotel but was looking for a good price and beach front was a must. The hotel was quiet, rooms were newly renovated, and clean. The beach here is beautiful, white sands and shorter beach so very convenient from room. There is no restaurant or  bar but Pubix grocery store is literally 1 minute away, we bought groceries for lunch and packed a lunch for the beach everyday and ate out for breakfast and dinner. There are grills by the pool so many were grilling but we did not. With the $400.00 I saved from staying at a chain hotel we spent on renting a pontoon boat for a day at Snookbite which is 1 minute away... That was our best day here... Boat was 240.00 + 18.00 gas for the day... All you need is a drivers license. This location is 7…

title: Great place to stay!
review: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Sandpiper for your recent Fort Myers Beach vacation.  I am pleased that we provided everything you were hoping for.  We hope to have you back again soon.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Our time here was better than expected! Will return.
review: The staff is very friendly and helpful and the beach location is second to none.  The hotel is definitely removed from the action of Times Square; we bought a 3 day Trollee pass for $3.50 and used that to get around with no problems. There aren't restaurants by the resort, we ended up going to the Publix grocery store and bought food since the room came with a kitchenette.  The hotel also provides grills which was awesome for cooking up some steaks as the sun set.  Our room was large and clean. Our view was of the parking lot, but you could see the beach and ocean from it.   The adults only pool was very nice, the only thing I would suggest is to add more umbrellas as there are only two and it would be nice to have more shade.

title: clean, comfortable, courteous
review: I am so happy that you found the Sandpiper to be a great place on Fort Myers Beach.  Thank you for your suggestion to add more umbrellas to the pool deck.  We appreciate feedback that can assist us in providing a great vacation for you, our guest.  We look forward to serving you again.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Beautiful location and rooms.
review: Picked this resort from other reviews and placement on the island and so glad we did. Area is wonderful, rooms clean and quiet and nicely set up with amenities to stay awhile, along with two grocery stores nearby.  Can take cheap cabs from here to anywhere or walk, bike whatever.  Rooms very clean, quiet at night and safe. 2 queen beds with a sleeper couch-awesome and comfortable too. Beach area and pools very clean and so were the trees and plants.  The best part was the staff-excellent service.  I was closing on a house in Orlando the day of check in and needed a computer, printer and fax to sign forms and they helped with everything to make this possible to be done this way-way to go everyone!!! Check in took about 10 minutes and check out about 2 minutes- Loved everything…

title: A perfect combination
review: I have stayed in four different motels on Ft. Myers beach. I am always searching for the perfect room, the perfect view, the perfect pool. I finally found one in the Sandpiper Resort.  It had a friendly atmosphere, a nicely appointed room, great views, and a fantastic Beach. I brought my grandchildren and had a pool view room. They loved it!  Another time I came by myself and enjoyed the quiet of the adult pool and privacy. The beach is so easily asessible (you don't trudge for miles to get to the ocean. Next time I want to stay in the ocean front room and treat my son to a nice Florida experience. I am not sure which floor to choose. I am thinking the second floor would be perfect.!!

title: A great value vacation resort
review: I am so happy that you found the perfect place on Fort Myers Beach in the Sandpiper Gulf Resort.  We look forward to when you return again with your grandchildren.  Warm regards,  Bonni Davis-Delizia General Manager

title: Great resort with personality!
review: Just got back from a week stay.  Suite almost like a 1 bedroom apartment. We had a beach view location.  The deck had an outstanding view of the Gulf.  A few cleanliness issues and 1 AC unit did not work, but was replaced immediately by maintenance.  Location is mid-island about 2 plus miles from Times Square.  Easy bike ride, but it would be tough walking. The area is mostly small resorts and houses around Sandpiper.  Staff is friendly and accommodating. Having the adult pool was a great plus for us.  They have a sister resort called the Pink Shell which you can use their facilities also. Good time had by both of us.

title: Sleep with the door open
review: Thank you for spending your valuable time at our resort for your vacation.  I am happy to know that your concerns were addressed quickly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to do so.  We look forward to your return.  Kind regards,  Maredith Rizzo Social Media Analyst

title: Fab location
review: This place was amazing.  We came late at night and still the desk staff was so kind and helpful.  The room was clean and spacious, and the indoor plaza with mini golf was such a treat!!  I will definitely stay here again!

title: Great Location for the price
review: I chose this hotel for a break from Orlando and it was located on the beach with a good price.  It is located a good bit down from the "centre" on estero boulevard, which is fine if you are driving, if not, there is a trolley which is very frequent.  The only downside to this is there is only one road in and out and there can be a build up of traffic at peak times.  The actual hotel location is great, right on the beach.  We didnt opt for a beach front view as after reading reviews a lot of the pool views had beach views.  We could see the ocean right from out terrace which was great.  Check in was effortless,there were two complimentary bottles of water in our room along with a "sandpiper" beach bag, nice touches.  The room was fine, two queen sized beds, full bathroom, bath…

title: Staycation
review: Thank you for this lovely review of the Sandpiper.  We are happy that you enjoyed your stay.  We hope to welcome you back to our resort on your next visit to Fort Myers Beach.  Kind regards,  Maredith Rizzo Social Media Analyst

title: Sandpiper Gulf Resort
review: My husband and I purchased a staycation through a local radio station last June. We had a year to use it and it was for 3 days, 2 nights at the Sandpiper. Check-in was at 4 pm, so much for day 1. Checkout was at 11 am, day 3!! The room was okay - sitting area, full kitchen, balcony which over looked the pool with screaming kids, and a few small roaches in the dressing area. It had a coffee pot but no coffee. There was no continental breakfast, and no elevator. I asked the desk lady what the usual rate is and was told with tax - $310 per night. REALLY?  It is on the beach but you have to pay for chairs and an umbrella on the sand. Parking is limited and tight. There are no restaurants within walking. There is a grocery store about a mile away. Afternoon traffic heading off the…

title: Awesome time at the Sandpiper.  Low key, friendly staff and great beach!
review: I'm sorry to read that your experience was not quite what you were expecting.  Like many resorts, our rates vary depending on the time of year.  The months of February, March, and April are when the Fort Myers Beach area receives the most visitors.  The Sandpiper is a quaint and family friendly resort that is loved by many.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back.  Kind regards,  Maredith Rizzo Social Media Analyst

title: Enjoyable and relaxing - friendly people and nice amenities.  I would recommend this resort
review: The hotel was very nice.  Our room was situated beachfront with lovely views.  I do not think I would have felt the same way if we were located next to the pool area.  Front desk staff were very helpful and informative.  One thing to note is that the property is situated a bit out of the downtown/central ("Times Sq.") area of Ft. Myers Beach and you may need to rely on the Trolley for meals and shopping. There is no food available at this resort.

title: Paradise for a Family
review: It is hard to believe that there could be better buys for your money than the Sandpiper Gulf Resort.  While not huge and pretentious, you couldn't ask for a more relaxing, attractive, convenient nest on the beach. And the coffee is always fresh and hot. Two nicely sized pools [one for adults only, one for 'family'] both within 50 yards of the gulf; lovely landscaping around the pool deck with lots of deck loungers. The soft white sand is gorgeous and the sunsets are unbelievable!

title: right on the beach
review: The rooms are very clean and the staff do a great job. They've done some updates and it shows. Still some updates for style to go but really is a great place to stay on the beach. Comfortable beds. Parking is limited and one night we return late and had to park down the beach at a friends. The security gating works great but bangs when people are careless. Kitchen does not have an oven but just enough for our vacation - I'd rather not be cooking all the time. Lot's of kids in the pool but there is also an adult pool that's lovely. And you can rent chairs and umbrellas as well as all kinds of sports stuff just out front.

title: Right on the beach mid-island
review: Just stayed here for spring break. The rooms have a full sized refrigerator, microwave, 2 burner stove, and dishes, silverware, & pots and pans. Even though we had a pool view room you could still see the beach/ocean from our balcony. Quiet part of the beach away from the college spring break crowd, but we had our college age son with us so we ventured down to Times Square so he could be among kids his own age. We enjoyed this resort, just hated the slow traffic heading to Times Square - not the resort's fault. Very friendly staff as well.

title: Good place to stay.
review: Got the last room as a walk in so paid the full price. The rooms are a bit dated for European taste but practical with a small kitchenette. We went shopping and made our own continental breakfast there for two mornings and they were the best breakfasts of the whole trip overlooking the sea and the wonderful beach. The room was clean, the staff were friendly on check in and out.  The roads were chaotic, no fault of the hotel but a warning for anyone in a hurry, we queued every time we left the hotel grounds.

title: Beautiful resort right on the beach.
review: We booked a second floor room right on the beach.  We could open the sliding glass door to our balcony, leave the screen door closed, and let the sound of the ocean lull us to sleep.  This worked because the hotel is located mid island, where it is less touristy and quiet.  Beautiful view from our balcony.  Made coffee and tea in our kitchenette and watched the dolphins go by each morning.  There are two pools, one adults only, but we used the family pool because it was closer to our room and there weren't a lot of kids there.  The kids who were there were quiet and well behaved.  Housekeeping wasn't prompt.  A lot of times they didn't get to our room until early to mid afternoon, but that wasn't too big a deal since we were on vacation and didn't care, but if this type of thing…

title: Great view!
review: Nice resort. Great view. Nice balcony. Housekeeping was not great , parking horrible....those would be only two complaints. Pools were very nice. First time to ft Myers beach was told fitness center was located at sister property did not realize sister property was miles away I assumed they were close. My fault for not asking needless to say we did not work out in their fitness center.

title: Beautiful resort on powdery white sand Ft Myers Beach
review: My wife and I loved our stay at this beach front resort.  Friendly staff.  Two pools, one for families with children, second for just adults.  Clean, spacious room with king bed, separate family room, equipped kitchenette and large lanai/balcony overlooking 6 miles of gorgeous powdery white sand beach.  Great escape from Chicago's never ending winter.   Highly recommend.

title: BEAUTIFUL, wonderful staff, great room and perfect stretch of beach!!!
review: Booked an inferior room on the internet and couldn't stay there.  Stopped here luckily! Beautiful stretch of beach, lovely rooms and friendly, helpful staff.  Hope to stay here again, love it! Not as congested as boardwalk area, feels more private.  We have a kitchenette and all balconies have views of the water.  You will love this place!!!

title: Great Stay!
review: We stayed in a gulf view room that had a gorgeous view from the balcony. The room was clean and had a great set up with sliding dividing doors between the bedroom area and the living room kitchen area where the fold out sofa was. It had a very nice walk in closet and a modern, clean bathroom area. The kitchen area was small but well stocked with cookware and dishware and had a coffee maker, microwave and full fridge. There was a TV in both areas which was great since we were there with a child. Free wifi which reached out even to the beach area was very handy. The adult pool was immaculate and very peaceful to hang out in. We didn't use the family pool but it looked just as clean. They also had shuffleboard and corn hole games near the family pool. The services on the beach for…

title: Very enjoyable weekend.
review: We recently stayed at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort Feb 15-19. We booked a beach view room , and really enjoyed the view from the balcony. It was nice having the rental company in front of the resort. We rented beach chairs every day, and went parasailing, and rented a wave runner one day. Beautiful beach and weather was perfect. Estero Blvd was bumper to bumper most afternoons, and early evening. We had a wonderful vacation.

title: Stay at the Sandpiper!
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper for our anniversary the week of Valentines day. It was great! This was our second time staying there and I wa much better. The last time we were down, the carpets were in need of a cleaning and the air conditioner seemed to be failing because there was a humid feel in the room....but we were right on the beach so it's to be expected. The room we had this time was renovated and was great! We will definetly be back.. We were told upon arriving about the rentals available on the beach. Chairs for a great price and jet ski rentals if you are so inclined...I did witness one guest being extremely rude to the beach attendant because he didn't understand why the chairs were rentals....so just be aware EVERYTHING isn't free. Lol. They do have coffee downstairs…

title: Great beach front property !!
review: We recently stayed at the sandpiper gulf resort feb 8-15.  Tho location was excellent for everything in the fort myers beach area...  We got a great rate and enjoyed our stay there .. We had a pool view that also had partial ocean view ...  Sunsets from our balcony were gorgeous.   If I had any critique, it would be no dishwasher and limited counter space to cook... There was a note saying dishes were not sterilized, I would assume because there was no dishwasher..  The room was a bit outdated, but again for the price, it was satisfactory..  It was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful !!!  We wish we were able to stay a extra week 😎

title: Great beach front hotel!
review: My husband and I stayed at the Sandpiper for one week. The resort is located toward the south end of the island and is away from the busyness of the north end. We would recommend renting bikes because Estero Blvd. is always busy and it's hard to get around with a car. There is a tram service, but we found it does not run on time, which is understandable due to the traffic. We stayed in a king suite beach view unit in the high tower. Our only criticism would be that the rooms are a little dated and could be updated, but we were told they are working on this. Our balcony overlooked the adult pool and the beach. We were extremely satisfied with our stay as we loved being right on the beach, the grounds were well-kept, and the staff was friendly and helpful.  We would definitely…

title: Sandpiper Gulf Front spectacular beach
review: My husband and I stayed Feb. 2014.  Rooms had full kitchens and sitting area plus a patio.  Only steps to a gorgeous beach with watersports rentals on the property. Two nice pools, one for adults only which was peaceful. Excellent experience and highly recommend. The only criticism I have is the traffic along Ft. Meyers beach is horrible in February.

title: Winter get away
review: After reading all the wonderful reviews we booked three nights for late January.  We had a beach front room with a wonderful view of the beach which is the only nice thing I can say about our room. The place is outdated and badly in need of new carpet and drapes and beds. Both double beds were uncomfortable the mattress pad was old and would not stay on the bed. The front of the cupboards in the little kitchen area were sticky and dirty. The dishes in the cupboard were the same I rewashed the ones we used. The second night we were there we saw a rat in the pool. When there is one rat I am sure there are more. we asked for a refund for our last night, the staff were very nice about it and promptly granted our request. Ft Meyers beach  is crowded and the traffic is horrible.…

title: Great Beach
review: We booked 4 nights at the Sandpiper on fairly short notice. Our unit was a ground floor beachfront room. There were 2 double beds, which in future we will avoid as it was just too small for comfort.  The kitchen area is small, there were 2 burners, a microwave and a full size fridge. It is better equipped for snack preparation rather than full meal preparation.  The best feature was large patio with 2 loungers, 2 chairs and 2 side tables. (Upper units had only 2 chairs and one table.)  Though, during most of the day there would be little shade on the patio.  We found that the drapes could do with a good washing and that the area under the beds are infrequently vacuumed.  The beach is wonderful, great for walking and shell collecting.

title: Winter Get Away
review: The Sandpiper is like a home away from home. The staff is always friendly and  the rooms are keep clean. Hot coffee and tea is always available by the pool area. The beach and the pool area are clean and never to crowded even in the high season. The Staff at the Sandpiper are all professional people. Kelly, Angel, Eric, Tim & Mike always make us feel welcome and at home.

title: We love this place
review: This was our 2nd stay here and we hope to return again next year.  The staff is friendly and helpful, especially Tim.  The beach is wonderful and the resort is very nice and relaxing.  Happy hour at The Beached Whale has great Mussels and flatbreads, SOB (Smoked Oyster Bar) is another great place to eat.  The trolley service to Times Square was the only disappointment as it was late.

title: So Happy We Found The Sandpiper!
review: We drove over to Ft Myers Beach, with no reservations for New Year's Eve, figuring we'd find something. We usually stay closer to the pier, but, nothing available. We had seen some vacancies coming in from the South, so, we started back down. One of the extended rental properties, sorry, can't remember which one, recommended that we check out the Sandpiper. So friendly and inviting! We lucked out, got the last room, which was on the second floor with two double beds, and VERY well-priced for anytime but especially for a holiday. They have two pools, one adult-only and a very nice coffee/tea bar, open almost all the time, and grills for your own cookouts, and shuffleboard. We did walk to the pier, about three miles, for the fireworks.  Good exercise, but, bicycles would have been…

title: Perfect getaway, beautiful property
review: This is a great resort with all the amenities you could want for a beach vacation, loved the beachfront ocean view 1st floor room. Angel at the front desk was so nice and friendly. The pool and courtyard area are perfectly clean and maintained it reminded us of a Disney resort! Would love to return for a quiet peaceful beach vacation. Thank you Sandpiper!

title: Memories
review: My grandmother and her other snowbird friends have stayed here for over 20 years, so I had many memories.  I brought my husband and kids for our son's 16th birthday and we had a great time!  Everything was awesome!  Everything I remembered from visiting the snowbirds!  The resort was clean and very secure.  It is great to have the pool that over looks the beach.  We stayed in a courtyard view room - grandma always stayed in poolside view.  All of the rooms are GREAT no matter which one you choose.  Beautiful white sandy beach, great heated pool, and excellent shelling!  Excellent choice!  We will be starting our own family tradition every year now by staying at the Sandpiper in December.  Thanks ;)

title: service
review: Again we had a beautiful stay at the Sandpiper, At the 2. day we had a problem, which was solved directly(within 2 hours) Compliments to staff -Angel, who offered us a beachfrontroom as an alternative, We have been here now for several years and we still loved this place. We have a  suggestion: It would be nice as management decide to refresh the rooms, after all the British West Indies design (2004) needs some changes

title: another "staycation" at the Sandpiper
review: We have been staying at the Sandpiper a couple times a year for some time now.  We've stayed in all of the buildings.  This time we stayed in the Tower because it was advertised as handicap accessible since I am now using a walker.  This is a misnomer for several reasons--only a few handicap parking spaces (usually taken), no shower chair, no seat or vanity stool at the bathroom sink to name the more glaring ones.  It is still a lovely place with a great view from our large balcony, but we'll have to look elsewhere next time.  If you are healthy and mobile this fine--if not. well.....  Also is there no ice machine in the Tower.  Our freezer barely worked and this was very inconvenient.

title: Dolphins and pelicans at your back door!
review: The Sandpiper Gulf Resort is an excellent choice for a beach vacation!  Its all about the location.  The resort is directly on great strip of white soft sugar sandy beach (and the building is very near the water, so you are not walking 1/4 mile every time you go back to your room).  When we were there in early December, we were treated to wild dolphins playing and feeding near shore every day, with pelicans swooping and diving for fish all around... very fun to watch.  Beach umbrella and 2 chairs can be rented for $13/day, and jet skis are also on property for rent at $79/hr for resort guests.  There are also jetski dolphin tours that run from there.  Weather was in the 80s nearly every day, so we enjoyed the 2 pools as well as the gulf.    The property is a little older but…

title: Lovely Holiday Getaway
review: The Sandpiper Gulf Resort was a lovely hotel located directly on Fort Myers Beach with all of the amenities that I needed. We were greeted cordially and shown to our room with assistance. The room was spacious with two televisions, comfortable bed and separate living area. The view of the beach from the balcony was just wonderful and the walking on the beach was a great way to unwind. It was a quiet and romantic holiday getaway that was truly needed and I would recommend it highly. There were many restaurants and shops nearby with friendly and welcoming staff.

title: Ever go back to same place twice?
review: This was a return trip to the Sandpiper.  We first stayed around the mid 90’s and liked the experience so much that we’ve since stayed at other places in the same area and various other gulf resorts on what must be seven or eight occasions.   An apartment overlooking the beach suits us perfectly.  Miles of white sand, blue seas, watching the sun set with a glass or two of California’s finest.  Pelicans skimming the surf and sandpipers escorting you along the beach on that morning stroll.  Even having breakfast whilst watching the occasional dolphin or three just off the beach. Well, all of that was present this time but time has not been good to the Sandpiper – at least not to our beachfront room.  Perhaps we have got used to better things over the years but we were very…

title: Excellent recreational resort
review: The family spent four days at this resort in july 2013. The staff were showed first class hospitality and the room - well, what can we say other than; fantastic! Top floor, large room for the four of us, a balcony with the best view in the Gulf.... The beach was excellent - with potential for water sports at location. We had a fun half day exploring the mangroves by jet skies - highly recommendable :-) All in all a "must stay" resort. If possible - we will come back!

title: Beautiful
review: My 5 day trip was awesome. I left totally relaxed. The weather was beautiful, buffet breakfast at Jacks by the Pink Shell was great! The area is nice most places around were friendly but overall this is a nice place to stay.

title: What a beautiful Place
review: We like the relaxed atmosphere. The Location is beautiful. The staff is very friendly and helpfuly. Its a wonderful place to relax and watching sunsets. Wie like to Walk on the beach and to watch to Sunset and Golf. Wie Take a coffee and went to our private Balcony, Thata all wie need.

title: What a great place for a vacation....
review: Great hotel - the rooms are spacious, clean and the kitchens had everything we needed, the location is perfect with a beautiful beach - perfect for watching the sunsets!  great weather & friendly staff - what more could you ask for. We have loved our 10 days here. We will definitely be back!

title: Sehr zufrieden
review: We were in November of this beautiful facility and were very satisfied. The location is fantastic - right on the beach almost white - sunsets and dolphins, including the morning. The plant is in very good condition. The garden is very well maintained, the staff very friendly and helpful. There is free coffee and a great free BBQ station.

title: Wonderful location for a relaxing beach stay.
review: Following a busy week in Orlando this was just what we needed. Much slower relaxed atmosphere. Beach amazing, i would definately recommend spending a little more and getting a beach view balcony. Watching dolphins swimming past in the morning and breathtaking sun sets.

title: One night stay. GREAT
review: Nice room, Very close proximity to the beach. Gulf front balcony room. Very comfortable bed, Two doubles was sufficient for us but King rooms are available. Full kitchen with coffee pot, microwave and full sized fridge.  LOVED IT. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Absolute BEST Resort on FMB, for relaxing, couple and family fun.
review: Sandpiper is the BEST Resort on FMB.  Clean, Friendly, Comfortable.  Couples, family and child friendly.  Close to everything.  Staff is wonderful.  Rooms are everything and more.  Reasonable prices, poolside, beachview or beachfront.  Good luck finding a nicer, friendlier resort.

title: Wonderful location!!!
review: I can't say enough about the location of the Sandpiper. Right on the beach, dolphins swimming by everyday. While the decor may be dated, the place is CLEAN and well maintained. I will be staying here again!

title: On the Beach!!
review: When the Pink Shell couldn't accommodate us for a couple of nights, they recommended this sister property.  We very much enjoyed how close our rooms were to the beach. Only real negative was no elevator.  Staff very nice.  Rooms clean. We enjoyed the adults pool. Good restaurants within close driving distances.  Allowed us to check in early, which was good, since we had to vacate our condo at Pink Shell by 11 AM. We had two rooms, one on each end of the building, so each room had side view and corner balcony's, which I recommend. Sea wasn't very pretty/clean, due to the recent water from Lake Okeechobee and storm, but that's not Sandpiper's fault.  We rented beach chairs and umbrella's, and the rental guy was friendly and helpful. They also have jet ski & paddle board rentals.…

title: Perfect stay at Fort Myers Beach
review: Sandpiper resort was a perfect place to stay for relaxation. The beach is just in the front and the staff is very friendly and  you get the good holiday feeling. You should be aware, however, that some rooms front the road, which have heavy traffic in week-ends and certain times of the year and may be disturbing during the night. Make sure you get a room fronting the beach with balcony. The rooms are spacious and beds very good. Everything you need in the kitchen and grills for free use in the public areas.

title: Great Place on the Beach
review: Arrived tired after a long drive from Cape Canaveral. Tim the receptionist made us welcome fom the first minute, our room had great facilities, 2 double beds, living area, flat screen tv, Full size Frige freezer, two hob cooker. microwave, patio room next to the pool and steps from the beach, Gas BBq grills, everything you could want on a fabulous unspoilt beach. Oh and a free beach bag in the room, free coffee all day and free newspaper. could keep going all day!!

title: Great location
review: Lost count of the number of times we have been to Florida for vacation.  However, this was our first trip to the Fort Myers Beach area.  Loved everything!  Great food, fishing, going to area attractions and all were reasonably priced. This place will head the list for our next trip to Florida.

title: Always the Sandpiper resort
review: My husband and I have been staying at the Sandpiper for at least 15 years.  We just returned and as always had the best time. Walking the beach, cooking in your room or on the grill they provide for guest to use. You have almost everything you need here as you do at home. We always stay beach front 1st floor. It is more expensive but truly worth it. The rooms do need to be updated but we love the Sandpiper, it's view of the gulf is breath taking and they have the best beach.

title: A wonderful place to stay!!
review: We had a wonderful stay here.  The location is directly on the beach and the beach is very nice here.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  The courtyard setting is very relaxing.  We also liked the fresh coffee that was ready at 6:00 am every morning.  Would definitely recommend this resort to anyone who likes a nice quiet place to relax.

title: Definition of vacation
review: We just return from a wonderful stay at the Sandpiper resort.  We stayed in the north tower.  Our room was large with a fully furnished kitchen.   Full size refrigerator.   The balcony was huge with a fantastic view of the gulf.   The resort has the softest sandy..trust me, we walked the beach many times during our stay and the Sandpiper was the closest to the beach and had the best sand.   I love the fact that you could just walked out the door and be on the beach.  For those that love to hunt for shells, you can also find a great assortment at the shore line.   The ocean water was mild and shallow so you can venture out into the waters with out fear.   Right next to the resort was a water sports facility that also provided the chairs and umbrella.  I rented chair/umbrella on…

title: Fabulous Girls week at Sandpiper Gulf Resort.
review: The staff was knowledgeable of the area attractions and dinning and offered coupons or discounts to many places. We didn't meet anyone on the staff that wasn't super friendly and happy to help with anything at all.  The resort was clean and beautiful.  The room was comfortable and clean.  We loved that it had a full fridge, microwave and two burner stove top.  The beach services were excellent too.  They are right there on the beach by the resort, ready to hook you up with chairs for laying out or set you up for adventure on waverunners, parasailing... we did the waverunner dolphin tour, it was great.  The Shelling on the beach was great.  You could walk one way find all kinds of shells and on your way back there would be more.  The sand was soft and the beach was beautiful.  We…

title: Beach hotel with great views.
review: Found the Sandpiper Hotel on the way through Fort Myers. Stopped for 1 night at the end of of our vacation. Great find, right on the beach.really helpful staff, complimentary coffee in the lobby,also free beach bags, wi fi , and use of computer/printer. Rooms really comfortable with complimentary soaps shampoo etc.

title: Quiet Location - truly on the beach
review: Quiet and relaxing weekend!  We were in a beach front building on the first floor. I had meant to ask for a higher (3rd floor) but was glad I didn't. The patio is extended on the ground level. Ate dinner on the patio and watched a perfect sunset. Our room had two double beds and a foldout couch. The full refrigerator was a definite bonus to me. One quick trip to the grocery about a mile away was all I had to make. Room was plenty big for three of us.  Most time was spent on the beach or on the patio.  Front desk was very helpful. Asked about delivery and were provided with various menu's and discount cards.  A full sized coffee pot is in the room.  However, coffee is served every morning outside of the office. We simply filled our coffee pot there and returned to the porch for…

title: Beach, accomodations, price
review: We were looking for a 4 day-3 night break from work. This was perfect. The beach has the same remarkable, fine quartz sand that Siesta Key near Sarasota has; it's cool to the touch (even under the mid-day sun) and heavy enough so that it never blows around. The room was really a suite with kitchen facilities and ample space. The bath and suite was completely clean. There were families with children of all ages, but there was no disorder or undue noise. Fort Myers Beach has a honk-tonk bar scene in the north which cedes to a more family oriented atmosphere with resort buildings and single family vacation houses farther down where this resort is located. A Publix supermarket is 5 minutes away by car or bike.

title: Perfect location - Nice beach front apartment.
review: The location is perfect. The sand is like baking powder and so chrystal white that you need sunglasses.Wonderful beach but very expensive beach chairs! We had a crazy expensive Beach front apartment, 3rd floor. The view was stunning and the sunset from the terrasse was unforgettable. The apartment was very spacious and nice. We didn't need AC at all because there was windows in both ends of the apartment so we could create a breeze. There was a small family pool but not so suited for small children. We really like the apartment and if we come back to Fort Myers we we spend 3-5 days here again.  A few negative things: Housekeeping wasn't so great. The bed making was terrible (Sheets "curled up"). In this price range you could maybe-maybe not expect a little service with the…

title: Gets better every time....
review: Just stayed 4nights in a beach view room in the tower...have stayed here many times and this is my second time this year...room was clean, had 2 flat screen TV's, king bed, and the bathrooms have been redone with beautiful tile, new tubs and high toilets. I love the beach, it has white powdery sand, never burns your feet. Lots of stuff to do but also a perfect place to sit and do nothing. The rental chairs and umbrella are a great value at $13. Per day for all day. My sister and her hubby also stayed for the first time and they loved it...the good news is the desk person said there's going to be a remodeling of the rooms pretty soon, so I can't wait for that. I've brought my family here in the past and they also loved it. Next year I hope to plan a big family stay...LOVE this…

title: Enjoyable Stay
review: This location is away from the active part of the island, which we like the quiet.  right on the beach, and room was comfortable.  We would return to this property, Publix up road 1/2 mile walking distance, and a few resturants near by.

title: don't stay here!
review: Contrary to all the lovely pictures of this "resort"on the internet I was shocked when I entered my room. There was the most disgusting odor throughout the room and it was filthy. The rugs were worn through and black with dirt.  I was so enraged I demanded a full refund and was fully prepared to leave and find another more suitable hotel. Management instead decided to give me a upgrade to their top sweet and we did remain however I would never return to the Sandpiper!

title: SANDPIPER GULF RESORT, FT MYERS BEACH,FL
review: i HAVE STAYED HERE 5 TIMES IN THE LAS7 7 YEARS AND HAVE NEVER BEEN DISAPPOINTED.Beach front and great location, great rates.     The ocean front rooms are so reasonably priced that I would always ask for them since they are not that much more than a regular room.  The 2 pools are good if you dont like saltwater,

title: Great location
review: Clean, friendly resort with nice kitchenettes in the rooms.  They have two pools - an adult and family pool which we enjoyed.  Great beach.  Easy check in.  Great location.  Comfortable rooms. We enjoyed sitting at poolside in the evening and enjoying the seeing and hearing the ocean.

title: great short escape
review: went for a long weekend, beach is fantastic and hotel is old but in good condition. tiki bar is definitely a hit alot of locals go to the bar so it stays lively. the rest. is good esp. the pizza. hotel is far south on the island which makes it pretty quiet

title: Weekend Stay
review: The hotel is right on the beach, I walked less than 40 steps to get onto the sand. The location could not be better. The hotel is pretty new, however the house keeping was poor. There was a blood stain on the shower curtain (it was old but they should have still changed the curtain). There was a hair in our fridge. They have full kitchens in each room that would be very beneficial to families that are staying for a week. Upon check in, the front desk manager was very rude to her own employees. She was berating them in front of everyone in the lobby. The clerk was mid sentence when she just started going off on him. Other than the poor management, the pool was very nice and clean, they have an adult pool and a family pool. Overall worth the money.

title: Great weekend gateway
review: First time in this hotel,me and family enjoy the beach and pool, there is no a restaurant but is a kitchen in the room and also a BBQ at courtyard  area in the hotel,we will come again.Highly recommend A+++++ Beach is clean no oil traces,

title: Excellent Weekend !!!
review: We went there on Friday until Sunday and it was perfect, nice hotel our next vacation we will come back, the Staff was excellent. Can't wait to come again. Our next Vacation we will go there no Doubt .

title: family holiday
review: we lived there for 5 days and it was perfect, nice and cheap, there is no restaurant but no problem there is an okay kitchen in the room, and there is free coffe at the front desk. We recommend one of the rooms with Beach view so you  can Watch the sunset. There is lots off stuff to see in the area in 30 min drive range. The pool area is perfect too children. We will definitly come back Again,even though its a long way from denmark.  Mvh Family Hammer.

title: Wow what a weekend
review: First time here and by far the best experience.  Me and my family came here to relax and just enjoy the weekend and that 8s exactly what happened.  All we did was open our balcony and there was the pool and the beach. Location is perfect.  Can't wait to come again. Highly recommend A++++

title: AMAZING STAY!  Great idea for pool area in my review!
review: Thank you for your review.  We are so happy you enjoyed your first visit to the Sandpiper and we look forward to your return.

title: Great honeymoon spot!
review: On our return to the southwest coast after many years (since before the big oil spill disaster), we decided to try the mid-beach area of Estero Island in the heart of Ft. Myers Beach, but away from the "craziness" of the times square area hotels.  The road trip going up to the beach was fantastic, passing through the everglades along I-75, crossing Bonita Springs' miles of beautiful beachfront towering homes, and miles of palm trees and beach shores untouched by commercial development!  After the amazing road trip, our eyes caught the beauty of the color pastel yellow!  Our destination this year for our end-of-summer vacation was the picturesque and amazing Sandpiper Gulf Resort--just like its website illustrated and stated, this resort, a "mini-resort," unlike its big sister…

title: Return Guest
review: We have been staying at this resort for so many years (20+) that I can't remember if I've ever written a previous review. The Sandpiper is just a great place to spend some time on the gulf coast of Florida. Originally just a Mom and Pop type motel it became privately owned condos several years ago and received a complete renovation to include all new kitchen appliences, granite counter tops and furniture. About two years ago they wnt with a new property management company which has improved services immeasurably. The grounds are very well maintained along with the family and adult pools. Although the beach area may be smaller than other gulf front places it is also well maintained. A great, relaxing stay even though we were given a much smaller room than we normally get.

title: I really had a great time
review: I enjoyed myself, suites were nice, staff was very welcoming to my husband, service dog and I. I will definitely be returning to this resort! Tim was very knowledgeable about the happenings in the area. Great vacation!!!! Great view!!! Great time!!!

title: Wonderful for families (and couples!)
review: Traveling with 6 year-old twins and we were up at 6 am and on the beach looking for shells by 7 am (as requested by the boys!!!). The hotel is wonderful and right on the beach. We stayed four nights and then headed to Vegas (without kids). While Vegas has a few attractions that are missing from Ft Meyers beach, my wife and I wish we had spent more days at the Sandpiper (for the no-kids part of the vacation) than in Vegas.   The beach is wonderful. We are really into looking at shells and got up at 5 am one day to catch low-tide at Sanibel, but had more luck right in front of the hotel (including sand dollars and conch shells). The sunsets are AMAZING (see picture). The hotel seemed to be mostly families and it was great having a Publix supermarket a half mile away. Free coffee…

title: great place
review: This is our 30th year at Sandpiper for our family reunion.  We still stay in our Honeymoon room. Room 151    Love the property and the staff has been consistently hospitable   The location is perfect , far away from the Honkie tonk downtown area and the beach is literally outside your front door .Rooms are kept clean and staff is there when you need them.    Only negative is they are now on their third management company and the latest company wont let us book all our rooms together and guarantee our rooms . We usually take adjoining rooms  150, 151 and 152 for us and our kids . In total the family takes 10 to 12 rooms The previous management said ok on the rooms  but when we got there they were no longer the management company . So my family was spread all over.  . Even with…

title: BEST VACATION EVER
review: The hotel is amazing! My two daughters & I stayed there for a week. The ocean is beautiful and at the hotel they have a company called "Wind & Water Sports" that are on the beach. The owner chris is very nice and Richard was the BEST tour guide. They have jet ski rentals, parasailing, dolphin tours, etc. I would totally recommend it to others :)

title: Location, Service, Relaxation!
review: Beautiful, older resort with a location that can't be beat!  We stayed in room 155 - first floor-beach front and we were delighted.  Room was clean and had modern updates - flat screen tv, granite counter tops.  Resort is located in a less commercial area of the island and is a great spot for a quiet and relaxing stay.  Staff was very welcoming and friendly without being too intrusive.  The resort has two pools.  One is designated for adults - ages 18 and older.  The adult is 6 ft deep and the "family pool" is 8 feet deep.  Really nice and enjoyable.

title: love friendly, not fancy of intimate sandpiper.  love rodney.
review: relaxing place to stay.  not the dog and pony show that just costs more and isn't necessary for great visit.  coming back for 7 years plus.  consistent friendly staff.  love small town feel of ft myers beach and the businesses on estero island.

title: May Holiday
review: Me and my wife stayed at the Sandpiper from 03/05/2013 - 09/05/13 and had a great time The staff are very friendly specialy Tim on on the desk and there are mainy great eating places nearby and you were right on the beach The room were very modern with a kitchen and great bathroom and pricing was great value and there was a pool for familys and a pool where children were not allowed

title: right on the beach
review: It was a second floor and no elevator.  It was an efficiency - nice appointments.  Comfy beds.  Granite counters in kitchen and bath.  Very clean.  They had 2 pools, but we did not use them.  Restaurants were nearby.  We stayed 1 night - took the boat to Key West - and another night upon our return.

title: Beachfront paradise in Ft Myers Beach,FL.
review: Excellent location and accommodations with on site jet ski rentals, close to Publix grocery store and many other stores and outlets and great restaurants. Resort located on the quiet part of town, you can go from beach to pool in just steps away and grill right by the pool or use their adults only pool also with grill right by the pool.

title: wonderful little resort on Ft. Myers Beach
review: This is a really nice, comfortable resort with very helpful and friendly staff.  We only stayed one night as we were traveling to a conference, but it was a great place.  It is a mile or so from the main part of the Ft. Myers Beach - close enough for a short drive or bicycle to several very good restaurants.

title: Gulf-front sunset views from a family-friendly resort with great customer service.
review: Wow! The location is excellent. The Sandpiper has a family pool and an adult pool right on the beautiful beach. Watersports and shuffleboard are available. I stayed in a 2nd floor unit poolside which had a view of the beach and sunset(229). The unit has a kitchenette where I made breakfast and lunch everyday. Publix (supermarket) is 1/2 mile away. The bathtoom was totally re-done and is beutiful; there is a tub. Nice flat screen tv and internet access. The staff is friendly and helpful. Feels like a family-like atmosphere.

title: Great location.....friendly, helpful staff.
review: Thank you for the review of our resort.  We are pleased that you found your stay to be so wonderful.  Enjoy the rest of your summer and we hope to see you again!

title: Great fun!
review: Quieter area than north of Sandpiper; great view of the Gulf and you can't beat the few steps access to the beach.  I look forward to, though, having the air conditioning system updated some day so it isn't so noisy........just me.

title: The balcony room with a beautiful view.
review: We had two of our grandchildren with us, and they had a wonderful time. We were on ground level right at the family pool, and they could swim while we watched them from our own lanai. Very convenient and relaxing.

title: My second review.....
review: This was our third stay at Sandpiper Gulf Resort.  I was a bit reluctant to write a good review because I want to keep this gem hidden!  However, I have to give credit when credit is due.  If you want to stay on Fort Myers Beach, but want some quiet time, this is the place.  It is a few miles down from the busy “Times Square” area.  If you are staying for a few days, be sure to shop at Publix to stock up your fridge and cabinets, then sit back and enjoy the beach or pool.  After a day in the sun, you can freshen up in your clean room.  I am looking forward to my forth stay !  You can also get access to the Pink Shell at the other end of the island.  We did this on our last day.

title: Much better than LaPlaya in Naples
review: Wonderful to read this was your third visit to the Sandpiper!  Thank you for returning and for choosing to stay with us.  We are delighted that you find our resort to be a gem on Fort Myers Beach.  Thank you for expressing your highest recommendations and we look forward to welcoming you back a fourth time!

title: Just Perfect!!!
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper after a 3 day business conference at LaPlaya resort in Naples  . Our room at the Sandpiper was much cleaner. Our in room refrigerator was spotless at the Sandpiper - the same could not be said for LaPlaya resort. Sandpiper was a great value- a third of what we paid at LaPlaya resort. The location of the Sandpiper was perfect - away from the congested Times Square area that we tried to visit, but could find no parking space. We will definitely recommend the Sandpiper.

title: Peaceful Sun on the Beach, 2 thumbs up!
review: Upon our arrival we were a little skeptical about this resort, I will admit however, to our surprise this turned out to be one of our favorite resorts in the Ft. Myers area. We have stayed at Pink Shell (hated it, yes, I know they are affiliated with them), Sanibel Harbour and Resort and at the The Westin Cape Coral Resort At Marina Village. While a lack of amenities was one lacking point, the benefits over weighed that tiny flaw. The resort is quaint yet so family oriented. The BEACH FRONT rooms are a must. The views are SPECTACULAR. I mean, breathtaking! Every morning we would wake up to dolphins swimming by, the evenings we would spend strolling the shore for some of the most unique shells and creatures. Staff was great, housekeeping lacked seriously though. Our rooms weren't…

title: Beachfront Bliss
review: Peaceful and Relaxing for a romantic stay or a perfect family place. I have come here with my family for the passed 6 years in the month of May. The weather is PERFECT everyday. We come for the Sun by the pools and the ocean. We always have a beachfront room on the first floor. I love the sound of the ocean when I have my patio door open.  I never check out from my stay until I have made a reservation for the next up coming year.

title: Nicer than expected!
review: We had booked a morning reservation for the jet ski dolphin tour with Mid Island Watersports ( awesome! ), which is right on the beach in front of the Sandpiper Gulf Resort and figured we would spend the day on the beach, booking a room there for that evening ( btw, if all the cheap websites like expedia, hotels.com, etc say there are no rooms left, call the hotel directly, which is what I did and they had two rooms available! ). Unfortunately check in time wasn't until 4 pm, and we got back from the jet ski tour around 12 or 1 and really wanted to shower ( the surf was rough from the wind and we were soaked and salty ) before heading out to lunch. They were soooo helpful and accomodating, allowing us to check in early. They were still cleaning the room but took our cellphone #…

title: nice renovations
review: We did our annual trip to the resort this year and were pleasantly surprised by the renovations to the rooms and properties. We always have found the resort to be a great family holiday and as this is our 10th year I believe this speaks for itself . we rented the bycycles this week and this was a great way to experience the island and beaches . Again highly recommended resort.

title: Fantastic!
review: I think I was just plain lucky to ind this place. Unbelievable!  The resort is located down to the road from the Times Square area of ft myers beach, so it's pretty mellow. It's right on the water, with two pools, and decent coffee in the lobby. Clean, comfy, no complaints at all, except I wish we stayed longer. Even if you're not a bird watcher, the sea birds will blow your mind. Dolphins and skates, just a great, restful stay on the beach. A close drive to all the fun in ft myers as well. There are two grocery stores close by. Go to Topps, the Publix markets are overpriced. This place is the perfect stay!

title: Wonderful find!
review: My husband and I stayed at the Sandpiper GUlf Resort this past weekend on our first visit to Fort Myers Beach and it was wonderful. The room was very clean and spacious and we enjoyed having a kitchenette. The staff was super friendly and very helpful in recommending restaurants. Very convenient access to the beach. We will definitely stay again when back in the area.

title: We had a great time - great for families
review: The kitchenette makes breakfast and lunch  a breeze and you are only steps away from the beach. Great location, restaurants and Publix very nearby, plus downtown is a short drive. Staff is very friendly and helpful - we played shuffleboard in the courtyard every night!

title: Average Accommodations with Excellent Location & Value
review: My teenage son and I stayed at this resort because of location, price and good reviews. I wasn't disappointed as far as that goes. We were told when we checked in that we would also have access to their sister hotel, The Pink Shell, which is at the end of Estero Blvd around Times Square. We did drive down there once just to check it out and found they have a much bigger pool and restaurant on sight. Although it looked nicer than our resort, it didn't have nearly as nice a beach as ours and seemed more crowded.  The Sandpiper resort, which is more of a hotel in my opinion, stands out with it's bright yellow color so makes it easy to find! Our room was #201 in the building next to the main one which was next to the road (there is an elevator if you are up on the higher floors).…

title: Fun in the Sun - The adult pool and location was perfect.  Staff was very helpful and accomodating.  Perfect location
review: Perfect spot for couples ... kitchen was right size and large fridge was perfect.  Beach services were very convinient and staff was very helpful.   Option of the adult pool or a shorter walk right to the beach was perfect.  Short walk to the Publix market and the trolley stop was right there too.

title: Family-friendly and a beautiful beach. Friendly and helpful service.
review: The Sandpiper is in a great location with a beautiful beach. We have visited Ft. Myers for a few years, and this beach is the best we've used. Overall the condo was great. They need to replace the carpet with hard floor. The room has a musty smell and the floors are hard to keep clean. The room is small. We are a family of five. It work out well. The room was clean and served our purpose. I really liked our room's placement, #225. We had a fantastic view of the beach and sunset even though we had a pool side room. Our deck was directly above the pool, but we enjoyed that because we could see our children if needed. The noise didn't bother us, we're used to. I would not get a ground floor pool side room. I don't think I would like that people can see into my room. Also, I am not…

title: THe Sandpiper is a great value.
review: The Sandpiper is a friendly, clean and comfortable place to stay right on the beach in Fort Myers Beach, Fla. There are accomodations for adults, with an adult only pool and 2 family buildings with a family pool. It is clean, well maintained with a friendly, knowledgeable staff. We really feel comfortable there. The noise level is very low and the beach is fantastic. Some rooms face the beach and if you can, book those because it is so nice to wake up and look out at the water.   We have stayed at the Sandpiper several times now over the past 15 years and this is unusualy for us because my partner likes to try new things. The fact that she will willlingly agree to go back is a major coup for the Sandpiper! My feelings are that I would stay there every time we are in Fort Myers…

title: Perfect nice hotel, directly to the beach. Great location to stay longer.
review: Was a very nice place to stay, Sad that we have to leave after only one night. Large room with two king-size beds, komplete kitchen with stove, microwave, coffemaker, refrigerator etc.. Free coffee. Own terrace, room very clean. Short way to the beach, clean water, sandy. Good location for trips.

title: Don't stay here
review: Once you get through all the traffic to get there, you will find a pleasant staff and good view from the top beach front rooms.  The price for a 2 bed, 1 sofa bed suite was very expensive compared to other places we stayed during our trip.  The sofa bed was terrible, you could feel the springs under the mattress.  I believe they used our CC to purchase itunes but cannot confirm this, but somebody did on the day we stayed there.  There is no fitness room, restaurant or bar at the hotel.  The suites do have kitchens.

title: Okay We Like It
review: We are happy to hear your compliments of our pleasant staff, but sorry to hear of your overall disappointment in your recent stay.  I am glad that I was able to reach you by phone today to explain that while we do require a credit card at check-in, once authorized, we do not have access to those credit card numbers.  As per our conversation, I do recommend that you notify your credit card company of these charges.  I hope you will consider returning to our resort during your next Fort Myers Beach vacation.

title: Clean, friendly and enjoyable!
review: A beautiful little set up, bright yellow in color, and nestled toward the south end of Ft Myers Beach. Riveting ocean views and TWO pools were just a couple of the great features to this hotel. It is the perfect place to relax and enjoy the ocean breeze. Each night we cracked the door to the balcony and allowed the roar of the sea to lull us to slumber and awaken us in the morn. Lovely view! The kitchenette in the room was spacious and quite modern, the room was cute and clean!  We also were able to use all of the amenities down at the Pink Shell since the Sandpiper did not have a gym, which was great, because there is nothing Matt n Morgan love more than a rip roarin' workout in the morning!
