The greatest drawbacks to this establishment were the lack of consistent WiFi access…

title: PERFECTION ON THE BEACH
review: We took our college-aged twin daughters on Spring Break for a graduation present and created awesome memories.  Loved the kitchenette - full size refrigerator was a definite plus.  Stove, microwave, coffeemaker and all the utensils needed were supplied.   We were able to buy groceries and eat breakfast and lunch to save money because we easily spent $100 a meal for 4 adults.  The balcony was fabulous - watched the dolphins jumping and the sun set all within one hour - gorgeous!  Friendly, knowledgeable and professional staff.  Clean, comfortable rooms - price was a bit steep but we bit the bullet for the special occasion.  The only downfall was there was a missing frying pan in our suite and we waited two hours for it to be delivered, even after visiting the front desk twice. …

title: Third Year in a Row
review: We stayed here for just one night in January on a long vacation to Florida & Caribbean.  On arrival the staff were very friendly and helpful and we knew we had picked a good hotel immediately, it felt more like a family ran hotel but very professional.  We had a quick check in and our room was ready early.  The room was fantastic, it was more of a suite with tons of space and a kitchen and very clean.  Beds were very comfortable and we had a good night sleep.  The Location was great with access straight onto the beautiful beach via a lovely swimming pool. Good facilities all well maintained and the laundry machines came in useful.  Value for money compared to some other hotels on Fort Myers Beach.   Our only regret was we wish we had stayed longer and with certainly be returning…

title: Great that it's right on the beach...pro.  more emphasis on the bathroom area...con.
review: Ft. Myers beach is a great beach, getting thru there is a real hassle, with that being said, the location of the Sandpiper is good, kind of in the middle. Room was plenty big, maybe needs a little updating, especially the bathroom. Shower AND toilet in same area w/ a sliding door, separating from the sink area, the big wall mirror in bathroom is too far away (only women would appreciate this comment), and water pressure in shower, as most hotels was awful. no box of kleenex in room...at all, no paper towels either. Lot of emphasis on kitchen area, full size fridge, stove, micro, table and chairs. Our room was probably the cheapest, minimal view of the ocean, corner of parking lot/and the street. Staff was for the most part "nice". Got mixed feelings for front desk. First was…

title: Great view of the ocean, but very little else to say.
review: Update this place...please! If it weren't for the view (from our overpriced oeanfront room) would have been a real bad experience. Thin walls..one flatscreen TV that is right in front of one bed only (roommate had a sore neck from trying to watch from the other bed), tiny, tiny bathroom. Cabinets were in awful shape. Staff was very nice, clean grounds.  I'm not a snob, but people staying there were one step up from being in a trailer park. Could be nice...wouldn't go back.

title: Ask for a balcony room
review: Thank you for your comments and concerns.  The Sandpiper has been operating with a new management company since last December.   Changes have already been made with operating procedures and policies.  Thank you for taking notice of the friendliness of our associates and cleanliness of the hotel grounds.  There are plans for future updating projects that will be sure to satisfy our clientele.  We hope that you will consider returning to the Sandpiper.

title: Perfect Weekend Getaway!
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper unexpectedly because they very nicely could accommodate us when our booked hotel lost our reservation... (yea, it happens). Sandpiper was PERFECT and there was a beautiful sunset that night, so all ended well. Best part: we were in room 404, in the side building, facing the Gulf, with large balcony. If you are counting on seeing the Ft. Myers sunsets on a trip, I feel it would be worth it to make sure you reserve (and pay for!) one of the beach facing rooms or suites. Only odd feature in our room was the window to the hallway, very close to the bed, and the louvered shades do not keep out the hall light.

title: Second time here and loving it
review: Due to a weather delay in Minneapolis (shocking for winter, I know!) we did not arrive at the Sandpiper until a bit after 2a. However, we were happily greeted by their security who helped find us a parking spot, and asked if we wanted to know anything about the hotel. We were wide awake and willing to check things out so he gave us a run down of the place and our room - wonderful!   The hotel has everything you need for a short or long stay. Full size fridge, microwave, stove top and all the cooking tools you could need. There is a grocery store within .5-1mi away. The beds were comfy and we had plenty of room for our things and for moving around. We had a courtyard room overlooking the pool, but the balcony is huge and you can easily see the ocean/watch the sunset from there. …

title: Wonderful property and location!
review: Booked this property from the reviews on tripadvisor.com and they were correct!  The views from the beachfront rooms are amazing.  Great sunsets, the property is clean and well taken care of.  Love, love the wristbands you wear to enter/exit the property and your rooms.  No keycards to mess with!  The rooms were well equipped with coffee maker, toaster, dishes and utensils.  We chose to take a quick ride down the street to a Publix and buy our breakfast and a few snacks.  It was lovely to just wake up and enjoy coffee on the deck!  This is not a 5 star property and the decor a little dated, yet the cleanliness and efficiency of the property make up for the age.  The beachfront rooms only have two double beds, so for a couple the sleeping is not the best (if you are used to a…

title: Unforgetable Week On The Beach
review: Congratulations on your engagement!  We are so honored that you chose to stay at our resort for your special weekend.  Enjoy the planning of your wedding and we will see you again at the Sandpiper!

title: Excellent vacation!
review: We booked The Sandpiper Gulf Resort online for a week's getaway.  This place went way beyond our expectations.  I can't think of a better place to be on that gorgeous Ft. Myers Beach. It is right ON the Beach.  Our room was beautiful and clean and accommodating.  It had a mini-kitchen with a full refrigerator so we could make some meals to cut down costs.  Publix Grocery Store close along with more noisy party center down the road for night activity.  There is a trolley right in front of the place that will take you there and back.  Also a Dog Racing Track  about 20 min. down the road in Bonita Springs.   The staff was so friendly and helpful about everything.  The resort is  beautiful with excellent pools (one adult) and the landscaping is out of this world. It is truly a…

title: EXCELLENT RESORT!!
review: Our family of 4, including two young children, stayed at this resort for four nights.  Our room included two double beds, a TV, a comfortable sofa sleeper, table and chairs, as well as a full size fridge, microwave and 2 burner stove.  Our room was very clean and housekeeping came each day midday to do basic cleaning and give us fresh towels.  The bathrooms have been redone since we were here couple years ago.  There is a well kept pool for everyone to enjoy and another adult only pool. We had a pool side room, on first floor.  We walked out our door and could see the ocean and the pool. We were VERY close to the Gulf of Mexico and a beautiful beach.  This was our second time here and we will return again.  Thanks for a wonderful stay!

title: Best of both worlds
review: as a Sr. Class Sponcer we went to the resort...they were VERY WELCOMEING!! even with H.S. Seniors they gave us the respect that we deserved during Spring BReak  :-)  and we ALL had a BLAST!! GORGIOUs resort~beaches are the best I have ever seen! went Parasailing~Jet Skiing which was right next to resort and easy to do...walking distance to TONS of activies~stores and dineing FuN!~ even had BBQs in court yard for all to enjoy and use.court yard was GORGIOUS and had shuffle boards.

title: We would definitely come back!
review: This is a great place to stay for the price we paid. Not a five star fancy resort but it was definitely no mom and pop place like a lot o other places around here. The rooms were clean, we could save money by eating in because we had an oven, stove,microwave, fridge, and dishes provided. We were literally right next to the beach. Very peaceful and quiet area. We were too far away to walk to any restaurants or clubs but it was nice to be away from all the craziness of not having parking and an overcrowded beach. It was a very short drive. Nice place to stay for families with young kids. We would stay here again if we ever come back.

title: Couples Get-Away
review: My husband and I stayed at the Sandpiper in early December.  The pictures on TA are a good depiction of this resort.  It is small, but reasonably kept.  We stayed in a room that had a patio overlooking the gulf.  The room included a kitchenette, which was handy.  If you're not familiar with Ft. Myers, know that you're definitely going to need to rent a car (which we did).  The weather wasn't good while we were there, so we did a fair amount of driving.  Had the weather been nicer (day of arrival and the day we left were the nicest, of course) this would have been THE place to stay.  The beach is unbelievable.  I appreciated that this is a smaller resort, not crawling with people.  Staff were friendly.  They allowed us a later checkout due to a late afternoon flight.  Overall, I…

title: Nice location on a beautiful beach
review: The resort surpassed our expectations which were not high.  The location on beautiful Ft Myers Beach is convenient to restaurants, Publix and other shops ... an easy walk if you like.  The resort facilities are fine .... nothing fancy, just well equipped, fairly clean and utilitarian.  The rooms were larger than we thought they would be.  The kitchen was well stocked with pots, pans, dishes, glassware etc.  We didn't use any of it, but thought it was nice that it was there.  Plenty of towels, soaps and lotions were available, 2 TV's (without a business channel ... not happy about that), OK furniture and a nice balcony overlooking the adult pool, the beach and the gulf.  My only complaint was that there was a pervasive smell of disinfectant in the room, undoubtedly from the…

title: What a find - my new favorite Florida hotel
review: Thanks to TA, I booked a stay here for last week.  We had two beachfront rooms, 150 and 152.  They were spotless, wonderfully equipped with a kitchen with everything but an oven - we bought food at the nearby Publix and only ate dinner out.  I had two pools to choose from when I got too hot lounging on my deck.  The hotel was very quiet - don't know if this was luck of the draw with neighboring rooms or par for the course.  We extended our stay, one night and the front desk staff could not have been nicer or more helpful and were able to arrange for us to keep our rooms.

title: Repeat visit
review: Came back again to the Sandpiper.  Love the location on the beautiful white sand beach.  Poolside is best for some, oceanfront for others.  Depends on what you want from your visit.  We like oceanfront for the sensational sunsets.  If my children were still young, poolside would be easy in and out.  It's also a cinch to utilize the shuffleboard and grills from poolside, and to hop in and out of the family pool.  There's a second pool for adults in front of the higher-rise building (the one with an elevator.)  Free coffee, laundry on site, kitchen in every unit.  Wristband system for entry to room and pools worked well for us.  Not glitzy, but well-kept property with outstanding water views.

title: Sandpiper does have an elevator!
review: The review below is incorrect. There IS an elevator in the North building where we stayed last year, January 2012. It is "handicap accessible" which is what I needed since I had broken my ankle a few months before, and was still using a cane to get around.     We had a unit on the 3rd floor, that had a separate bedroom from the living/kitchen area. It was very comfortable and clean and we enjoyed the Gulf and pool view from the balcony.  This pool was heated and just for adults. There were plenty of loungers there and out by the beach under the palm trees for shade, if you wanted it. The beach there was not too wide, so I was able to walk down to the water's edge.    There was a coin laundry available on the ground floor of the main unit.   It had just come under new management…

title: Dirty Bird
review: We picked the Sandpiper based on TA review and were very disappointed. Other than the beachfront view which was spectacular, the room left much to be desired. The carpets were disgustingly filthy; the door lock was broken; microwave sounded like it was going to implode at any second; greasy film over most everything; nightstand drawers missing handles; carpet stretched out so much it was a trip hazard. Can't believe this is a sister to the Pink Shell! Check-in clerk did give us the great recommendation for the Fresh Catch Bistro was the only plus of our stay. For the price, stay elsewhere...

title: Lovely location, view and pool
review: We are truly sorry to hear of your disappointment with your recent stay at our resort.  While we are a charming boutique resort with just 63 rooms, we take cleanliness very seriously.  We have a cleaning program in place that is strictly supervised and enforced.  Broken or non-working items are to be discovered and replaced before a guest checks in to a room.  If this was not done for you, we apologize.  We would have been happy to either replace those items or move you to a different room to ensure your comfort and satisfaction.  We hope you will give us another try to meet your expectations.

title: Great Place to Stay
review: We recently spent four nights on the gulf side of the resort. Beautiful. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony and watching the sunset. The tranquility pool for adults was wonderful - and heated. Our only bad experience was being with a usable toilet for 23 hours. When the front desk first learned of our problem, his first response was "Did you throw something in it?" We were never shown any sympathy for our inconvenience. He told us that there was "nothing he could do about it" and that security would "snake it" that evening. Security plunged it, but did not snake it. The next morning, the new front desk immediately came and snaked it himself. It's just not the situation you want to find yourself in when you are paying a pretty hefty price per night. Would we return? I'm not sure.…

title: Great stay in November/December
review: We are delighted to hear you enjoyed our heated pool and watching the sunsets from your balcony.  For the inconvenience you mentioned above, we are very sorry.  In some situations we may find ourselves so focused on resolving an issue, that as in this case, your feelings as our guest were overlooked.  We apologize that our front desk associate did not offer sympathy toward your situation and that you had to wait for it to be resolved.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  We hope to see you again at the Sandpiper.

title: Very detailed review, esp if you have never visited Ft Myers Beach
review: The Sandpiper has been my "go to" place for visits to Ft Myers Beach for a few years.  To quickly add, it states "resort" but this does not have amenities such as massage, hair, kids activities as some people will assume come with a resort.  However, read on and you will find that you can go to their sister site for this type of service ...   For anyone who has never visited, but plans to, it is helpful to know that Ft Myers Beach is basically a strip of barrier island that is the Gulf on one side, and what they call "bay" (most folks refer to it as bay) on the other.  The gulf side with the beach is, of course, a popular side to stay, and gives many beautiful sunsets over the west coast.  The water is calm in Ft Myers, there are no waves like the Atlantic ocean east coast. …

title: Great place
review: Booked through Expedia for the first time so wasn't expecting the best room but what a surprise. Tim on reception was a star, great help, good service, made fresh coffee for us and recommended a great restaurant, stayed just 1 night but if we come to Ft Myers beach again would stay here.  Great location right on beach.  John Cavanagh 2013. 9/10

title: Sandpiper resort on ft. myers beach
review: RELAX  AND ENJOY. excellent excellent excellent --- see dolphins everyday sitting on the deck directly on the beach.  everyone is so nice and helpful, especially Angel.  a place where you can go to relax and enjoy.

title: compliments
review: compliments to the new management, daily cleaning of the rooms is a good one! the service was allready ok the last several years, but under the new management it's perfect! also the new pavement of the pooldeck looks good, perhaps you can think about a kind of a loyalty programm for repeaters? A big "thank you"to Tim, Rodney and Angel and the rest of the group (cleaning etc.) We hope we see us again next november/december 2013 Jan and Carla (dutchies) Netherlands

title: sand piper review
review: was best trip ever when i went there i knew i would have a great vacation and i officially loved that place and thats why i am writing this review and the pool was heated and they had grills breakfast for free and shuffleboard my favorite was the grills  for free you can play shuffleboard and have a grill you also had view from the pool to the water there was also a walkway where you could go on the beach and there were rentals on the beach and you can also walk to the sand bar and find lots of shells there and every night i went to the pool and then got out looked at the moon and went shell hunting

title: We LOVE this propery.
review: We stayed here 3 years in a row and we LOVE it. Its as nice a place as you can stay on Ft. Myers beach. Clean, modern and right on the beach. Great pool. There's a kitchenette in room with all utensils and a big fridge (and there's a Publix grocery store about a mile up the road) so you can eat in. PERFECT FOR KIDS because its right on the beach. (Can also use sister property Pink Shell which has an amazing pool for the kids.). The Sandpiper pool is big and heated. I HIGHLY reccemend this property.

title: Excellent
review: We found this hotel from Tripadvisor and stayed here because it had good reviews and it is located right on the beach.  The room was clean and he staff was friendly.  We swam in the pool, cooked out on the grill and walked down to the beach every day, it was perfect.  The location is great if you want to be located directly on the beach.  We will definitely stay here again when we back to Fort Meyers.

title: Wonderful, Relaxing Stay At The Sandpiper Gulf Resort
review: My wife and I were in Ft. Myers for business / weekend away.  Our stay at the Sandpiper was wonderful.  Had a 2nd floor poolside room and could still see the gulf.  Loved sleeping with the patio doors open and hearing the surf.  Very nice staff.  Super clean.  Beach is very clean and wide - great for taking a long walk.  Love the layout of the hotel with its pool and courtyard surrounded by the building on three sides and the beach on the fourth.  Very quiet and relaxing. We enjoyed staying on the southern part of the island.   Bed was not super comfortable, but not horrible.  You have to drive to eat or grocery, but not far.   Will definitely stay here again if given the chance to come back to Ft. Myers Beach.   Note that they charge your credit card for the whole rest of your…

title: Relaxing.
review: Spent 5 nights at the Sandpiper Resort on October 16-21, 2012.   Was a great place! Decided to upgrade to oceanfront room.   We were on the northside, 3rd floor.   Great view. However, since the sun comes directly in every day, the room tends to heat up quickly.   Good room-darkening curtains they have had to be pulled closed daily to keep the room adequately cool.   I was hot during the night, since the bed was furthest away from the AC unit in the kitchen. Sheets on the bed were heavy and hot.   Kitchen was great.   Large microwave oven over the cooktop.   Full-sized refrigerator for families.  Bathroom shower was excellent.  There is no elevator for the third floor, but stairs were safe to up barefoot. All in all, my husband and I would definitely return.

title: One of my best vacation stays
review: We had such a relaxing and enjoyable week in FMB (except the pesty noseeums) and the Sandpiper Resort was a very good choice.  We had never been to FMB before so picked the Sandpiper randomly.  We asked for a room overlooking the ocean and the Sandpiper delivered.  It was quiet at this end of the beach which was heavenly.  The only complaint I have was the noise, the hotel was doing off-season maintenance so every day there were maintenance men working with a noisy machine someplace.  But it didn't deter me from sitting by the pool and reading.  The hotel room is big with a kitchenette - the room was clean and nicely decorated and very comfortable.  The balcony overlooking the ocean was a wonderful PLUS and we watched a beautiful sunset every night. We had early check-in and…

title: Looking forward to returning!
review: My parents always stayed at the Sandpiper when were children so I was excited to be there with my own family.  We stayed in a court side room next to the pool, which was perfect with a little one who has a fondness for swimming.  It was also nice to be so close to the beach.  The staff was wonderful, even mailing an item to us that got left behind.

title: Great time & view
review: we stayed at the Sandpiper on advice from others and Expedia review.  Beachfront room w/great view and wonderful weather.  We will be going back next year.  Near family but  had time for ourselves. We were told that September is a very quiet month there, we will  probably go end of Sept for more peace and quiet.  The beaches are beautiful and clean and great for walking or even bike riding and there are many birds to watch from thr beach or room balcony.

title: Very nice accomodations with very helpful staff. Looking forward to a return stay
review: Arrived a bit early for check-in and this wasn't a problem. The room and equipement were very clean and in working order. The bathroom and its fixtures were very clean and was equipped with all the appropriate amenities. Entire staff was friendly and helpful. Excellent value for the dollar. Am looking forward to staying with them again.

title: We will go back!
review: The sandpiper is a wonderful place to stay.  The staff is friendly and the room was clean.  The beach was amazing.  We could not have asked for a better vacation spot.  Publix is 2 blocks north of the hotel.  That made getting snacks and even meals very easy.

title: Great property right on the beach
review: We stayed here for a little less than a week.  Room was clean and well appointed with a kitchen and a patio.  There was tons of storage.  The pools were well kept and staff was very friendly.  They also have chairs that you can use on the beach and several grills if you feel like cooking.  My only complaint is on the last day we were there, we woke to find 2 large cockroaches dead on the kitchen floor.  If we had been staying longer we would have complained but since we were leaving we let it go.  All in all a good stay.

title: RIGHT ON THE BEACH.  Secret? Highly reccommend due to excellent location, service, kitchen and updated bathrooms.
review: Good for families with kids or adults. TWO separate pools (family and adult). Close to publix to purchase supplies. Barbeque available. Shuffleboard, jetski for rental, beach chairs,... almost anything you need. Restaurants are close-by. Check with front desk for coupons. They brew coffee in the morning and have soda (and water) machines. Ice is also available. The resort is small enough that the staff gets to know YOU. They are super nice. We'll be be back, Had a terrific time. Oh and, the beach was excellent! Peaceful section of Ft Myers Beach. Ask about a discount for returning again...

title: Excellent value!!
review: I have been coming back to this resort for 25+ years now.  It is an older hotel but has been refurbished and updated on a regular basis.  It is a great place just to get away for a laid back vacation.  It is on the quite end of the beach which is just my speed!  They now have lounge chairs that they allow on the beach now which is just awesome as I find there is nothing better then sitting next to the surf and reading a book all day.  I love Ft. Myers beach for the sand as it is a great beach to exercise on.  Walked and ran daily 4+ miles on my last stay.  Grocery store is less than a mile away.  Sunsets are beautiful!  Keep up the good work Sandpiper I will be back soon!

title: Perfect Spot To Relax!
review: Thoroughly enjoyed my weekend stay here. The property and rooms are wonderfully maintained. Though the hotel itself is of the "old style" it has been upgraded and renovated and is very nice. A perfect place to stay and just sit on the beach.

title: AMAZING
review: Amazing Vacatrion and great service, perfect place to stay. My family and friends find the Sandpiper is the perfect beach place to stay.  We go at least twice a year. They have a beautiful Resort and very good rates. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They do have water sports and also you can have access to the Pink Shell.

title: Great Hotel - Great Price
review: The sandpiper gulf resort was  a great place to spend the week and had a good price for a family on a budget. My family came in to the lobby and the rep at the desk was super nice. One of the neat things is the fact that they do not issue "keys" to the rooms. Instead, they issue RFID bracelets to wear and you just put it against the door and it unlocks!  The pool was clean the beach was great!   Before we got there we were not sure if we would need to rent beach furniture...  It was provided at no extra charge.   Each room also has a kitchen area where we were able to cut our costs during the stay by buying groceries at Publix (right down the road) Instead of eating out every meal.  One thing we found was they there were not enou complimentary grills available during traditional…

title: realy good place to stay away for long weekend or vacation with the family.
review: They have a beautiful Resort and very reasonable rates. Staff is  friendly and helpful. They do have water sports on site. Wave runners parasailing, and dolphin tours. They also have an Adult Pool which is nice if your not traveling with Children.

title: Nice place to get away for a few days or Vacation.
review: They have a beautiful Resort and very reasonable rates. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They do have water sports on site. Wave runners parasailing, and dolphin tours. They also have an Adult Pool which is nice if your not traveling with Children.

title: Absolutely LOVED Sandpiper Gulf Resort.
review: Already planning a trip to come back ASAP! I am now a forever customer! I give 5 stars!!! I'm soooo happy I found the Sandpiper! It was my perfect beach dream vacation I've been patiently waiting for!!! Thank you Sandpiper for making my dream a reality and a gorgeous one at that! I don't think it could of been any better!!!

title: Dream Vacation
review: If I was to dream of the perfect place to stay it would be this one.  Beautiful, clean rooms.  You feel like your at home with a two burner stove, microwave, sink and full size fridge.  They provided the plates, silverware, glasses, pots and pans and cooking utensils.  There were 2 beds in our room plus a sofa sleeper.  There was also a dining room table with chairs for four.  Covered balcony overlooking the beautiful beach.  I love the sound of the waves splashing on the shore.  I could swim in the pool that was over looking the ocean and hear the waves all at the same time.  They have two gas grills by the pool with an outdoor table and chairs for you to cook out and sit outside and eat.  The neatest thing about this place was the key.  They were rubber waterproof bracelets…

title: We'll be back!
review: This was our second stay within 4 months. First time was a last minute decision and we were pleasantly surprised. Very clean and manicured grounds. Rooms were nice and updated all the way through except for the kitchen and bathroom cabinets. Pull out sleeper could use new mattress too. Comfortable beds and pillows and great house keeping staff. Pool/beach towels could use an updating. Love the new room key system that also serves as a guest ID. We'll be back...maybe tomorrow!

title: Everything is very nice, with exeption of the front desk guy, he is very Rude with the customers.
review: The resort have a nice rooms, nothing exeptional, but just nice, nice beach, but the front desk guy is very rude, I' m staying here this weekend 08/10-08/12/2012 and beleive, is not a person to work with customer, because tkhat is the face of the resort.

title: The Perfect Wedding at The Sandpiper Gulf Resort
review: You always dream of the perfect wedding for your child when they grow up.  Last week-end I got my wish. My son married his gorgeous bride on the white sands of beautiful Fort Myers Beach.  But it wasn’t just the exquisite blue sky, the gentle waves of the Gulf rolling in & out or the tropical breeze that made Oliver & Anne’s wedding perfect. It was the whole experience of the Sandpiper Gulf Resort.  I have to say that when a friend told me about the Sandpiper Gulf Resort I was skeptical of a beach hotel built in 1980. Visions of spring break & kids partying filled my head. I couldn’t have been more wrong. My first encounter was with John, the General Manager, an endearing man who immediately put my fears at ease. He took me on a tour of this charming resort with all the comforts…

title: Great location, top notch staff, clean rooms and very reasonable price!
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper Resort for six nights while attending a family wedding.  We were pleasantly surprised by the friendliness of all staff members, their willingness to help as well as their determination to meet every single request our group members presented to them.  The rooms were cleaned well every day.  The maid worked hard each day to make up our room so that it was as clean as when we checked in the first day.    While the pool was great for families, it was especially nice that they had an adult only pool when you needed a little time away from the youngsters.  Being right on the beach was another advantage of the Sandpiper Resort.    Based on the room rate we paid for a Ft. Myers Beach location, we could not have been more pleased our accommodations.

title: relaxing, clean
review: I was very impressed with the very new, clean bathroom facilities including the efficient toilet, new tiles, tub and shower; even shower curtain was spotless!  Towels and sheets were white and clean smelling.  Refrigerator was very clean. Adult pool seemed to be recently redone, tiles and surface clean and unmarred.  Fresh paint on walls.  We enjoyed our weekend at the Sandpiper!

title: Zero Star for this place !
review: Room 301 had for 4 days  NO actual "high speed internet access" . No Facebook or Aol mail service could be used . We could hardly check our text messages. A call to the frontdesk ended up that I was yelled at !  Yes, I was yelled at  !  A complain to the head office ended up - nowhere. For the management of this establishment seems to me -a guest who gets yelled is no reason to apologize !!!

title: Sandpiper Gulf Resort wins again!
review: My Mom & I have been going to the Sandpiper on and off for about 20 years.  Its location right on the beach and the refreshing pools make it very relaxing.  This year we were pleasantly surprised to see that it is being very well maintained and the staff was very diligent.  The Sandpiper's association with the Pink Shell as a "sister resort" gave us something to do - we drove over to the Pink Shell and used their gym and pool.  The gym, albeit small, was fun; the pool, however, was overrun with kids.

title: Sanpiper Gulf Resort- super staff and excellent value
review: We stayed here during the off season (july 2012) and WOW were we impressed, we booked this last minute and were looking for a beach front hotel.  The website doesn't do it justice, the staff is SUPER and the location of the resort is great.  Amenities included a king size bed, full kitchen that has all the equipment we needed (minus an oven), dining table and couch.  the balacony had excellent views of the sunrise and sunset. Adult pool is a plus for anyone traveling with NO kids and want to relax and not have the 8 yr olds running around like crazy. We truly enjoyed our 3 days here and would come back again.

title: Great family place, right there on the beach!
review: Great family place, right on the beach of Fort Myers. Very clean beach front rooms. Very friendly staff.

title: Our home away from home
review: We have stayed here 3 out of the 4 times we have stayed in FMB. Highly recommend the Sandpiper. Right on the beach, nice pools, nice rooms, & always friendly service. Very accommodating.

title: We will be back!
review: Just arrived home after a four night stay at the Sandpiper and already wanting to return again soon.  What a quiet and relaxing get away!  The rooms were a pleasant surprise, the staff was very friendly and the adult only pool was perfect those traveling without children.  We'll definitely be returning to the Sandpiper!

title: So glad we picked the Sandpiper!
review: We are traveling the east and west coasts of Florida with no reservations or timeline. So using tripadvisor as a guide we picked the Sandpiper to stay at and left incredibly impressed. Definitely would stay again. Our "beach view" seemed "beach front" in the quieter tower. Private adult pool.  Easy beach access with first come first served lounge chairs and table to use on the beach. Waverunners, parasailing right there in front of the hotel. The room was nice albeit somewhat dark since there was only the balcony door letting in light. Fullsize fridge, 4 burner cooktop, microwave. All clean. The A/C? Super cold! Nice little bathroom and the king bed was pretty comfy. We stayed extra days and Tim at the front desk was very helpful. Ashley at the Pink Shell in reservations (I…

title: Sandpiper Gulf Resort is the Best!
review: Love the direct beach front rooms, but if you want to save money all the rooms are nice! Step right on to the beach or into the sparkling pool. Grill, relax, Publix store close by, small kitchenette in room and full size refrigerator, comfortable beds with good bedddng and clean to, as well as comfortable lounge chairs. Kids, families, couples it works for everyone.

title: Nice location, clean rooms
review: On behalf of everyone at the Sandpiper Beach Resort, we are delighted that you enjoyed your recent stay with us. We are very happy that you enjoyed our special interior amenities and took the time to relax and enjoy all the beach side fun! Thank you again for writing, and we look forward to welcoming you back very soon.

title: Philly Phil!
review: Stayed here in July 2011, got a partial gulf view room, view was much better than expected. Room was spacious and clean. Nice, more quiet area of Fort Myers Beach, but still close enough to everything. Saw manatees mating right near shore on our first evening there. Liked that there was an adult only pool, it wasn't heated, but being July, it was fine. We were looking there to stay again this year, but it looks like the prices have gone up a lot. Not sure if we'll come back.

title: A nice get-a-way!...away from "Times Square".
review: Swimming with the Manatees was the highlight of my trip. They just decided to swim up to shallow water right in front of the Sandpiper. Once in a lifetime opportunity. I have stayed at The Sandpiper Gulf Resort five times.I have stayed here alone and with my family. I have rented condos at various location in Fort Myers Beach, but their locations cannot compare to that of the Sandpiper. If you are traveling with children this is the place to stay. It is hassel free. The beach is nice and wide and absolutely beautiful. The pool and beach are just steps appart from one another. What I like best is the ability to sit by the pool and still see the beach. There is nothing better than waking up in the morning taking a few steps and being able to sink your toes in the white sandy…

title: Worked for us
review: This was a great hotel/condo for our first trip to FMB. The location was great and visiting the end of April/beginning of May is a perfect time to go. Upon check in we went to our room and it was not what I had requested after checking with the desk they were great about giving me an ocean front room as I had requested when the trip was booked. I had brought along the email where I requested an ocean front room.  The room: A little outdated but did the job. We were not there to be in the room. The kitchen came in handy for breakfast and lunch and the Publix is just a couple trolley stops up the road. Beds were comfortable, AC worked great, ocean front balcony was PERFECT.   The hotel: The best parts of the hotel to me were being RIGHT on the beach and the two pools. Also, daily…

title: A falling star
review: This was my sixth (seventh?) stay here, and this is my second review of it.  One of the high points of my extended family's year is going to FMB and staying at the Sandpiper, where some of the group's members have been visiting since 1998.  I find myself spending the Iowa winters counting down the months until we visit, usually in late April or May, and lamenting getting back on the plane to come home.  And the Sandpiper has been a very big factor in that experience.  Other than the family, maybe the center of it.  Sadly, when we arrived this year, we learned that the Sandpiper is under new management.  At first, that didn't seem too bad, as we were informed that some needed upgrades are slated for implementation starting this summer, including: flat screen tv's (moved to the…

title: Great Place for our first trip to Ft Myers Beach
review: We loved our beach front condo and had a great time at the Sandpiper.  Lots of privacy there, and it is not crowded.  The heater in the pool was broke so it was a little cool to swim in it.  We spent most of the time at the ocean, taking in the views.  I would prefer bigger coffee pots in the rooms instead of having to goto the lobby, but it was nice that it was offered there.  We vistied the Pink Shell, it was very nice but crowded with lots of kids and people.  Not what I am looking for when I want to have a family vacation with my own children.  I also heard the rumors of the rates increasing, hopefully not to much.  We loved our stay and would love to return again with my 3 girls.

title: 3rd stay at the Sandpiper
review: This little beachfront resort is perfect for a quiet beach vacation.  You are just a few steps away from the beach.  It is the perfect place to enjoy the Gulf, swim in the pool and see gorgeous sunsets.  This is my third stay at the Sandpiper.  Other stays were in 2010.   Hotel: The room sleeps 6, using the pullout couch.  Kitchenette has all you need, except an oven.  We usually eat 1-2 meals a day in our room.  We always stop at one of the superstores along Route 41 to stock up on all our supplies.  Publix is less than a mile away.  There are bbq grills near the pools.  TV doesn't have lots of channels, but who spends time in the room!  DVD player in room.    Air conditioning is a bit loud, but it cooled the room.  There is free coffee at the hotel lobby.    Free beach towels…

title: Good value in FMB
review: Stayed here with wife & kids for spring break 2012. Sandpiper was an excellent value on the beach - a few amenities: shuffleboard, 2 small pools. Room was good sized with 2 double beds, pull out sofa and kitchenette. Having Publix right down the street was a great bonus - able to pick up breakfast and lunch food so we weren't going out for *everything*. A few restaurants nearby, but crowded (spring break ;) - didn't make it up to Times Square area, as traffic was horrible all the time. In general, nice clean place on the beach, good value for families. Also, note that the beach is relatively quiet as there aren't any high-rise hotels nearby  - another bonus (for us). Notice farther south down the beach that you would have a LONG walk from hotel to beach, even though the hotel is…

title: Second Time Around.
review: Sandpiper has everything--family pool, adult pool, right on beach, kitchenette in room, beautiful landscaping, etc.  The courtyard with the family pool is the most beautiful oasis on Ft Myers Beach.  The parking lot is outside the courtyard, so your car is close by, but out of sight (out of mind).  Our room was poolside, first floor, so we could come and go easily through the sliding glass door.  Off to the beach, off to the pool...all through the glorious courtyard.  You can walk to Publix in about 10-15 minutes.  You can take the trolley into town from one of the stops right outside the hotel (or walk to the pier and take the trolley back).  Great place for a family vacation and/or family reunion.  Everyone can do their own thing.

title: A wonderful getaway!
review: Our room was nicely decorated and the staff was always helpful and cordial. The Publix is just down the street, so we were able to stock up on a few basics and use the kitchenette for breakfasts and lunches. Loved the lobby's coffee bar! We filled our mugs at least once each morning and took them back to enjoy on our balcony. We're looking forward to our next visit!

title: Great stay at the Sandpiper
review: I had the opportunity to stay at the Sandpiper for the first time last week with my two boys, ages 10 and 7.  We had a wonderful stay.  The room was clean and nicely decorated, with a large balcony overlooking the beach.  There were 2 queen sized beds, a small sleeper sofa and chair with a coffee table, and a kitchen table with 4 chairs in the kitchenette.  The furniture appeared in new condition and so did the carpeting.  The room is much like a small studio apartment. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and meticulously clean.  Because it is a smaller resort, it is much less crowded than other places we've stayed on Ft. Myers Beach.  I loved the kitchenette which has a full sized refrigerator, a sink, a microwave that appeared to have other cooking functions, and a 2 burner…

title: Beachfront rooms have incredible views and beach access
review: Love this place and have stayed here probably 10 times in the last 10 years.  There is not another place to watch the sunset like here. They need BIGGER tvs!!  And better channel selection!! AC can get hot in the summer - it is not sufficient for someone who likes it frigid, especially in the summer.  Publix is down the street and we always stock up and eat in the room as there are not many good take outs or deliveries available and Estero Blvd can be very crowded at times.

title: new management problems
review: we recently returned from our annual family holiday to the hotel and i must say i am dissapointed in the treatment of long term  renters at this hotel (10 years). Our reservation was bothched and after much discussion we reserved our room that we wanted . The new management was very unaccomodating and there seemed to be a stategy to refer guests to another hotel managed by the same group. We were also informed that there will be a substantial price increase for next years reservation if we were to reserve the same room . All in all very dissaponting considering the amount of years and family vacations we have spent here.

title: Fun in the Sun
review: We just returned from a five day stay at the Sandpiper.  the hotel is very nice, the grounds were immaculate.  Didnt like that there were very few ammenities, such as no coffee in the room.  Having the kitchen facilities is nice, but not even napkins or paper towels are provided.  Make a trip to Publix before checking in.  We did not have maid service for 2 days, despite putting our service flag out.  other than that, the place is great.  Staff at front desk are very polite and friendly, beach is beautiful, pools are kept very clean.  A good place to stay for the rate they charge.

title: This is the one
review: Absolutely as advertised. I'm typing this on our last morning of our stay sitting on the lanai enjoying the view and sounds of the ocean. We stayed in room 200, known as the Penthouse. It is located above the lobby and is the largest of the units. The view overlooks the courtyard with the ocean as a backdrop. The view of the ocean is slightly restricted but the quality of this unit had us asking if we could purchase it. It is newly refurnished and tastefully decorated. The entire resort is spotlessly clean as the staff is on top of everything.  Our last two stays in Florida where the Ritz Caralton in Naples and the Breakers in Palm Beach.  We expected excellence there. Here, for the price, it was a pleasant surprise. I think we will be back.

title: Sandpiper Sensation
review: It was our first visit to Fort Myers Beach, FL. The Sandpiper was just under new management and literally everyday you could see new things being instituted to "step up their game" in such a competitive environment. The management and staff were VERY accommodating. Addressing each concern/need with expediency and courtesy. It definitely felt like we were in a place like the Bahamas or West Indies as advertised. The decor was advertised as such and lived up to the description. And the sunsets. WOW! I can't imagine them looking any better anywhere on the beach. Optimum viewing!

title: had a good time but"
review: pool was great the beach was too,but rooms are not arranged to take full advantage of view and had to be in bed to see the television.chanels avalable very limited.carpet was so dirty it made my feet black.to use the beach chairs [which aren't  allowed to be on beach because they want you to rent their cabanas] you have to sit behind the waveriders and sailboat they also rent,which spoils your view of the gulf.

title: We wish we were going back this year...
review: My family traveled to Fort Myers in March 2011.  We can not say enough good things about our experience.  We had to modify our trip due to a family emergency, and the manager of the resort was very helpful.  We spent our days going from the pool to the beach (with  shuffleboard games in between).  The hotel had coffee ready every morning, which was delightful while watching the dolphins swim.  Restaurants are a bit of a drive, so we did a lot of grilling in the courtyard.   Our room was pool side and on the ground floor which was perfect with kids.

title: that little extra!
review: again a wonderfull stay in this resort with new bathrooms, a special thank to Rodney and Grant, two employees who give that little extra to their guests, a company can be proud of those hard working guys, it looks like they are the owners of this beautiful resort, however the lady who is responsible for the cleaning outside (pooldeck etc.) needs more managing from her manager, with a cellphone in the left and a towel in the right hand, its impossible to do a good job!!  I hope we see us next year again!

title: beach paradise
review: this resort hotel is the best value on fort myers beach. very friendly staff,great location,plenty of good resturants nearby,very quiet beach. would strongly recommend having stayed there several times in the last few years.

title: I waqnt to go back there!
review: I recently stayed there for about a week and enjoyed it very much. The units are very comfortable and pleasant to stay in. The whole complex is very clean, with two pools and the nearby beach; also well located, near Publix. Finally, the staff is very nice and helpful. I recommend this place to anyone.  R.B. , Belgium

title: great
review: Just got home from this wonderful gulf front resort.  Beach is wonderful, rooms clean, staff great, helpful, the only thing was wrong was that I could not stay longer.  Will stay again when come back to Fort Myers Beach.

title: perfect stay
review: We are from Germany and we were making holidays in Florida.We drove from Fort Lauderdale to Fort Meyers.We had a perfect stay at this hotel...a new hotel room, so nice... receptionist James is just awesome...friendly and really taking care of his guests...we are coming back for sure. Annett and Basti

title: Sandpiper Gulf Resort - Estero Island Gem
review: I spent the evening in Paradise.  Traveled to the island for an overnight stay.  I will definitely return with family and friends. The Gulf of Mexico is beautiful. Sandpiper Gulf Resort is the perfect resort in Ft. Myers Beach to enjoy the beauty of the island and awesome sunsets.   I dined alfresco under majestic palm trees enjoying the perfect weather. The staff was friendly and very knowledgeable, the room was super clean and the parking easy and free!  A perfect getaway resort.  I strongly recommend the Sandpiper Gulf Resort.

title: Great Time
review: This was our fourth year staying at Sandpiper and it was just as great as the first. Great location, right on the gulf. Publix is just up the road and it's a short drive or trolley ride to time square. Waverunner rental on location, say hello to Andy at mid-island watersports, super guy. Can't say enough about Sandpiper, friendly staff, great location and clean rooms. WE'LL BE BACK AGAIN!

title: We love the Sandpiper Gulf Resort!!!
review: My husband and I spent a glorious week in unit 370 at this resort from June 7 to June 14. My only regret is taking so long to write my review. We loved the set up as it is not a high rise hotel and we were literally right on the beach. The staff was always helpful and friendly, I wish I could remember all the names but compliments to Tony, Rodney and James among all the others. Our kitchen was well equipped with a full size refrigerator, the view was outstanding, the beach, the room and the hotel itself were kept clean and well maintained. We absolutely loved the adult pool for its privacy, tables and chairs and quiet atmosphere. During the weekend there were 2 large groups staying at the hotel but management and staff handled it exceptionally well. The resort is conveniently…

title: Lots of nice things at sandpiper
review: Great mid island location. Great views and friendly staff. Two pools, one for the kids and one for adults. You won't be disappointed,

title: Awesome View
review: We stayed in several rooms on Fort Myers beach but room 370 has it all, the view, the comfort, the perfect height for listening to the waves at night and no one is making noise above or next door.  We can not recommend this unit any more.

title: Just as we remembered!
review: We return to the Sandpiper Gulf Resort because our boys (now 8 & 9) wanted to go back to the "yellow place". They had fond memories of the first time when they were 4 & 6. Well, our stay was just as pleasant this time. The grounds were well maintained and the rooms were clean and inviting. The staff was friendly and very accomondating. We will return again!!!

title: It was horrid!
review: We were given a room in the tower that had a balcony facing the ocean but the balcony doors had nothing to attach to.  They seemed to float in the doorway where they should have been attached but were not.  The room is like a compartmentalized box.  When we sat on the toilet it felt as if we were leaning and for some reason the thing shook!!!  It was frightening.  There was nothing to assist us in getting all of our vacation gear to the 4th floor but our own two hands... no cart, nothing!  When we asked to move room we were told we could have an ocean front room the next day by noon so we went to bed with that hope.  The next day we asked the people in that room when they were checking out and we were told in 2 days!  It was a shock.  When we checked with the office we were told…

title: Still love this place...
review: Good Afernoon  We have reviewed your comments made on Trip Advisor. I see in your review that you indicated you stayed in June. I would apreciate the opportunity to discuss your experience with you further. My e-mail is Plandis@tcgr.com and my name is Perry Landis. I oversee the resort division for our company. My primary office is located at The Sandpiper.   I haven't ever received a complaint in regard to te Jet Ski rental operation previously so I would appreciate is if you could elaborate via e-mail. Having 300 feet of beach makes me wonder what occurred during your stay to cause the slick you described. The watersports company is closely monitored by several agencies so if there is a problem which appears to be isolated we would like to make sure it doesn't affect any future guest stays.   In regard to the unit we can't find anything wrong with any balcony doors and we reviewed maintenance repairs for the last three months.   Please e-mail me specifics  Thank you  Perry Landis VP  Sandpiper Gulf Resort

title: Very Nice Resort
review: Stayed for 4 nights...Monday to Friday...great deal 4 nites for the price of three...We've been here many times...you can't beat the location or the gorgeous beach. I noticed that the rooms  have new doors on the bathrooms and closets, and the sheets fit the beds!!!  Also, beds were fresh and clean, and I think the mattresses must have been replaced, since they were more comfortable than last year. The room was very clean, and we had an adjoining room with our son and his family...their first time at Sandpiper and they loved it!  My only complaint is that the bathroom fan was noisy, vibrating, and didn't even have a blade in it! I also noticed there was a lightbulb missing, and the thing was basically rusted out and needed replacing. I hope when the tubs are replaced  that this…

title: FANTASTIC STAY
review: Just got back from first trip to Sandpiper.  Overall it was a good experience and I would go back again.  On the positive side, right on the beach.  This property has a great location and you can easily set up your beach site and come and go as you please all day without worry.  Staff was friendly and called ahead to find out that early check-in was available.  Having two separate pools was a great benefit and didn't see one kid near the adult pool.  The family pool is very busy and extremely noisy.  The rooms were clean but definitely show signs of the heavy wear and tear.  On the negative side, the bed in my particular room was horrible.  This could be a deal breaker in the future and will pack an Aero bed just in case for next time.  Will also try a different room.   Wi-Fi…

title: Marvelous as always!!
review: Another wonderful stay at the Sandpiper in Ft. Myers.  As always, the staff is very friendly and attentive. Everyone there is on top of things; any request is met with a smile and quickly. KUDOS to the entire staff.  The rooms are impecably clean; large and comfortable. The pools are maintained and very clean.    I have nothing but GREAT things to say about this hotel and will keep coming back every chance I get and recommend it without hesitation.

title: Perfection
review: My wife and I got married here on June 24th, 2011. I will say that picking a resort and beach site unseen was a little unnerving at first because we had no idea of what to expect. But once we got there and saw the rooms and the beach we were happy. What made our wedding day more perfect was how accomadating the staff was. They were very nice, assisted during and after the wedding, and made sure everything was perfect during our stay. The resort is a trolley ride away from the shopping and bars, which is .50 cents per way. It was a very affordable and beautiful place. Also we had 18 people there with multiple rooms and every person had a great time. I reccomend this place to anyone it is beautiful, affordable, and close to multiple entertainment venues. Good luck finding a better…

title: Can't wait to go back in July
review: While it was raining off and on in Palm Beach County we were enjoying the breeze and Gulf in Lee County and had no rain.  We need the rain but we were thrilled it didn't show this weekend.  We have stayed at Sandpiper over the years and always enjoy ourselves.  this time the property and rooms were exceptional and while we were there new bedspreads arrived for the Tower.  It is great to know they keep up with the furnishings and try to make everything so nice. We would recommend Sandpiper to all of our friends and family!!!!

title: I have been going here since I was 3....I am 46 now!
review: When I was a little girl, my family would drive down from Chicago for 3 weeks every year. In 76 we moved to Tampa. To this day, I still frequent the Sandpiper. Sometimes I go with my Mom and last year went with my own family. What great memories have from my childhood and now with my own with my family. I totally recommend this place. It is quiet, relaxing and a perfect location. I prefer the first floor ocean view or pool view. Not the high rise. Probably because this is where we always stayed when I was little. I actually keep a picture of it in at my desk at work to remind me of the relaxation I get there! Helps in stressful times!

title: Great family vacation!!!! We love it here!!
review: Thank you very much for your review and for decades of Patronage to The Sandpiper. We appreciate your loyalty with so many options for vacations in todays economy. We look forward to serving your family for many years to come.   Best Regards   Perry Landis VP The Continental Group Realty

title: We loved it, great location!!
review: The Sandpiper is a great little Gem on the Ft. Myers Beach.  The rooms are nice, the bathrooms are small but still nice, great lay-out and opens up onto a beautiful garden pool area.  I will say I am a hotel snob so I review with a critical eye.  The bathtub had some weird worn spots, and the bat mat did not look like it was clean as could be, so I just wore my flip flops in the shower.  I would suggest if you are going to be staying at the Sand piper in May or June ask if they are having any large groups visiting.  They have several large groups in May and June and they one of those was our first weekend at the Sandpiper and it made for a crowded somewhat unpleasant first day or two.

title: Dream Vacation
review: Thank you for taking the time to rate Sandpiper Gulf Resort. We appreciate your patronage and we wanted to inform you that we will begin the bathroom remodels in August of this year which will include new bath tubs and new tile featurs which will enhance the three star feel of the suites.   Thank you Again  Perry Landis VP  The Continental Group Realty Inc.

title: Best vacation in the last 7 years
review: This Resort was one of the best we've ever stayed in.  We were so happy to find this place at the last minute and at a great rate.  The staff is excellent and go above and beyond to make sure the guests are happy.  We have a son in a wheel chair and their creativity to make sure his stay was enjoyable was appreciated and showed how much they care about their guests.  After hearing from us how it would be nice if he could get down to the "hard sand" on the beach they came up with a way for him to cross over the soft sand with his chair without having to drive it through the sand and ruin the chair!  We will definitely be going back for more great memories.  Very clean and well kept and the pictures can't do this place justice.  : )

title: We loved it and we'll be back.
review: All of the staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was awsome with a great view with magnificent sunsets.Our room over looked the adult poor and the beach with clear views.Having the adult pool was very nice,nothing against kids we have 4 of our own along with a grandson.We would recomend Sandpiper to anyone that wants to have peaceful and relaxing vacation. We will be back for our next vacation. Side note you must eat at the Yucatan Bar and Grill great atmosphere and food, must try the grilled Mahi Mahi.

title: The Perfect Location
review: Stayed in a room with a view of the Gulf.  The people staying there were friendly.  The staff was very efficient.  Rodney at the front desk was friendly and helpful.  Great beach, two pools to choose from.

title: awesome location- perfect stay
review: stayed there for 5 nights, had an awesome holiday friendly staff, clean rooms, very well furnished We had beachfront, it was awesome to watch the sun go down every evening  The beach is great and they have chairs on the beach near the adult pool, so you do not need to rent them for big money....great !!! We will definitely come back ..no need to choose another resort, this one is the best !!

title: Would stay again in a heart beat
review: We've been coming to the resort for many many years.  They have had many changes there for the better.  Front desk people, Rodney and little Tony were very gracious.  Rodney will go out of his way for you to make things right if something is wrong.  I will be back again!!

title: Perfect!
review: The Sandpiper made our vacation absolutely perfect.  The location is excellent, right on the beach and yet far enough from all the crowds on the north end of the island.  We walked the beach every morning and at sunset; and watched dolphins right from our deck. The pools and grounds are clean and inviting.  The staff was friendly and made excellent recomendations for nearby restaurants and things to do.  We are so grateful that we chose the Sandpiper for our vacation!

title: Wish I could have stayed a week or two
review: What a real find . We where just traveling around looking at places to consider as a " Winter home or Snowbird House" and stayed at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort .  The front desk person , Tony Matthews , was such a friendly and helpful person .  He made us feel so welcome and you can tell he loves the area .  We would love to come and stay a couple of weeks .

title: Excellent place - right on the beach
review: Excellent place to stay - it is right on the beach, two pools (one for adults) room was clean - staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about the area - room was clean and had a kitchen as well as a lanai - had a poolside room with a view of the ocean as well - would recommend this resort

title: An amazing place to stay!!!
review: I had an great time at the Sandpiper.  The rooms are clean and beautiful.  I had an ocean view and being so close to the beach was amazing.  The resort itself had something for everyone.  You can rent jet ski's in your backyard and going for ocean walks was fantastic.  We saw stingrays, crabs and all kind of ocean life.  I will definately be staying here again without question.

title: AMAZING RESORT
review: I recently spent a girls weekend at the Sandpiper.  I have absolutely nothing but praise for this resort. When you have a group of ladies together, I'm sure you can imagine that we could be a bit needy.  The staff was unbelievable and accomodated all our requests.  The rooms were fantastic - very clean and so comfortable. Both our rooms had a great kitchenette with a full size fridge so that was an added plus.   It really fit all our needs perfectly.  The resort is right on the beach.  The beach is spectacular with white sand that was so nice to walk on.  The Sandpiper is coveniently located on the strip, close to grocery and restaurants. The staff recommended Junkaroos for dinner and it was AMAZING.   I will most definitely stay here again and soon.

title: Perfect
review: From beginning to end, everything about the Sandpiper perfectly suited our trip. We will be back - hopefully soon! :)

title: The Best Girls trip Ever
review: We recently stayed at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort this weekend for a mini Girls get-a-way.  Not only was the Hotel stay there beautiful but the staff was extremly accomodating in so many ways which made our trip a lifetime of memories to share!  I highly recommend your stay here at the Sandpiper, the beaches are amazing, soft white sand and the accomodations and recommended resturaunts were wonderful!  Did I say the Sunsets were "Priceless" too!  I plan to bring my family here in the Summer, what a great place to go for some R and R and fun in the Sun!

title: Already planning a return stay next February !!
review: We have recently returned after spending 15 days at the "Sandpiper Gulf Resort" and I can not believe that we stayed at the same place as "junezeln" (17 Feb 2011) !!  Our experience was the same as that enjoyed by the majority of people who stay at the Sandpiper .... and was nothing like that enjoyed by "junezeln" !!  We found the place to be extremely clean and well maintained ... but, of course, you will always have the odd minor problem !!  In our case it was the fridge which woke us in the middle of the night making a noise like an alarm clock, but a call to Reception next mormning and it was fixed within the hour !  The other thing that pleased us about the place was the friendliness and assistance received from the staff.  They advised us on the local restaurants and those…

title: The staff's needs are more important than the guests
review: We arrived at 10am to check in knowing they would probably not be ready early and were told nothing is available before 4pm. We convinced them to take our phone number "in-case". We asked if we could at least put food in the fridge - no the staff doesn't like it. At 4pm we were told nothing was ready yet and it would be at least another hour. Explaining we had a dinner meeting to attend and really needed to clean up first, we were told by the staff was working as fast as they could. We commiserated with 4 other guests also waiting to check in.  We were allowed into our room just after 5pm (before the others waiting) and reminded that check out was promptly at 11am (your electronic key is turned off). Not sure why promptly at 11am as the staff did not enter the room to clean it…

title: Wonderful, Friendly, Clean Beachfront Resort
review: Dear CWITHP  It is unfortunate that you didn't feel you received the exceptional service that so many before and after your stay reported.   I questioned the front desk staff and GM to see if they remembered a guest that had reported having issues as you mentioned on your Trip Advisor review and they were not familiar with your myriad of issues   reported.   I certainly would have preferred if you had reported your issue to Mr. Montoya the GM and we might have been able to resolve your dilemma before we tainted a 4 year relationship with a repeat guest.   I have overseen the Sandpiper as part of my Florida Resort division since Feb of 2005 and although I don't spend a great deal of time at the front desk I would have been more than happy to discuss your issues as would have my GM.   My concern is that many issues you mentioned are services we provide routinely for our guests without being prompted for example early check in (if the room is ready), taking your cell phone number to contact you when the room is ready, use of the facilities while you wait and even the storage of refrigerated items in one of our two common refrigerators.   I see to it that formal ongoing training is done with our various resort staff and by reviewing the other more favorable reviews we receive it seems to be working.   You mentioned about staff vehicles being in the way or cleaning of pool desks at 8am being an annoyance. Unfortunately we have to have the two pools open by 9am each morning and as you were well aware we had upwards of 300 people using our facility during this peak time of year so keeping it clean is a necessary task. We wait until 8am even though the city ordinance allows for this type of work as early as 7am so that our guests are not disturbed. Also the units have hurricane rated doors and windows so the noise should have been minimal had you slept with the sliders closed. Our check in time is as soon as the unit is ready or by 4pm. Sometimes there are issues with a unit, or a volume of cleaning that prevents us from getting everyone in by that time. In those cases we would have offered to compensate you in a reasonable fashion for the delay.   My e-mail is Plandis@tcgr.com if you would like to discuss your issues further or you feel I need to address specific employees that will make the vacation experience better for all.  Perry Landis  VP Resorts

title: Sister's Trip
review: Excellent value and location. Clean and friendly staff. We loved the pools and the white sandy beach at your toes. Stayed in room 240, big, full kitchen and all updated. Comfortable beds too! Publix and CVS are close by and you are away from the crazy downtown noise.

title: Fantastic Time
review: My sisters and I wanted to book a quick 4 night 5 day trip to our favorite beach. I searched online and found Sandpiper. It fit all of our needs. It was conveniently located on the strip, close to grocery and restaurants. It offered everything we needed, kitchenette, pool and it's right on the beach. We aren't high maintenance and just wanted to get away for a few days. We enjoyed it very much.The staff was very friendly! The rooms were a little outdates (carpet and window treatments, but who stays in the room when they're on vacation?! I will stay here again! Our favorite part was having the resort right on the beach!

title: Will return, year after year!!
review: Another fun time spent at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort.  Always a pleasure to stay at the Sandpiper and be treated with much respect from the front desk personnel (Rodney).    The resort is nicely landscaped and very clean....anyone looking for a fun place to stay with everything you need - You must then choose the Sandpiper Gulf Resort!

title: lovely spot on the beach
review: Stayed here for 3 nights: ocean front ground floor unit.  It had 2 queens and a kitchenette, table seating 4,  couch, and patio overlooking the beach.  Fort myers beach is a small beach resort community.  there is nothing else except the beach.  it is close to Naples.  we have family there. liked the room:  clean, great set-up for us.  full fridge, very useful.  it is not a fancy place.  we stayed in the high rise, Point Estero resort a few years back, and that was a full condo and much fancier. would be happy to stay at either place again. the pool was small, clean, and heated to a fabulous 90 degrees.   Overall I would rec this place.   lots of older people, but looks great for kids.  Wi-fi included, easy to use.  we never had to interact with staff, as we came in late, and…

title: Was I really a guest, or just another nusiance?
review: The room was just ok, with a very strong smell. Opened the balcony door first thing. I am not sure if the day shift desk clerk realized that I was a guest, for he certainly did not treat me like one. I approached the front desk to request that the shower be fixed, as it was not turning on. I got no "good morning", or, "can I help you". Just a look, as if to say,"what do you want?" The evening before we called the front desk to check on availability of internet service, and to report a burned out light bulb. Had to leave a message on a machine. The message was never answered. Was informed next day that there is no clerk after 8PM.  Surprise! That is not written down anywhere. No apology offered. Asked for a late check out. Mistake. "We have people checking in. I only have 3…

title: Beautiful location, comfortable, nice place to stay on the beach
review: Hello Junezeln  I am sorry to hear that you didn't receive the stellar service and  experience that The Sandpiper is well known to provide.   I am providing you my e-mail as I would like to know who treated you in a than a service oriented approach.   I am Thankful that you brought this to my attention and would have liked to have handled your issue at the time it occurred.   In regard to office hours they are posted on the lobby, in your welcome folder material and also in the Guest room guide.   We have a Guest service agent that is on the property from 8pm until 4am to keep an eye on the Resort and provide for urgent requests.   Please e-mail me so I can follow up with you.   Thank you  Perry L.   You can e-mail me at Plandis@thecontinentalgroupinc.com.

title: A great place on Ft Myers Beach
review: Stayed in second floor oceanfront unit (#262).  Perfect views of the beach, ocean and sunsets.  Loved relaxing on the balcony.  Rooms not extravagant but well done and have all you need including kitchen with full size refrigerator.   Property was clean inside and out.  Even though the temperature fell to the 40's overnight, the pools were comfortably heated.   Definitely a great place to stay for a weekend or vacation on the beach!

title: My Yellow Brick Home
review: This is our third Jan/Feb stay at The Sandpiper and we intend to be back.  Sandpiper is right on the beach, the rooms are large, comfortable, the grounds are well kept up, clean, the office staff, maintenance staff and cleaning staff are friendly and courteous, two heated swimming pools.   They have little things like a grill in the courtyard for use by anyone, free bottles of water, more.  It's been a quiet place...not a lot of noisy parties.  I highly recommend this place.

title: Great first time experience in Ft. Myers Beach!
review: This was part business part leisure trip. Travelling with family is sometimes harder than expected, but this was a flawless trip. The resort was beautiful and the staff at the property extremely courteous.

title: Relax
review: We found this great place by pure coincidence and loved it. The rooms are spacious with a little kitchen fully equipped  and a balcony. We had a room facing the beach on he second floor and absolutely loved it. The whole resort is very well kept and clean. A big compliment to the staff who run this resort. It would not be the place if it wasn't for them.

title: Wonderful small "condo-tel" on the beach
review: Everyone on staff is very friendly and goes out of his way to be helpful. Rooms are always clean and well-maintained. Heated pool was 85 degrees during the coldest week of December. This was our fifth stay and we will be back.

title: fabulous again!
review: again our stay was great, we stayed now in several hotels/motels but Sandpiper is and will be in future our favourite! great spot and service and accomodation ok only the rooms can use a little upgrading esp. the bathroom.  I hope we see us again  in Nov/Dec 2011  Jan and Carla van der Niet Noordwijk Netherlands

title: fabulous beach experience
review: We loved our first visit to Ft Myers Beach and our stay at the Sandpiper. Can't wait to get back another time. We were there for a wedding so didn't have time to get to know the area much, but we were completely happy just being at the resort. I particularly liked that it is a smaller, more intimate place,and we were not near any high rises, so the walk along the beach was very realxing. We saw dolphins swim by each morning, and the white powder sugar sand was the softest I've ever walked on. Great shell collecting, too!

title: My Summer Getaway
review: We have been going to the Sandpiper for the last 4 years and now have all our family and freinds going also. Whether you are looking to do a family reunion or just looking to get away and relax, this is the place for you. With well appointed comfortable rooms and a freindly atmosphere, it is easy to want to return to this paradise over and over.   The staff is very proffesional,  freindly and accommodating. We are truly greatful to Anthony & Rodney for making all our stays memorable. See you next Summer! Lucia & Douglas Rispa

title: Simple  Pleasures
review: The  Sandpiper  was  the  most  ideal  location to  experience  what  we  would  describe  as  'simple  pleasures'.  It's  a  well-kept  beach  front  property  where  we've  enjoyed  early  morning  walks  and  late  evening  beach  strolls.  The  view  from  our  room  was  all  about  beautiful  sunsets where  we  slept  with  our  sliding  door open  to  enjoy  the  sounds  of  the ocean  as  it   broke  onto  the  shore. Our   most  memorable  experience  from  the  5  days  and  4  nights  that  we  stayed  was  to  see  the  dolphins  frolicking  so  very  close   to  the  shore.  And  yes  we  could  say  that  they  did  swim  with  us  being  mere  meters  away.   If  you've  been away  from  the  ocean  as  long  as  we  have ,  it's  the  most  relaxing,  rewarding …

title: What a GREAT place to stay-without Exception
review: We were extremely satisfied with their accommodations, they were clean, bright, well appointed, and extremely spacious what a pleasant surprise upon arrival. Did not expect a suite size accommodations. You will not believe how large they are. The staff were all exceptional in attending to our needs in making our stay "The BEST ON THE BEACH"- thanx to: Rodney, Tony, Mike in security and Grant in the maintenance dept.they all are extremely helpful, friendly and willing to help in order to make your stay perfect. IF you have NOT stayed here YET- Do it -you too will be extremely pleased. Especially the staff, the facility/suites beach location and their amenities are exceptional and the location is perfect for Ft Myers Beach.

title: Best Place on Ft. Myers Beach
review: The Sandpiper is the perfect getaway hotel on the beach. The rooms are fabulous the views are breathtaking, and the location is perfect to all the main attractions. You can step out of your room and onto the beautiful white sandy beach or take a refreshing swim in one of the two pools on site. If recreational sports is your thing, there is a jet ski rental right on site! It is the perfect place for a vacation getaway with family and friends. I highly recommend the Sandpiper to anyone!

title: Terrific getaway
review: What a great place to stay for a getaway.  Clean and efficient room, everything we could need.  It was just the two of us, but it had plenty of room for four more.  Wonderful view of the gulf and the sunsets were beautiful.  Grounds are immaculately kept with a very relaxing atmosphere.  So close to the beach, didn't have to carry our things very far.  Pool was a nice size and updated.  Was in distance of some nice restaurants, but we had all the conveniences in the kitchen.  Would surely go back again and tell our friends about it as well.

title: The Sandpiper Resort is a great location that has nice, clean and up to date rooms with fantastic customer service!
review: The Sandpiper Resort was a great experience.  We had an ocean view room for such an affordable price!  The rooms are very clean and up to date. Most of all the customer service was just wonderful!  Rodney at the front desk was so friendly and helpful that it just made our stay even better.   Even though we were only there for one night everything was fantastic and I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

title: Relaxing and beautiful family mid-island resort with friendly & helpful staff
