review: Sandpiper is a beautiful ocean-front resort, located mid-island, near publix. It has 2 pools-one family and one adult.Pool towels are provided. It has a barbecue in the courtyard and a shuffleboard court.They also had jet ski rentals. We stayed in an ocean view room (229) that had a view when sitting on the balcony. The room had a nice kitchen with a stove-top, microwave, and full-size frig. It had 2 full size beds and a pull out sofa, tv with dvd player, and a sitting area. The resort has free wi-fi. The staff was helpful and friendly. We had a wonderful and relaxing time and didn't spend too much money. Great place for families or adults!

title: Great staff and views
review: beautiful beach and grounds.  granite counters and upgraded appliances,. you can't go wrong here!!

title: Best Resort In Fort Myers!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: I recently stayed at this resort and absolutely loved it.  It is very relaxed and laid back.  The rooms are very nice with complete kitchens, dining room table, and living room setup.  You are literally steps away from the beautiful beach.  I am from Fort Lauderdale and would pick this place and beach over anything in Fort Lauderdale, especially if you are looking for something a little more peaceful and relaxing.  The staff is very friendly and readily available to assist.  Definitely a must!!!

title: Most Serene Stay
review: Kudos to Tony, Grant & Rodney on being so accommodating and attentive. The Sandpiper is definetely a place I will re-visit for its charm and warmness. The walks on the beach are most relaxing and you never know what you will find on one of those walks. Have your camera ready!!!

title: FANTASTIC
review: We were there to celebrate a dear friends 60th birthday.  We ranged in age from the 80's to 2 years old.  Everyone had a wonderful time.  The rooms were clean and beautifully decorated, as was the courtyard and pool area.  The walk to the beach is about 30 feet. Rodney and his staff were so friendly and helpful, no matter what we asked for they were right there to help.  All in all it was a fantastic weekend.  We are already planning our next trip.  Go to the Sandpiper Gulf Resort you will not be sorry!!

title: Perfect family get away location, relaxing, fun & picture perfect!
review: My husband and I haven't been to Fort Myers Beach for quite some time.  We had forgotten what a pretty and fun area this was and plan to return again soon.   Sandpiper, was a perfect choice.  The staff was cheerful, efficient and helpful. Our room had a full kitchen (including a full size refrigerator) as well as a table & chairs, sofa seating area and a patio with seating. The entire resort was clean and well maintained.   We were able to rent jet ski's and parasail without leaving the resort.  The grill came in handy too... teenage boys like lots of bbq! (Publix is only a block away..) The beach area was also pristine and a treasure trove of shells not to mention the postcard perfect sunsets. The area also has numerous choices for eating out, fun shopping, and live music so…

title: Love this place...needs TLC
review: This resort is our favorite place on the west coast of FLa.  We have been there 7 times, and this time, it's starting to show some wear in the rooms.  We had double beds, they were a bit firm, and the sheets kept popping off. There's nothing worse that waking up on a bare mattress that you don't own. That being said, the sheets and pillowcases are fresh and clean. The bedspreads are heavy, dated, and a bit soiled. I don't think they are changed between guests on a regular basis.  Some routine maintainance, such as  repair of loose faucet handles in the bathroom, would be nice.  I feel houskeeping should be aware of these things and report them, a guest should not have to.  The "NO FOOD OR DRINK ON THE POOL DECK" rule is not enforced; however, i think when people are on vacation…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Hello and Thank you for your continued patronage to The Sandpiper.   I appreciate you taking the time to rate the resort and give us shining marks. I wanted to address your comments in areas that need attention.   We are in the procees right now of taking bids for several items. The Sandpiper suites were completely remodeled in 2004. The properties exterior was repainted last year and the courtyard areas were re landscaped this year. We plan to remodel the bathrooms this fall or in offseason next year as we may lose the down time period once we go through the permitting red tape. The bath remodeling bids will include a tile floor option to get away from the pergo flooring. While there are just a few units that the floor has gotten damp tile will add to te bath ambience. The tubs will be replaced with either showers or new tubs and new wall tile.  Our rental management is meeting with the directors on changes to the bedspreads as the drapes are custom so color matching is crucial.   You are correct about housekeeping reporting any items that need addressed in the units. They sometimes have limited time on busier periods that reduces their ability to report an item as prompt as we would like but by all means if you find something unsatisfactory please contact the front desk and we will address it propmptly.   The food and drink exclusion for pool areas is actually a state health department code and the state is now focusing more on this item.   Again we appreciate your patronage  Thank you  Perry Landis VP Resort Division

title: The hotel was better than we had hoped for
review: I stayed there for one night and will stay there in the future.  The staff is friendly and helpful; the room was clean, spacious and it had all the ammenities they advertise.  I drove from Ga. and requested an early check-in and it was granted without hesitation.  The kitchen area is fully equipped; the fridge is full size, cooking and eating utelsils were all clean and in perfect condition; the walk to the beach couldn't be any shorter.  The grounds are well kept and I saw the staff making rounds around the entire resort making sure everything was just right for the guests.   WIFI is slow but we had no problems connecting from the room and the pool area.  I had a teenager with me as well as an elderly person and the environment was a good one for both.  I'll stay there in the…

title: Everything was perfect including the suite, view, balcony, beach, pools and management.
review: If your looking for the perfect place with exceptional clean fresh Bermuda inspired interiors, great bedding, wonderful full kitchen and dining area, a pull out sofa and well appointed bath and vanity area, look no more........ Oh did I mention the pricing - Best on Ft Meyers Beach. Water sports rentals of all kinds just beyond the pool and A wonderfully kept imaculate beach overlooking Sanibel Island and the Gulf. We spent hours on our private 18' X 7' covered balcony. As a former hotel manager in the Bahamas, I would highly recommend the Sandpiper Gulf Resort as we plan on returning for a longer stay this fall. Rodney was very accomodating and had our suite ready for early check-in. The whole staff was professioinal, friendly and helpful and gave us a heads up on local…

title: We love our Sandpiper!
review: loved staying at the Sandpiper! The rooms are so clean! I asked the front Desk staff whoi cleans the rooms And they said Rhonda and her crew! Way to go Rhonda and your crew! Those rooms are soo cleaned and they smell soo good when Youy first walk in! What a great feeling! Now the front desk help! That Rodney!! Man what a very good job that kid does there! Sandpiper should be very proud to have him as an employer! That boy works his butt off to make Sure that WE the guests are taken very good care of! Thanks Rodney!  Jesse is awsome there at the desk to!  Me and my family will be back very soon!!

title: i love this place!
review: i have been coming to the Sandpiper since 1980 and would not stay anywhere else. Its like home away from home. When the units went for sale several years ago I was so upset thinking that I would have to find a new place to stay. I just wish I had been able to purchase one of the units! I have brought all of my children here and they absolutely love it also. I know they will continue to come on their own and this will be a family tradition for many years to come. The staff has been very helpful when ever we need anything, the rooms are always clean, the beach is kept very well and even the outside stairways, chairs, sidewalks were washed down when we were there. I really can't say enough about this place!  Love it!

title: We come back every year!
review: We have been staying at the Sandpiper every year religiously for the past 8 years or so and have no intention of looking elsewhere.  We love the location, the peace and quiet, staying right on the water, and have all that we need around us (gym, grocery store, restaurants...).  Its all we could ask for.  We have laundry facilities available to us, which makes things much easier.  The staff there is always welcoming.  Rodney makes sure we have everything we need and is more than helpful.  He has become a friend!  Grant is always there to fix or help us with anything we need.  We just could not get better service if we stayed somewhere else.  We are comfortable there and really feel like we are on "vacation" as soon as we arrive.  I would recommend the Sandpiper to everyone that…

title: Great place to stay, relax, have fun and feel safe.
review: I can't say enough about the Sandpiper Gulf Resort!  I ended up having to find a place to stay rather quickly when my mother (who was on vacation) was admitted to Healthpark Medical Center in the ICU.  I checked out a couple of other places and ended up staying at the Sandpiper due to the accomodations and the price.  I was immediately greeted by the General Manager Monica who sympathized with my situation and was more than accomodating.  She even included prayers for my mother's recovery!  After a couple of days I also had the opportunity to meet Rodney, another office worker (not sure if he has a title).  Rodney was awesome!  He took care of me and any concern I may have with care and understanding.  He too offered prayers for my mother's speedy recovery.  I ended up staying…

title: WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY!
review: Courteous employees from check-in to room and grounds service.  We had a slight problem with a noisy air conditioner which they remedied immediately.  Excellent kitchen amenities and all equipment in good working order. The view is wonderful. It's a great family place but is also most enjoyable for older folks who don't care about being around younger families so much as there is both a family pool and an adults-only pool.  There are some clear and concise rules which are enforced--such as no glass containers around the pool .  This is a protection for everyone.  The rules are fair and considerate.  Because the service and amenities are so pleasant, we've returned there now for 5 or 6 years.  They are very anxious to make our vacation experience pleasant.   While walking on the…

title: Fourth stay at Sandpiper and counting...
review: My family keeps going back year after year and for good reason.  The staff has ALWAYS been friendly--both at the desk and housekeeping/maintenance.  The location is wonderful, and the rooms/facilities have always been clean.  Two pools help to alleviate stress between those with children and those without.  You can also rent a jetski or arrange a parasail ride right there on the beach in front.  I never have, though, because we always enjoy just hanging out at the pool and on the beach at the Sandpiper!  The only improvements we would have liked this trip would have been minor maintenance issues such as an inoperative ceiling fan and slow-to-drain stool.  But they were minor enough that it didn't cross my mind to report them, so it's hard to fault the staff.  Plus,we were too…

title: Great place to stay!
review: Very nice, clean place to stay. The people at the desk were wonderful.  We'll be staying there again!

title: Didn't want to leave
review: We have stayed at this hotel for the last eigth years with the exception of the year it was under construction and the year my husband had a stroke. My girlfriend  found this place by a stroke of luck. We rent two rooms and come with the kids. It"s great. We brought a friend for a little get-away on Friday in April and left on Sunday. Mike the nite watchman gave us the key and made sure we got in fine. The next morning Rodney helped me settle up the bill and looked after our needs for the next two days.We"re going back in July for a couple of days with the kids. Hope to see Rodney, Marta, and Mike real soon.

title: Horrible Customer Service
review: When my family and I arrived at the Sandpiper at 3:15 we were told our room was not ready, which is fine because check in time is at 4:00.  However, when we returned at 4:30 to check in we were told that there was still someone in our room.  When we asked  the staff  why the room had not been cleaned in last hour no one could answer.  All they told us was the they had 18 people check out at 11:00 am and had little maid service. The staff never said they were sorry and even raised their voices and swore at us.  When we finally got into the room the tv was broken and the lights were out over the bathroom sink.  The room did seem clean. The view and the balcony was wonderful.

title: Just okay
review: We appreciate you taking the time to write about the issues you experienced at The Sandpiper. I am familiar with the circumstances in regard to your after 4pm check in. It was reported to me by the two front desk employees that were on duty the day of your arrival. First and foremost I have never had a report of these staff members cursing at a customer. It was reported to me from several of our repeat guest that a member in your party expressed their dis satisfaction with the check in time by using profanity that could be heard at the family pool. Had that person maintained reasonable decorum we would have compensated your party for the delay in checking in. This delay was do to a high volume of back to back check ins and check outs that day which was our logistical problem. In a customer service industry we realize that not all of our customers will find the excellent experience that we are known for as reported by trip advisor.

title: Great value and location
review: Location was great.  Rooms were nice.  Service was poor.  No sheets for the hide-a-bed the first night and since staff was gone, we had no way to get any.  No apology when I informed staff the next day.  I still was charged for 3 people in the room.    We had cold showers for our first 2 days.  Told staff both days - No apology and was told nothing could be done.  (I had to suggest to turn up water heater.  That fixed the problem.)  I will not return.

title: Outstanding!!!
review: Enjoyed our stay very much- the only negatives were that our room was not ready at check-in time (we couldn't have our room until 6 pm as they were still cleaning it), and the room we stayed in was in need of a little maintenance (handles missing on a few kitchen cabinets, 2 light bulbs burnt out on vanity mirror, alarm clock not functional).  The positives were that our room was squeaky clean when we did get in it, and the location of the hotel is great.  Right on the beach, which we could see from our balcony, even though we had a pool front room.  The beach was BEAUTIFUL- clean, and not too crowded. It was so great to sit by the water, and be able to run back to the room if necessary for snacks, etc.  The pool was often fairly full of kids (we didn't use the adult pool since…

title: Nice place, good location, but perhaps time for a facelift
review: Spent 4 days at the Sandpiper with my mom and 7 yr old daughter and couldn't have been happier! The hotel is right on the beach and has a great pool. The rooms are clean and neat and the staff goes out of there way to make sure your stay is a good one. You can't get any closer to the beach than the Sandpiper! Anything you need just ask Rodney he's the best!

title: great location
review: excellent service great location 10 steps from the gulf of mexico. every need catered to.The resort had a problem,during our visit, with a unruley guest and it was taken care of promptly.rodney is the greatest.the adult pool is very quiet for those  staying with out kids.thanks again see you NEXT FEBRUARY

title: Right on the Beach!
review: Our room was literally right on the beach.  We couldn't have asked for a better location.  We slept to the sound of the waves.  The room was like a studio apartment and very comfortable with nice decor.

title: Christmas Vacation
review: This is our second visit to the Sandpiper. We stayed in the 5 story building this time. The room was a bit small for 4 people,so not a lot of privacy. The condition of the room was not as nice as I expected. We has several light bulbs burned out and it could use a little updating. The location is great right on the beach and you can rent jet skies. The pool at our location was for adults only, but it was never enforced. Over all for $225 a night I think I will shop around next time we travel to Fort Myers Beach.  P.S. the staff was friendly and helpful but the free WIFI was terrible.

title: Great and Freindly resort
review: I thought thepeople especially monica the manager was outstanding the rooms were very clean and the view was great and has great location on the island

title: Another glorious stay at the Sandpiper
review: This was our third stay at the Sandpiper.  It was the first as part of the Sterling group.  We were extremely satisfied, and we feel it has the best ocean location on Ft. Myers Beach.   We walked daily, relaxed, and had many delicious meals.  The staff,  especially Rodney and Monica met our every need.  They are friendly and efficient.  All of our needs were satisfied, we will return as soon as possible   Thanks for a great vacation.

title: Loved it!
review: Great property right on the beach.  Our room was on the 1st floor gulf view and what a beautiful view it was, from the white sandy beach to the wonderful sunsets.  The pool and beach were only a few steps away.  Everyone working there was wonderful from Rodney at the front desk to Norma in housekeeping.  Stay 2 nights and get the 3rd free!  Can't wait to go back!!!!!!

title: AHHHHHH peace and tranquility
review: Have staying at The Sandpiper for years. This was the most relaxing vacation. The staff is wonderful, great job, the rooms are very nice, the views are amazing. The most beautiful sunsets.

title: Great location, clean and comfy.
review: We booked this after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor just the day before we drove down from Orlando for a long weekend on the beach. The location is along the main boulevard of Fort Myers Beach and the hotel is right on the beach front.  It's a couple of miles from the heart of Fort Myers Beach and it's pier, but is is a quieter and nicer part of the island. Staff on reception were friendly, efficient and helpful.  We were offered 3 nights for the price of 2 as it was out of season and this made the stay very good value for money.  However, even without the offer, the accommodation is good value for the area.  You can get cheaper hotels but they looked more basic and dated. We had a gulf facing unit with comfortable king bed.  The kitchen area had a huge fridge/freezer,…

title: Great Plade to Stay!
review: The room was great, the pool was great, the beach was RIGHT THERE, so nice to walk from our room to the Gulf in less than 100 steps!  The room was more than I expected and looked just like the pictures.  The kitchen was fully stocked with everything that we needed to prepare all of our meals.  The entire resort was very clean and well kept.  The resort staff were very friendly and accommodating.   My only gripe is the size of the shower!  The resort should invest in curved shower curtain holders to expend the width of the shower.   My daughter and I had a wonderful time and we plan on returning next year.

title: WHat a place to stay
review: Thank you very much for staying with us at The Sandpiper. I appreciate you taking time to share your experience on Trip advisor.   Sincerely  Perry Landis VO Commercial Property Division Continental Managed Resorts

title: Great location to spend a weekend or a day
review: The Sandpiper Gulf Resort staff goes all out to make it nice.  Rooms are quite clean and spacious.  The two pools are great because they have one for adults and one designated for children/everyone.

title: Whoa! Well defined flea bag!
review: I wanted to Thank you for not only staying with us at The Sandpiper but for taking the time to tell others about your experience.   Perry Landis VP Commercial Property Division

title: 4th of July Stay at The Sandpiper Gulf Resort
review: Oh my. Where to start? The peeling paint was a hint, but one of the reasons the paint was peeling on the ceiling in our bathroom was that the bathroom in the room above us LEAKED into ours! So gross. And at one point sitting in the living area the kitchen sink started making a horrible racket and dirt and soap started shooting up into our sink from ( I guess) the neighbors dishwasher. It was truly like a bad movie. Top that off with the mound of noisy people, including the over-crowded unit next to ours where some of the guests were sleeping on lawn furniture with the hotel bedding and you have yourself a true Florida West Coast flea bag.  When we checked out the line of similar complaints departing early was quite long. Internet was down, and overall just a very run down…

title: Didn't Want TO Leave
review: Dear Fladoula  I reviewed your problems with the front desk staff as well as with The GM Moncia Nunez.   It certainly appeared as you had a very difficult stay. By now you should have heard from one of our staff in regard to compensating you for your issues. I hope this makes at least a small difference in your visit to us.   The primary problems that occurred during your weekend were both peer related. We had someone who was less than courteous bening loud around your room and another issue with someone blocking our plumbing line. As you can see from guest 's comments before and after you that we have resolved these problems. I did want to inform you that even though our oifice closes at 8pm that there is an emergency number that you can call for any noisy neighbor issues.It is posted on the front office and again in the welcome book in your room.  We have a night time courtesy agent who will respond to issues from 8pm on.  The plumbing issue must have been extremely annoying for you and on behalf of our company I wanted to publically apologize for your unpleasant experience.   Thank you for taking the time to bring these issues to our attention.

title: Great place to stay, affodable!
review: Recently we were driving up and down Estero Blvd trying to find a hotel and decided to stop by your resort.  When we entered the office the gentleman "Rodney" greeted us with great respect but with some humor to may us more relaxed at knowing we were choosing the right place to stay.  While inquiring about the place Rodney offered to show us one of the rooms and made sure that we were happy with the room before booking with your resort.  He pointed out all the ammenties that the resort had and made us so at home and relaxed.  This was our second stay at your resort and the BIG reason we chose to come back was because of your staff and Rodney.  The night watchman Mike was very nice and made sure the resort was safe.  I would highly recommend The Sandpiper Gulf Resort to my family…

title: WOW what a great place to stay at!
review: You know I cant say enought about Sandpiper Gulf Resort. The place is so clean,quiet,relaxing. I had such a great time wile on vacation there. I am going to tell everybody I know and meet about this beautifle place to visit.  The customer service is the best ever. The people at the front desk are so welcomeing and warm when you walk in. They great you with respect right away and they go OUT OF THERE WAY to help you out anyway they can. How awsome is that!!  There is NO BETTER place to STAY but at the SANDPIPER in my book!

title: The Sandpiper is a relaxing, quiet simple getaway.
review: If your tired of paying for alot of extras you and just want the enjoy the beach with great rooms then you'll love the Sandpiper. The rooms are very clean and the views are great. My family just had a wonderful beach vacation and we will be back.

title: Great for the price
review: I stayed here in January 2008 with my mom for a short girls trip.  We found it online and they honored a discount my mom had through her credit card, so we got 5 days for $400.  Our room was big with a kitchenette for us to have some of our meals in.  The fridge was plenty big to hold my margaritas and cans of coronas.  The grills pool side were perfect for soaking up the sun while getting lunch ready, and there was laundry facilities if you choose to use them.  We had coffee on the beach every morning and watched the sun set every day.   There was a little damage to one of the walls in our room, but all in all it was clean and well kept.  I would go back again.

title: Rexlaxing Resort right on the Gulf!
review: Relaxing Resort right on the Gulf! Spent a wonderful February at the Sandpiper - great resort and great mid island location. Sandpiper has a nice friendly staff and also a nice group of guests, many of whom return each year as we do. A great place to enjoy the gulf views, as well as walk the beach or just find a spot to read a book. Marian Plainfield, IL

title: Relaxing, Refreshing Change of Pace
review: We hope to return to the Sandpiper Gulf Resort--for two weeks--next year!  The location is great--away from the Times Square hubub but close to the grocery and a nice plaza with shops and restaurants.  Darlene at the front desk booked our reservation and it was such a delight to meet her in person.  Part of the reason things went so well is she had great tips on where to eat, what to see, and was just a lovely person.  The fact that we met people around the pool who had been coming here for 20 years or more says something!  I should also mention the man who took care of the pool; he was so personable as well and told us about Heavenly Biscuits.  Even on his day off he saw my sister-in-law and I walking on the beach and stopped to chat!  We do not feel the urge to shop for a…

title: Wonderful Experience
review: We found The Sandpiper Gulf Resort via on-line search and were not disappointed. In fact, we were pleasantly surprised that everything about our stay beat our expectations. Location is great, rooms are very clean and well maintained, and the staff is absolutely superb. Darlene at the main lobby and Dwight the groundskeeper are simply wonderful to interact with day to day. They both truly care about the quality of the experience that their guests enjoy. I would recommend The Sandpiper Gulf Resort to anyone who is interested in a top notch vacation getaway experience at a price well below the top-tier prices along the beachfront.

title: Great Resort, Wonderful Service
review: We just finished 8 days at the Sandpiper and had a wonderful time.  The staff worked hard to make our stay trouble free and comfortable.  The entire resort was freshly painted and looked great.  We will be back again next year.

title: we loved this place
review: We had a great time here, very cordial staff,in fact helpful staff, very clean and if you have children its the place to go. We have been several places on the beach and keep coming back here, its the Best!!

title: Perfect vacation! Excellent alternative to a high rise, and for people who want a kitchen etc.
review: Thank you for your time in writing a response on Trip Advisor. We appreciate you staying with us at The Sandpiper and sharing your experience with others.  Perry Landis  Regional Manager  Resort Division

title: A relaxing place to be
review: This is our third trip to Ft. Myers Beach in 4 years. As an empty-nest couple, we are avid Red Sox fans who usually choose to vacation on the East Coast of Florida, but the Sox brought us to the Ft. Myers area. As a former travel agent ...and Cape Codders, we are picky about beaches.... because this was a shorter trip we wanted to be right on the beach.  We looked here in trip advisor and narrowed it down to three, choosing the Sandpiper as opposed to a high rise and a property similar to Sandpiper but closer to the Times Square area.  This is a property that sells the units for ownership (not sure if it is time-share or full-ownership).  There are clearly people who seem to have spent the winter there.  We wanted to be facing the beach so that we could see the spectacular…

title: Much better than expected
review: Booked this just the day before as a last minute deal and were unsure what to expect, we got a good deal over the phone a the manager explained that some work was going on and they were offering a 30% discount, the work did not interfere at all with our 2 night stay, the apartment were listed as sleeping 6 but to be honest you wouldnt want to do that for a week, but for a family of 4 they are brilliant, the pool is really warm and clean as is the spa, the whole complex is spotless and the location is unbeatable, a great spot and would have no hesitation recommeding it for a family of 4, but not for 6.

title: West is the Best!!
review: Thank you for taking the time to write about your experience at The Sandpiper Gulf Resort.  We appreciate you choosing A Sterling Managed Resort for your vacation.  Respectfully  Perry Landis Regional Manager

title: Our Favorite Place To Stay
review: The hotel and room was fantastic!! Everything we had hoped for and more except for one issue. The wireless connection! They advertised they have wireless; however we were beachfront and there was no way to access the internet unless you went outside on the deck and then it was spotty. We went to the office and had problems too. We had asked them and they rebooted a few times, but the connection was still very slow and spotty. Two of us had to work everyday a few hours and it was very stressful until we decided we would sit in our car and use the wireless from the next hotel. Not pleasurable; however it  did work.   If you don't need the internet.. you will be delighted! The beachfront rooms are the way to go! Perfect location if you don't like the hustle and bustle.  One note…

title: Loving every minute of it
review: Thank you for sharing your experience with Trip Advisor. Our apologies are extended in regard to your internet issues. I use it Monday through Friday with very little issue but some room locations have had issues. We keep it at no charge because of this issue. You shouldn't have had any trouble in our lobby however and I will make sure the GM reviews reset procedures with the staff. Also the association is looking into other options for wireless to enhance transmission.   Sincerely   Perry Landis Regional Resort Manager

title: Great place to stay
review: Our stay at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort left no room for improvement!  Our room was so beautiful, so perfectly clean and decorated in a warm feeling, a comfortable West Indies look.  The glass on the sliding glass doors was spotless.  Our room was as clean as if we owned it.  We had our own private patio, which was very large, and it included two chaise lounges, two chairs, a small table, and there still was plenty of room left to move around.  We were right on the beach with nothing blocking our view.  Our view was beautiful, and we were so up close to see the dolphins jumping and playing!!  The pools (2) were beautiful, and the grounds was immaculate.  Even with all of this, what stands out with us is the hospitality and that we were never treated as "just a customer" but as a…

title: Lovely Location
review: The location of this hotel is superb.  We had a ground floor beachfront.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable with all the amenities you need my only criticism was the bathroom.  It was very small and in desperate need of some attention.  One night we had an unwanted visitor in there.  I didn't complain about this at the time as I figured its an internal room in a damp, humid environment.  I felt with the best will in the world these things can happen.  I did mention it on leaving just so they knew really and I was offered very sincere apologies and told I should have complained at the time so it could have been addressed.  The  staff at the hotel were curteous and helpful at all times and I cannot fault their service.  The pools were lovely and we enjoyed the adult only…

title: Lucky Find!
review: My husband and I were evacuated from Key West due to hurricane Ike. We decided to drive up the west coast of Florida and find a place to stay until we were permitted back in Key West.   With no particular place to go, we agreed that we would just drive until we found a place we liked.. and that turned out to be The Sandpiper Resort. We loved the ocean front view, the cleanliness of the room, and the great swimming pool.  The staff was very pleasant and helpful, especially Monica Nunes, the GM. Thanks!

title: Clean but needs some work
review: Thank for taking the time to write Trip advisor and for your nice comments. I agree Ms. Nunez is definitely a good choice for our company.   We hope to see you back again.   Perry Landis Regional Manager

title: Going Down Hill
review: Stayed at the Sandpiper for the second time this year, as a girls' getaway weekend in Ft. Myers Beach.  The location and beach are great, it's why we keep coming back to the area.    We had a beachfront room on the 2nd floor.  The rooms are very clean inside.  The bathrooms are a little run-down and need to be renovated.  We had a moldy shower curtain this time, but at least the shower drain did drain.  The beds are fairly comfortable, but the sheets keep popping off the mattress...they seem too small.  The kitchenette area in the room was nice and well stocked with utensils and plates/cups.  Was glad to see they had a bottle opener and wine key too.  Definitely pick up some snacks and drinks at Publix down the road so you don't have to go out all the time!  The exterior of the…

title: Our Favorite Getaway
review: Thank you for pointing out some areas that need attention. We are aware of this and we we are addressing these areas in the fall. Unfortunately pressure washing won't do anymore so we have a compete exterior painting project beginning in the next few months. The walk ways will be getting new water proof membrane work and the building will have a fresh new look. The color will be staying the same so you can find us on your next trip. Also we will doing interior painting were some of the bathrooms are peeling from the last contractor using water based paint over oil with out prepping the surface properly.

title: All you need is a swimsuit!
review: Sandpiper is somewhere that you want to stay over and over again. The staff is very helpful and friendly. They are willing to go out of their way to find anything you need. The rooms are VERY clean and completely stocked with everything you need to never leave your room. The grocery store is less then 1/2 a mile away so stock up and stay in. With everything from 2 pools to an all day coffee bar why leave. An extra bonus... THE LOCATION!! You are very few steps away from a beautiful beach! The sunsets are to die for! Not to mention the fact that we saw dolphins on multiple occasions! There really are a ton of things to do so plan on being here for more then a weekend! Bring sunscreen!

title: Great hotel!
review: Thank you for choing the Sandpiper for your vacation. On behalf of the management I appreciate you taking thetime to write Trip Advisor.   Perry Landis Regional Manager Sterling Management

title: Wonderful place, great staff, fun times!
review: This hotel is right on the beach.  We stayed in the Sandpiper II which had the adult pool in front of it.  We had a side room with an island view, but standing on the balcony we could see the ocean and beach.  The room was decorated nicely, with a nice little kitchenette and dining table.  We loved the space the room gave a family of four.  The hotel had two pools, plenty of grills, and lots of beach chairs.  There were chairs by the pools and also by the beach.  We didn't have to rent any.  The only downfall is parking.  When we arrived we were told we might have to park a block down the street because non customers park in their lot.  They do put signs on the cars that don't belong saying they will be towed, but the cars never are.  After the weekend though, parking was not a…

title: Lovely place on the beach
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a comment. On behalf of the management we appreciate you choosing The Sandpiper.   One of the staff members must have misinformed you about parking off site. This should have only been mentioned if you have a second vehicle. There is one parking space per suite. It is true we rarely tow vehicles but the night courtesy agent is supposed to tag them at night. We occassionally have guests who are so caught up in there beach experience that they neglect to put there parking permit in their window. You have should have been instructed to park in the alternate parking area where our tower is located.   My apologies for  any inconvenience you experienced and I am glad it didn't  change your experience at Sandpiper.  Perry Landis Regional Manager

title: Another trip back to our piece of paradise!
review: We wanted to do a nice surprise party weekend for my dad's 70th birthday.  After much research, we all decided that the Sandpiper Resort would suite our needs.  A few phone calls to Darlene and all was set up.  We booked 7 rooms and Darlene was able to get us on the same floor all next to each other.  This worked out beautifully for our entire family.  Check in was fast and easy and the rooms were much nicer than we expected!    The staff was more than accommodating and they went above and beyond in helping us find a place to park our boat and a public ramp to launch it at.  The gas grills were brand new and worked great for our large group.  The rooms were spotless and the towels and other linens were crisp and clean.  The location of the Sandpiper can't be beat!  Close to…

title: This is a jewel on the Gulf
review: My sister and I spent a weekend at the Sandpiper celebrating our birthdays.  Everything about the experience was above and beyond our expectations - accommodations clean, more than adequate, location perfect, attention paid to detail such as decor, cleanliness.  The price was definitely right!  There were two pools - one for adults only.  And the beach was just a few feet away.  The hostess, Darlene, could not have been more helpful and pleasant.  We will definitely make it our annual get-away and plan to extend our stay next year!

title: Another Wonderful/Relaxing Vacation at The Sandpiper
review: Another great vacation at The Sandpiper Gulf Resort (April 15-29th).  This was our third year in a row staying at The Sandpiper and once again, we weren't disappointed.  The staff are very accommodating,  rooms are nice, grounds and pools are well maintained, beach is beautiful and the sunsets are amazing.  Every night we were able to sit on our deck, facing the Gulf of Mexico and watch the most awesome sunsets.  Many of the guests are repeat visitors to The Sandpiper and tend to visit around the same time each year so, it's always nice to see familiar faces.  There are 52 weeks in a year, for 2 of them we are staying at The Sandpiper and for the other 50 we are thinking about it.   It  would be great  to see more Canadians at the resort.  Can't wait to return next year.

title: Great Beach Vacation
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper for 9 nights and loved it.  We were very satisfied with all aspects of our stay.  The staff was very friendly and helpful in any area needed, room was clean, pools and grills were kept in great shape.  WE have already reserved the same room for April 2009.  Thanks for a great vacation!!

title: Enjoyed Sandpiper
review: I have been home a week, and I miss the Sandpiper Gulf Resort!! It is wonderful to sit on the balcony in the morning, and watch the dolphins swim by!   In the evenings you can watch the sun set.  The location is great, and there is even a supermarket near by.The Sandpiper is very clean and the staff is great.  We are planning go going in 2009!     Laura from Pembroke

title: Great Vacation at Sandpiper Gulf
review: Our stay at the Sandpiper Gulf was great! The room was very clean and furniture/appliances new and well maintained. We spent very little time in the room though because the sandy beach on the Gulf of Mexico was beautiful! Although we were there during "Spring Break", this end of the beach did not seem over-crowded. The on-site watersport kiosk made reservations and rentals for parasailing and waverunners easy. The main pool was full of parents and young children and the courtyard rooms provide easy access for the frequent return trips to the room that are necessary with young children. This hotel has whatever you need - no matter the age of your family! I am already planning to return!

title: Very Chill Spot right on the beach!
review: I stayed at the Sandpiper for two nights while in town on business.   The location of the resort made my trip seem more like a vacation.  The staff was very accommodating.    I would recommend staying here, and it's close to everything, and also very affordable!

title: Not Staying Again!!
review: First, I would like to say that my wife has been vacationing at Fort Myers Beach for 15+ years. I have been 3 times and this is by far the worst hotel/efficiency I have stayed at. Upon of arrival and entrance of the room you can’t help but notice how small it is. The next thing we noticed was the size of the refrigerator. It was not a full size like they say. The stove is a two burner camper like unit and there is hardly any counter space at all around the very small kitchen sink. To top it off our fridge did not cool properly. We noticed on the second day that it was very warm inside. After mentioning this to a maintenance worker he checked the temp and it was 57 degrees!! He tried to adjust the thermostat but it never really got anything cold. We were told all week that…

title: Decent Stay
review: We stayed at Sandpiper Gulf Resort March 14 - 17, 2008 during Spring Break.  The place is a decent stay.  Its an older facility, but they have painted it and installed a standing seam metal roof in an attempt to keep it updated.  Pros include the fact it offers a full size frig and small kitchenette in each unit.  No dishwasher and limited counter space.  I question on just how clean and sanitize the dish and glassware are - as most items are washed by hand and the sink water is not overly hot.  The swimming pool was nice and we even played shuffle board for a bit.  A good grocery store - Publix - is near by.  I was impressed with what that grocery store had to offer given its smaller size.  I ended up using the gas grill by the adult pool.  Both grills on the property are used…

title: Sandpiper Gulf Resort - A Wonderful Oasis
review: We have stayed here a couple of times and it is a great place to stay. It is quiet when we go there, the people also staying there are friendly and many are return visitors.  The place is very clean and there location on the beach is fantastic. I love that is farther down Estero, on the quiet part of the island and if you spend a little extra money for a gulf view, you can take in the sunsets, and enjoy the sounds of the ocean when you wake up.  They staff is friendly, the pools are nice, and the rate is affordable in my opinion for what you get.

title: Nice spot
review: We spent three nights at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort. We booked a room overlooking the Gulf on the 2nd floor. The space was more than adequate for us. The kitchen is equipped with the necessities. However, the beds and linens were a bit tired. The pool was lovely and Ft Myers Beach is a treat to walk. The location is closer to the south end of the island so it is quiet. The action/night life is further north near the bridge. Fresh coffee is available outside the office in the morning. Staff were friendly and helpful. There is a Publix just up the road for provisioning. There are laundry facilities on site. A great location - a perfect spot to take the kids.

title: Paradise!
review: Beautiful hotel right on the beach. The ocean view rooms are well worth the extra bucks. The views are breathtaking, especially the spectacular sunsets. The place is *very* clean, you can tell it has been recently remodeled, and staff is super nice and friendly. Really comfortable beds, free wireless internet (although, depending on the room, the signal might be too weak) and fully equipped kitchens. They have two pools, one for adults only, and a jacuzzi but the beach is right there anyway. It is also located on the quiet end of Ft. Myers Beach, so it is perfect to sleep and rest away from the crowds. There is also Publix nearby if one wants to cook. Perfect place for a relaxing getaway!

title: Wonderful All Around
review: We stayed in a beachfront room.  It was right on the beach with wonderful views.  Nice quiet, family atmosphere and the people were great.  Darlene and Vesse are the best!  God bless.

title: Our Best vacation
review: We've stayed at hotels/motels all over southern FL. We feel most at home at the Sandpiper

title: Great experience - have stayed here twice
review: Excellent location. From our beach side efficiency room we could see dolphins. The best things about this place are its quiet location and that we could walk along the beach and find shells and sand dollars.  Although this motel/resort doesn't have a restaurant or bar, we could walk a mile down the beach to bars & restaurants of the Outrigger & Holiday Inn.  As well, one can take a short drive to a variety of eating establishments.  Or use the free trolley service.  A grocery store is not too far away.  Each room is individually owned and the staff at the front desk is supplied by a management company. Staff was friendly and informative. Rooms were clean. Laundry facilities are available on each floor.  There are two pools, one with a jacuzzi. One pool is intended for adults and…

title: Off Season Rates
review: My wife  and I  stayed the month of October. Not only are the off season rates very reasonable, but they also give a generous AAA or AARP discount. What more could you ask for!!!!!

title: home away from home
review: this will be our 5th year at this fantastic family resort. We stay in  one of the beachfront units and have found themto be spotless and the staff to be courteous and helpful. 3 other families meet us each year and we all enjoy the place immensely. great personal family experience

title: Best on the beach
review: My wife and I spent almost 3 week at the Sandpiper the month of October, 2007. We can't find one thing bad to say about the motel.  Everything you need to do is close, yet the motel itself is very quiet and restfull. Staff is great. No problems with housekeeping.  Overall a great vacation and a great place to stay.

title: Great Vacation
review: My family and I stayed at the Sandpiper for two weeks in December.  We loved this hotel.  The room was large and had a little kitchen.  The pool was great.  You can see the ocean from the pool.  The beach is one of the best I have ever been.  I guess the only down side would be the large parties that book many of the rooms at one time.  We were there during a birthday party that lasted two nights.  It got noisy at times but it was all right.  I do believe it is one of the nicest small hotels on the strip. The hotel is located on the quiet end of the island.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a beach getaway.

title: Great place to stay
review: We just wanted to say that we had a great stay at the Sandpiper. We really enjoyed the adult pool feature, Not  that we don't like kids, But this was our little get away without the kids so it was really nice for us. The rooms were clean and newly renovated, the jet ski people were very nice, We really enjoyed the Dolphin tour. The staff also very nice and friendly. Great Vacation!!! Thanks from N.J.

title: loved it
review: I love this place!  I have been there many time in the past, which did not surprise our friends and families that this is where we would get married.  On April 15,2007 we got married in front of the beach as the sun was going down. It was beautiful.  Our experience with the staff regarding our wedding along with our stay, was amazing. From the  manager of the hotel down to house keeping, everyone was great and very helpful..I cant leave out the fact that  this resort is beautiful.  If you are ever in the neigborhood, stop in.. tell them Glendaly the bride sent you..lol

title: a terrific location, beautiful beach
review: stayed for 6 days. weather perfect, beach front was raked every day, chairs set up, pool cleaned.  Room - king bed - was clean, towels were well stocked, employees polite, quiet location.  loved having an "adult pool ".  other guests were all ages, from families with young children to retired folks.  Liked having a refrig and ( brand new ) microwave.......also liked having the Publix close by.  The every-other day housecleaning schedule suited us just fine, and they did a good job.   all in all, we were completely happy with this choice of stay, and would certainly return. My only request, perhaps, is for the hallways to be painted so it doesn't seem as though you are walking through a tired college dorm.  The elevator, however, was sparkling with clean mirrors !  an excellent…

title: Our favorite beach resort
review: We have stayed at the sandpiper during our January vacations for the past two years. It was one of our most favorite vacation destinations. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are very clean and well cared for. We enjoyed the adult pool; it gave us a break from some of the families swimming with their children. The only reason we can no longer stay at the Sandpiper is because they are now a condo resort. The prices just about doubled from when we first stayed there, pricing my wife and I out of this wonderful resort.

title: Resonable price, nice peaceful location
review: This is a remodeled caribbean styled hotel resort. Rooms have full size refrig.  It sure is better than a typical beach motel, at about the same cost. The counters were all granite and it was an great view of the beach and water. There were 2 pools, one was for adults. Courtyard with grills to use for free!  Hot-tub.   If you want to be around all the shops and dining this one is not for you. You would have to drive to that.  It is more settle upon a somewhat quite residential area, very nice setting.   For the price, it is a good value.

title: Watch out for weddings!
review: Our family HAD stayed at this resort for many years--no longer.  We were there over 4th of July weekend--big mistake!  There was a wedding party which just ran rampant, and the management did nothing about it.  Please understand, this is a hotel with no banquet or wedding facilities--just the beach, which the wedding party was allowed to commandeer and pollute.  The managament's response was basically "Too bad, they booked 30 rooms."  Managament was indifferent and hostile at times.  Front desk staff was competent.  Housecleaning is every other day--they are up front about this.  My advice: ask before you reserved a room if there are any large bookings for your stay (but they might not tell you).  I tried to resolve the issue with the BBB, but the Sandpiper doesn't think their…

title: WOrst holiday vacation ever
review: The penthouse accommodation (1 bedroom) was  nice (newly renovated) except the room was in the middle of the courtyard/pool  area above the office. The BBQ grills should have been put at the end (near beach) so that the grill smoke did not seep into the lovely room.   Also, a church group was in over the weekend and took over the entire property. Water balloons and children galore.. The adults were worse than the children. The adults  were inconsiderate of a few of us who booked rooms on our own -  not with the group. Families running around the courtyard until 11pm and kids in the pool during the evening hours during  inclement weather provided a liability to the hotel/resort. Water balloon wars are not my idea of a relaxing vacation. The hotel staff except for one security…

title: Think Twice !!!
review: Well - That was interesting...  They promised a "full kitchen" but it turns out there in only a microwave oven and a 2 burner electric stove & small frig.  Of which one burner was broken.  Luckily after the 3 failed calls to the desk, the pool guy swithed out the bad coil for us.  Also, they really boast about grilling - well only 1 worked and the other you had to light by hand (watch your eye-lashes / poof!) Also, the rooms are really small, maid service is every-other day (basically rationed to one roll od TP for a family of 4 so we got our own).  The door was really sticky so every time you entered / left every one knew it.  Next time it's Captiva for us.

title: Great Value, Clean Hotel
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort in August.  The resort is very clean and the rate was very reasonable.  We stayed in a king suite which had a nice kitchen with a full fridge.  The adults only pool was great and the resort is directly on the beach.  We visited Ft. Myers during the slow season so crowds were not a problem.  The resort is located in the middle of estero island so you are close to all the restaurants and a grocery store is one block away.  Would highly recommend the Sandpiper Guf Resort.  The resort is a great place and extremely economical.

title: Great quiet romantic getaway!
review: I was looking for a place on the beach in Ft Myers Beach and a friend mentioned Sandpiper...it was great!  Right on the beach, two pools (one is for adults only).  The rooms were large and clean and had everything - stove, full size fridge, everything.  Our balcony looked over the pool and we could watch the sunsets.  The beach was beautiful and nearly empty.  This is definitely not one of the party spots, but a nice quiet place to get away for anyone else.   We saw dolphin, barracuda, starfish, horseshoe crabs, all sorts of beautiful shells and sand dollars by the dozens.  We can't wait to go back.

title: Nice family hotel--Great for the price!
review: Just got back from a 3 night weekend visit to the Sandpiper from July 14-17.  Overall, we had a great experience, and here are some notes that might be helpful:  1.  This is a hotel on the south part of the island away from the bars and touristy area downtown.  We enjoyed visiting the pier, restaurants, bars, etc., but preferred to stay in a more quiet area.  If you want to be able to walk to everything, this isn't the place for you. 2.  While the Sandpiper is a great deal for the price, it is more of a hotel/motel than a "resort."  If you want a place where people deliver little umbrella drinks to you while you sit in your chair, this is not the place for you.  We fixed our own drinks in our kitchen and then sat by the pool or beach all day.  I enjoyed being left alone. 3.  All…

title: Great
review: Great,location,Staff and everything. Must recomend it. Exelent Room , Beach.......... Was 5 nights there.

title: Great Beach Getaway
review: We stayed her over Memorial Day weekend and thoroughly enjoyed it!  Two couples and a three year old. Rooms are very close to the beach. The three year old loved the calm, shallow water.  Low tide was great for seeing sand dollars, starfish, hermit crabs, etc. Room was very nice and clean.  Full house this weekend but did not seem overly croweded.  Only one minor problem when we went to use the grills for dinner on Sun. evening we couldn't get either one to work. If it's a holiday weekend have a backup plan for dinner! Very nice spot.  Will definitly return!

title: hated to leave :(
review: What a great SURPRISE! After a day of online searching, I decided on the Sandpiper! So happy I did! The facilities were perfect for a quick getaway! The room was amazing! spacious and  the decor so inviting!  Location is further away from the  crowds.. but close enough! I will go back!!!

title: Exceeded expectations!!!
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper Gulf Resort January 12-18,2006.  We chose this resort based on previous reviews.  The staff were so nice and accommodating.  The rooms were SPOTLESS with new Tommy Bahama style furniture.  The grounds are very well kept.  The pool was very warm and clean.  The beach is beautiful with powdery sand.  You can also rent jet skis on premise.  The sunsets are to die for!  The resort is a great value for being right on the beach.  We will definately stay here again!

title: This place was spotless!
review: We stayed here for 5 nights in December.    Our room was absolutely spotless, looked like all of the appliances were brand new!        Surprised to find a spacious private patio on front of our first floor room right on the beach.    Decorated with 4 lounge chairs and a small table, we spent most of time at the hotel right there!     We saw dolphins swimming right in front!    The beach was also spotless and very popular for walking and bike riding.  The two pools were not only heated, but very warm, which was nice since the air was cool.     This hotel is out of the congested area of Fort Myers Beach and right on the beach.   I would recommend it.

title: Fantastic Beachfront Suites
review: What a wonderful family location right on the beach. All suites are remodeled with all new furnishings.  Sand at your doorstep with beachfront units. Great view and flat beach for running and walking. Pools are very nice and plenty of chairs to go around. Staff, especially Merrit, was great and very accommadating. Maid service was the best ever. I would definitely recommend this place to others. Rates were excellent for beachfront. This will always be our place of choice on Ft. Myers Beach

title: AWESOME!!
review: Just returned from this beautiful place. Beautiful  rooms. Fully equipped kitchen. Just all remodeled. Room 120 is a great poolside location. What a bargain...Staff excellent. Will go back soon.

title: Love this place
review: This hotel has been completely redecorated in the past year and is very nice with hardwood floors and new mattresses and nice colors.  The beach is literally 3 feet away and the sunset and view from your balcony is worth the price of admission.  It is hot in the summer and we always take a fan. The A/C cannot keep us cool enough.  In the cooler months it is pure heaven.  It is on the quiet end of Fort Myers.

title: Loved every minute!
review: We stayed at the Sandpiper in December of 2004.  It was a very wonderful hotel.  Everything about it is great.  The beach is so close from your doorstep.  I was surprised to here that AAA gave it a 2 star rating.  We will stay here again.

title: Wonderful place to stay
review: Stayed at SandPiper with my family for 3 nights the last week of March 2005.   We changed rooms for the last night (only because we waited late to make reservations and it was Easter weekend & Spring Break for many -very busy time at the beach).  Both rooms were beachfront efficiencies on the 2nd floor and couldn't have been nicer - recently renovated, decorated better than my house & very clean.  Rooms were very quiet & relaxing and we enjoyed our deck overlooking the ocean.  Rooms are close to the beach (if considering other hotels, ask how far the hike is to the beach - it can be a long walk from some other Ft Myers "beachfront" hotels).  Although the staff was overwhelmed with the sheer number of guests, they were very professional and courteous.  Traffic getting across the…

title: Great for families!!
review: Stayed here in March of 2005 with my wife and 3 year old. Rooms are recently renovated, stayed in a 3rd floor oceanfront studio ($215 per night), full size fridge, micro-oven, two burner cooktop, two double beds, sofabed, and dining table with four chairs. Balcony has a wonderful view. The hotel is located mid-island so the traffic is not too bad. We were able to make several trips for groceries to the local Publix supermarket which is close by.  The main pool is heated. Kids are only allowed in the main pool. There is no kiddie or toddler pool. The beach is very nice, sand is very fine, but be careful for sharp shell fragments in the sand. Rubber slip on beach socks/shoes are best for navigating the beach. Front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. Towels are available at…

title: Loved it!!!
review: Stayed here March 11-15, 2005. The room was nicely furnished and very clean. We were on the third floor with a nice view of the beach and our own small deck. The kids loved the heated pool (very warm!) and spent much time in it, as well as playing shuffle-board. The only faults I could name are the water pressure in the shower was low (maybe better on lower floors) and it would have been nice to have a reclining chair on our deck. The staff are wonderful and if we return to Ft. Myers Beach we will definately stay here again. One caveat, the traffic here is awful due to there being only one road across the island. Getting to Times Square was very frustrating. All in all though, a very relaxing and enjoyable stay. Do consider this place, it's very economical for a beachfront…

title: Waverunners and Parasailing
review: The Sandpiper was a terrific hotel! We went last summer in July.  Everyone was friendly, good location, lots to do. We went parasailing and were able to go on a dolphin tour by waverunner. This was more fun than anything we did in Florida (including Disney)!!! The water sports rental is right out back and has a website. I think it is ---------------------------. Don't miss out. The tour guides made our trip so memorable- we can't wait to go again.
